texts.en:
Gina P., 27 years old, is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living Gina operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

Gina joined HSPFI in 2009 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Gina is requesting her third loan, for 11000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi A. est une femme de 46 ans qui vit à Atakpamé une ville située à 100 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse de maïs et elle exerce cette activité il y a 18 ans, avec ce crédit, Essi voudrait acheter du maïs dans les fermes pour en faire le stock. Dans les moments de pénurie du maïs Essi souhaiterait vendre son stock pour avoir beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, elle  préférerait prendre soins de sa petite famille et dans l’avenir elle compte vendre à Lomé.
texts.en:
Massi Koumako est une femme de 48 ans qui vit à Atakpamé avec sa famille et ses 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de noix de palme et elle exerce cette activité il y a 20 ans, elle va dans les fermes qui environnent Atakpamé pour se ravitailler. Avec ce crédit, Massi voudrait acheter en gros où le prix du bol de noix de palme est moins cher afin de réalisés beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec les bénéfices réalisés, Massi souhaiterait subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et dans l’avenir elle souhaiterait avoir à Lomé un marché qui lui ferait gagner beaucoup d’argent.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat du maïs pour le stock

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Viriginia M. is a widow who lives in Prk. Santol, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and buy and sell (bananaque) businesses. 

Viriginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Viriginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,700!

This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy more stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and expansion of her business.  Viriginia M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

---------------------------------------
About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This month, Rosalinda Alejado’s business is at its peak because classes have opened and therefore a lot of students and teachers need school uniforms and/or to have their uniforms repaired.  Just recently she has received a bunch of orders. Timely, the loan she is paying through ASHI has ended and now she is qualified to request another loan. Considering the high demand for her products, Rosalinda would like to request a larger loan. 

For Rosalinda’s previous performance in ASHI, she has maintained a 100% rating in terms of repayment, attendance to weekly center meetings and her business. Aside from proving her competence to other people, Rosalinda has also discovered that she has the ability to grow her business and to be responsible in paying a loan she used as an investment in her business. Although she cannot yet say that her business is sustainable, she is positive that someday it will thrive together with her family life.

loans.use: To buy a large volume of cloth and other supplies for making and repairing school uniforms.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
From the town of Cetro Napu, Tudela Mis. Occ., Jovita M. is a 68-year-old married mother of seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jovita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her sixth, of 50000 PHP for the same purpose. Jovita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa N. is a charcoal seller in Takoradi. She is a married woman living with her five dependents. She has not received any formal education. Her husband is a palm wine tapper.  

Adwoa uses her returns from her sales to help her husband in providing the basic needs of her family.  Adwoa will use the loan to purchase additional bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase additional bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli M. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 49 years old. Noli is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Noli raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Noli has been engaged in farming for over eight years. He now owns a tricycle that he uses when free of farming duties. He transports people around his community with his tricycle.

Noli joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noli has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Noli is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds and for motorcycle maintenance. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Noli from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds and for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Kimiyokhon

texts.en:
I. Kimiyokhon is married and has two grown children. For the last decade, she and her husband have made a living by growing vegetables and raising cattle. Last season, the couple managed to raise a bumper crop, and they would like to continue that success this year by planting an even larger crop and raising more cattle. To make this possible, Kimiyokhon and her family are applying for a loan for $1,500. They hope to use the increased income made possible by this loan to improve their standard of living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en:
Amiel is 43 years old and is married with six children. He is well-known in the business of selling a variety of foodstuffs such as beans, maize, etc. He has been in this business for a long time and his business hours are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Amiel needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to hopefully expand his business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs so as to satisfy the demand of his customers. If successful, he will earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better expansion of his business and enable him to continue providing the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as beans, wheat, Irish potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan has been practicing mixed farming for 20 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His farm produces bananas, sugarcane, maize and vegetables, which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to provide for the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenge has been disease and insecurity in the area. 

Nathan is 60 years old. He is married with six children who are all adults. Four of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for his children and establish a business for his family. He hopes to acquire more dairy cows in the future. He is requesting Juhudi to increase its loan sizes.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lubomyr

texts.en:
Lubomyr is married with three children. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Lubomyr breeds pigs. He then butchers them and sells the fresh meat in the local grocery market. Lubomyr’s product is in constant demand: local meat vendors trust him and come to him for fresh supplies of pork. 

Lubomyr started his venture 7 years ago. He had some savings and invested them in purchasing an abandoned stable. Presently, Lubomyr has 1 hired employee and 2 freelancers who come in when additional help is needed. Lubomyr receives about 8,000 Grivnyas in income each month. 

Lubomyr is seeking a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to buy additional swine stock. The business is the main source of income for him and his family. One of Lubomyr’s goals is to generate additional income and savings to be able to buy his own house. With a family of five it’s getting harder and harder to live in a rented house. Lubomyr is willing to work extra hard to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: To buy additional swine stock

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena O., age 46, operates a pedicab transport services business. Elena has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. She is widowed and has eight grown children. She lives in the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 
 
In 2009, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used  to repair her vehicle for better service. Elena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other necessary accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other necessary accessories for her transportation business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Radio Advertisements

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de gallinas y cuyes, ella vende en la forma ambulatoria en cualquier de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los animales y luego los vende. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas y cuyes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the “COMUZONE I” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Alejandrina is 39 years old, married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising chickens and guinea pigs.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor in the markets in the city of Cusco's.  She fattens her animals and, when they are grown, she sells them.  She is requesting this loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

Alejandrina is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Leap

texts.en: Mr. Leap Y. (who we see in the photo above) is 39 years old and married to Mrs. Chenla Say, who is 36 years old. They live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh, have been married since 1993 and have one daughter who works in a garment factory. Leap makes a living by driving a taxi and his wife works in a factory. He is applying for his first loan, for $1,000, to buy land adjacent to a parcel he already owns.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land adjacent to a parcel he already owns

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
José de 31 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y su hija de 9 años de edad, él es empleado de una asociación cooperativa de servicios eléctricos, tiene un año de estar desempeñando el cargo de notificador y motorista.
José en sus actividades debe caminar mucho para poder dar entrega a las notificaciones de los clientes, por lo se ve en la necesidad de comprar una motocicleta para poder realizar el trabajo fácilmente, para realizar esta compra él solicita un préstamo ya que no cuenta con fondos para hacer la adquisición de la motocicleta.
Su objetivo es que a través del préstamo pueda tener la motocicleta que seria una gran ayuda en el desarrollo de sus actividades laborales ya que así estará desempeñando una buena función y trabajando por proveer para su familia lo necesario  y ayudar a su hija en los estudios ya que su sueño es que sea una profesional de éxito.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and resides in San Francisco Gotera, Department of Morazán, with his wife and nine year old daughter. He has been an employee of a electric utility cooperative for a year, working as a messenger and motorcycle driver.

As part of his job, José does a great deal of walking in order to deliver notifications to the customers. He needs to buy a motorcycle in order to perform his work more easily. For this reason, he is requesting a loan because he does not have the funds to acquire a motorcycle.

His goal with this loan is to have a motorcycle since it would be a great help in developing his work activities. This will allow him to function and work properly so that he can provide for his family’s needs and help his daughter with her studies since she dreams of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino Bañico, de 34 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco,  convive con Carmen de 32 años y  fruto de ese gran amor tienen 04 hijos;  juntos viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Santa Rosa departamento de Ayacucho. Marcelino, es el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar  en la chacra, Marcelino es campesino viene trabajando 10 años en sus propias tierras, en su parcela cuenta con variedad de plantaciones como: hojas de coca,  café y cacao, que son plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de la mano ajena y tiene que contratar jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao, café y hojas  de coca. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los  mil nuevos soles solicitados, contratará peones para realizar el desmonte de malezas en su parcela.
texts.en:
Marcelino Bañico, 34, is from Anco.  He lives with Carmen, 32, and the four children who are the fruit of their great love.  They live together in their own house in the Santa Rosa community in Ayacucho department.  Marcelino is his family’s source of support.

From childhood his parents taught him to work the fields.  Marcelino has been a farmer for 10 years on his own lands where he grows a variety of crops like: coca leaf, coffee and cocoa beans which are plants native to the jungle area of the Apurimac River Valley.

During harvest time he needs help from extra hands and has to contract day laborers to advance with the harvest.  What he likes best about his work is harvesting because that’s when he sees the long months of hard work rewarded in the quality of his fruits.  He considers the most difficult part transporting the products from the field to the city of San Francisco which is where the best prices for cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaf are offered.  In the future he’d like to buy more land to increase his crops.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He feels that the contribution will help his work progress much.  He is grateful to the institution for granting the loan.  He will use the requested 1000 new soles to hire laborers to clear weeds from his field.

loans.use: To hire laborers to remove weeds from his field.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: La Sra. Marianela de 25 años de edad casada hace más de dos  años y medio con el Sr. Alexander tiene un hijo, viven en casa propia en el en la localidad de el Torno. La clienta tiene su vehículo el cual lo da a trabajar para taxi y ella percibe una renta diaria que le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, la Sra.  Marianela trabaja como, secretaria  lleva ya con eta actividad varios años,  El crédito que solicito la Sra. Marianela es para la compra de una moto. La clienta expreso su agradecimiento a la Institución por  la rapidez que fueron atendidos y el buen trato que se le dio.
texts.en:
Marianela, 25, has been married to Alexander for more than two and a half years; she has a son.  They live in a house of their own in El Torno.  She owns a vehicle that she leases out to provide taxi services; she is paid a daily rental fee that helps her meet household expenses. Marianela has been employed as a Secretary for several years.

The loan Marianela asked for is to buy a motorcycle.  She expressed her gratitude to the Institution for the speed with which she was taken care of and for the good way she was treated.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ngvon

texts.en:
Ngvon S. is a 36-year-old rice farmer who lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a leader in the construction field. They are blessed with three children who are studying in the local school. 

Ngvon S. says that her husband lacks some money to purchase more construction materials for his construction business. Ngvon S. doesn’t have enough money to assist him in his business. To overcome this problem, she has decided to request a loan from Kiva to buy equipment for her husband to improve his construction business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her husband's construction business.

loans.name: Elvia María Del Rosario

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Creciendo Para El Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el sector conocido como Parque Forestal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce porque en él hay un bello parque, además por su exuberante vegetación y por sus bellos paisajes.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Elvia, ella  tiene 45 años  de edad y es madre soltera de  tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y una jovencita de 13 años, dos de sus hijos viven con ella uno estudia en universidad y la menor en colegio. Lleva en el Banco Comunal dos años y le gusta el grupo de compañeras.

Tiene un pequeño restaurante donde prepara comida, bocadillos y otros productos elaborados. Trabaja todas las tardes desde  las 17h00  hasta las 22h00, solo vende meriendas ya que le deja mejores ganancias y también aprovecha que su hija le puede ayudar a esa hora ya que ella estudia de mañana. Nos cuenta que lleva 4 años con su negocio y que le va muy bien, esta muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que le han dado.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es darles una muy buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Creciendo para el Futuro' (Growing for the Future) community bank meets in a sector known as 'Parque Forestal', in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its beautiful park and also for its lush vegetation and beautiful landscape. 

Here we meet Elvia who is 45 years old and a single mother with three children.  Two of her children are already grown up and she also has a 13 year-old daughter.  Two of her children live with her.  One is studying at university and the youngest is in school.  Elvia has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes her fellow group members.

Elvia has a small restaurant where she prepares meals, sandwiches and other products.  She works every evening from 5.00pm to 10.00pm.  She only sells evening meals since they make her the best profits.  She also takes advantage of the fact that her daughter can help her at this time of day since she studies in the morning.  Elvia tells us that she has been in her business for 4 years.  It is doing very well and she is very grateful to Fundación Espoir for the help that they have given her.

Elvia will use this loan to buy products for making her meals.  Her dream is to provide her daughters with a very good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing meals

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos Q.habita en su propia casa con dos de sus nietos en Lourdes Colon, Departamento  de La Libertad. Desde hace 10 años  Doña Santos  mantiene una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación, en donde ofrece variedad de artículos como: papel, detergente, sal, azúcar, pan dulce, golosinas entre otros. Ha trabajado duramente para lograr mantener activa su pequeña tiendita que durante mucho tiempo ha sido y sigue siendo su fuente de ingresos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para  poder comprar una mayor variedad de productos tales como: café, leche, azúcar, arroz, galletas y de más productos que le permitan  atraer una mayor cantidad de clientes que le generen mayores ingresos para aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santos Q.lives in her own home with two of her grandchildren in Lourdes Colon, in La Libertad department.  For 10 years, Santos has had a small store in her home where she offers a variety of products such as paper, detergent, salt, sugar, sweet bread, candies, etc.  She has worked hard to keep her small store going as it has been her source of income for a long time and continues to be so.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan so that she can buy a larger variety of products such as coffee, milk, sugar, rice, cookies, and other products that will allow her to attract a larger number of customers.  This will make her more income and she will be able to aspire to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy paper, detergent, salt, sugar, sweet bread, candies, etc.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Mrs. Ren was born in 1953. She is a widow with two children who are seamstresses in garment factories. She is a pork seller in her village, earning some profit to support her family. Besides this, she is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice for her own family. Currently, she wants to start a new business, but she does not have enough money to support it. So, for this purpose, Mrs. Ren is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una madre D. familia D. 54 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia que no cuenta con ningún servicio, ubicado en el caserío Guaraguaos a unos 10 minutos del distrito D. TambogranD., que se encuentra a  una hora D. distancia del departamento D. Piura.  Los pobladores D. esta zona se dedica a  la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Francisca  se dedica a la crianza, y venta  D. animales (ovejas, gallinas y  pavos), desD. hace 8 años, su corral lo tiene a unos minutos D. su casa. A sus animales los alimenta con comida  balanceada y una vez que llegan a su tamaño y peso ideal los venD. en el mercado del distrito D. TambogranD. o también  ha otros comerciantes. Sus ventas incrementará sus ingresos para cubrir todos sus gastos diarios.  Su esposo trabaja en las tierras D. cultivo D. otras personas para que tengan otro ingreso económico.

A solicitado  Francisca un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar  alimentos balanceados y  para la ampliación D. sus corrales por haber aumentado la cantidad D. sus animales.  La venta lo realizará  una vez que éstos  hayan alcanzado su desarrollo óptimo y pueda ofertarlos a los distintos comerciates aun buen precio.

Francisca  es una persona muy conocida en su caserío por sus ansias D. superación cada día y el tratar siempre que con su trabajo su familia se supere y mejore su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 54 year-old mother.  She lives with her husband and children in her own home which doesn't have any basic services.  Her home is located in the small village of Guaraguaos, ten minutes from TambogranD. district and one hour from Piura department.  The residents of this area work in agriculture and livestock raising.

Francisca raises and sells animals (sheep, hens and turkeys).  She has been doing this for eight years.  Her animal pens are located a few minutes from her home.  She feeds her animals with balanced animal feed and, once they have reached an ideal size and weight, she sells them in TambogranD. district market or to other salespeople.  Her sales cover her daily expenses.  Francisca's husband works on other people's land so that they have another source of income.

Francisca has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced animal feed and expand her pens as her number of animals has increased.  She will sell her animals once they have reached an optimum level of development and she will be able to sell them to different salespeople for a good price.

Francisca is very well known in her village for the fact that she is keen to improve herself every day and is always trying, through her work, to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and to expand her animal pens

loans.name: Andrey

texts.es:
Andrey, tiene la edad de 26 años, está Casado y vive con su hijo y su esposa. El pretende con el crédito comprar una moto para trasladarse al tabajo. El tiene un trabajo fijo como guarda de seguridad privada por las noches, por el horario que maneja, también puede trabajar ratos en construcción, lo que la moto le economiza mucho tiempo para trasladarse de un lugar a otro y a su casa. 

Andrey  quiere crecer en lo económico  y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y su esposa. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibide de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Andrey, age 26, is married and lives with his wife and son.  He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation to his workplace.  He works as a private security guard at night and when his schedule permit, he also is active in the construction sector.  The motorcycle will help him save time getting from one place to another or home. 

Andrey wants to grow economically and give his wife and son the best quality of life.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never taken out any state bank loans, and FUDECOSUR is giving him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita es una cliente antigua y anteriormente trabajo con kiva, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de sombreros, y también acomoda mantas de vicuña, ella vive con sus hijos de los cuales tres son personas independientes, la última hija se encuentra en colegio aún, con el esposo hace dos años que se separó, este fue un golpe duro para ella pero salió adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos, siendo ella la que sostiene y dirige el hogar, La Sra.  Benita solicita los créditos para comprar sombreros y acomodar por la zona  para la fiesta del gran poder en esta ocasión, ya que ella tiene pedidos en todas las fiestas de la zona, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benita is a long-standing customer who has worked with Kiva before.  She buys and sells hats for a living and also sells alpaca wool blankets.  She lives with her children, three of whom are independent.  The youngest daughter is still in school.  She separated from her husband two years ago, which was a hard time for her, but was able to get ahead for the sake of her children, since she is the one who supports and manages the household.

Mrs. Benita is requesting a loan to buy hats and blankets for the local religious festivities.  She already has orders for all the festivities.  She is a responsible, hard-working woman who is grateful to the institution for the support received.

loans.use: To buy hats.

loans.name: Mariane

texts.en:
Mariane is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. She has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy eggs, snacks, biscuits & bread.

Mariane has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Mariane hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy eggs, snacks, biscuits & bread.

loans.name: Julio Roberto

texts.es: Julio Roberto de 54 años de edad, habita en su casa con su hija que ya es mayor de edad y se dedica al comercio. Julio es un hombre emprendedor, durante mucho tiempo ha trabaja para sacar adelante a su hija y poder gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Él se dedica a los negocios, hace 29 años que logro establecer un pequeño negocio en el mercado central del lugar donde él habita, dicho negocio se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida por los habitantes del lugar  y en especial el negocio de Julio el cual ofrece variedad de productos como: pastas de zapatos, cremas para el cabello, pega, cepillos, etc. Muchas personas lo prefieren ya que se encuentra en una zona muy accesible y además es un hombre  muy amable que se gana a sus clientes con su carisma. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio y poder comprar variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y así poder atraer  a nuevos demandantes de sus productos que le permitan aumentar  su nivel de ingreso.  Con el crédito comprará más artículos necesarios y demandados por los clientes como: Hilos, agujas, cremas para el cabello, pega, pasta, encendedores, y muchos otros productos que los clientes solicitan con frecuencia. De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julio Roberto is 54 years old. He lives in the home of his grown daughter, and he works in retail trade. Julio is an enterprising man, and he has worked for many years to help his daughter get ahead and to enjoy a better quality of life. He is a businessman, and 29 years ago he was able to establish a small business in the central market of the town where he lives. This business is located in an area that is very well-traveled by the local inhabitants. They especially visit Julio's business, which offers a variety of products such as shoe polish, hair creams, glue, brushes, etc. Many people prefer his business because it is in a highly accessible place, and in addition, Julio is a very likable man who wins over customers with his charisma. He is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business by purchasing a variety of products to offer to his customers, so that he can attract new buyers and thus increase his income. With the loan, he will buy more items that are needed and sought after by his customers, such as thread, needles, hair creams, glue, paste, and lighters, along with many other products that his customers often request. In this way, he hopes to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, hair creams, glue, paste, lighters, etc.

loans.name: Amalia Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Amalia, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo mayor de edad él cual ya cuenta con su propia familia; Amalia se dedica hace 2 años a la venta de caña de azúcar en su triciclo por las calles de Camaná. El desafío que enfrenta Amalia es el tiempo ya q vive sola, sin la compañía de su hijo, y por ello que tiene que levantarse desde muy temprano para poder pelar, cortar y embolsar su mercadería. Amalia invertirá el dinero para la compra de mas mercadería en la ciudad de Tambo (Productora de Caña de Azúcar), ya que allí es mucho más barato el producto; el sueño de Amalia es poder establecerse en un puesto del mercado y así ver crecer su negocio, Amalia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora y está muy agradecida por la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en:
Señora Amalia is a single mother with a grown son who already has his own family.  For two years, Amalia has been selling sugar cane on her tricycle through the streets of Camana. The challenge that Amalia faces is time.  She lives alone, unaccompanied by her son; this is why she has to get up very early to peel, cut and bag her merchandise. 

Amalia will invest the money to buy more merchandise in the town of Tambo (Sugar Cane Production), since the product is much cheaper there.  Amalia's dream is to settle herself in a stall at the market and so grow her business.  

Amalia is a striving and enterprising woman, and is grateful for the trust being placed in her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and so grow her sales.

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Morita has a food shop that serves & sells dishes, like escabeche (marinated, seared fish) & afritada (chicken/pork with tomato sauce). She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making dishes to sell.

Morita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Morita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making dishes to sell.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa has been in active farming for 4 years producing and selling milk and eggs which she sells to the local markets in her hometown of Eldoret in North Rift, Kenya. She is married with one child, aged 9. She runs a retail shop for household goods and cereals.

She has made a loan request amounting to 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her construct a dairy unit and start a poultry farm by buying poultry birds. She says the two businesses will help her in paying for the education of her child and payment of the loan. She is optimistic that with time she will be able to make supplies of over 10 trays of eggs in a day.

Melisa laments the high costs for management of animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
The Sarwa Wiguna group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of Rp 15,000,000 and each member will receive Rp 1,500,000.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement the family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising. This is their third loan with MUK.

Ni Ketut, is the head of the Sarwa Wiguna group.  Ni Ketut would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to save for her children's college fees.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Lely Del Carmen

texts.es: Lely, originaria de la ciudad de León, tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos , ella  es comerciante, dueña de una pulpería. Empezó su negocio a los 38 años este ha sido su segundo negocio  antes viajaba a Guatemala a comprar mercadería para vender y su familia tenia un negocio de venta de bloques, también trabajo vendiendo granos básicos en un local cerca de la terminal de buses, tuvo que dejar ese local porque su hijo se enfermo y no tenia quien lo cuidara. Así  que toda esta experiencia le sirvió de mucho para poner su pulpería. Realizo el préstamo para comprar un freezer y surtir su mercadería de productos tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, leche, huevos y productos de limpieza. Quiere mantener su negocio de productos que son demandados por sus clientes, y comprar el freezer para vender carnes, pollo, jugos, gaseosas, mantequilla, crema, queso. Su meta próxima es ampliar su pulpería con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Lely, a native of the city of Leon, is 41, married, and has two children. She is a tradeswoman and owns a small grocery store. She began her business when she was 38 and this was her second business. Previously she traveled to Guatemala to buy merchandise to sell and her family had a business selling cement blocks. She also worked selling bulk grains in a place near the bus terminal. She had to leave that place because her son became ill and she had no-one to care for him. Consequently, all of that earlier experience served her well when she started her small grocery store.

She obtained this loan to buy a freezer and merchandise, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, milk, eggs and cleaning products. She wants to keep her business stocked with products in high demand by her customers and to buy a freezer in order to sell beef, chicken, fruit juice, soft drinks, butter, cream and cheese. Her next goal is to expand her grocery store by offering new items.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and re-stock her merchandise with products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, milk, eggs and cleaning products.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is a 43 year old married man.  He lives peacefully in the province of Isabela where he plants rice as the family's primary source of income.  Elmer is a hardworking man.  Apart from farming, Elmer manages his hog raising business, raising pigs for breeding.  His desire is to expand his business premises and grow the business.

Elmer is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which he will use to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.  His previous loan was invested in his business and had a positive impact.  He hopes this loan will help bring him additional income, which will help the entire family.  With this business, he is able to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pig

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 10 years and 18 years. He describes himself as focused. He operates a welding and repair shop. He has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a busy local market and his primary customers are motorbike operators from within the area. He describes his biggest business challenges as expensive spare parts and fluctuating electricity prices. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add spare parts to the shop. His business goal is to own a fleet of motorcycles in the area within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the shop

loans.name: Domenador

texts.en:
Domenador is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in Upper Loboc,Oroquieta City. 
 
Domenador has a fishing business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He is requesting a loan for  5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase materials for fishing. Domenador has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing.

loans.name: Ricardo  Jose

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene la edad de 37 años, con su propio negocio, una vulcanizacion con un año de trabajarla, pues anteriormente, tenia negocio de billar, pero no tenia  ganancias, lo que toma la decision de cambiar totalmente, para lograr recuperar la inversion perdida. Que ahorro en su periodo de trabajo, asi como aporte de la familia.
Es soltero, vive junto con su familia,  lo que aporta al hogar, hoy en dia, esta contento por lograr sus propios ingresos, ya que por años laboro en una joyeria en un mercado de la capital, lo cual viajaba todos los dias, por que vive a cuarenta kilometros de la capital.
Toma la iniciativa de un financiamiento para la instalacion de un baño e inodoro en su cuarto, logrando tener espacio y privacidad para su persona.en donde comprara inodoro, tubos para aguas negra, pegamento, piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, entre otros para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 37, has a business of his own: a tire repair shop that he’s had for a year.  He used to have a pool hall but it wasn’t profitable so he decided to totally change to recuperate the lost investment.  He supported his family with savings he’d earned from work.

He’s single and lives with his family and contributes to the household.  Today, he’s happy to be earning his own income because he worked for years in a jewelry store in a market in the capital that he had to travel 40 kilometers each way daily to get to.

He takes the initiative of a loan to install a bathroom and a toilet in his room to have more space and personal privacy.  He will buy the toilet, sewage pipes, adhesive, stone, sand, cement and metal rods, among others, to start the project.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and install a toilet for more comfort and privacy.

loans.name: Webanania Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Webanania S.H.G Group in Western Kenya! Sophia is the facilitator of Webanania S.H.G group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Sophia takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Sophia had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Sophia was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Sophia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Sophia will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Webanania S.H.G group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Patience

texts.fr:
Patience est une femme âgé(e) de 46 ans. Elle est mariée å un  employé de bureau avec 02 enfants en charge.
Patience travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation généraledepuis 2005. Elle vend seule à ses clients à la maison après avoir acheté les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Patience a requis son troisiéme  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartons de divers savons,des bidons d’huile,de la mayonnaise et autres.
Elle veut voir ses enfants réussir c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Patience is a 46-year-old woman who is married to an office worker. They have two dependent children. She has been selling general food items since 2005. She works alone from her home, and buys her merchandise at the Grand Market of Lomé.

Patience is seeking a third loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise such as boxes of various soaps, jugs of oil, mayonnaise, and more. Her goal is to see her children succeed.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale

loans.name: Mercy Zoraya

texts.es:
Mercy Soraya tiene 40 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo, padres y los hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Mercy se dedica a la agricultura compra de insumos agrícolas, semillas, y además a la venta de gas  hace tres años, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para mejorar los sembríos comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos, con la ayuda del crédito obtendrá mejores beneficios.

El sueño es tener una casan en los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música
texts.en:
Mercy Soraya is 40 years old living in a common law relationship; she has two children.  She lives with her husband, her parents and her children who are 19 and 16 years of age in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “Luchando Juntos” communal bank is located in Recinto Zapotal Nuevo belonging to Ventanas Canton; most of the members carry out commercial activities.

Mercy is a farmer who buys agricultural inputs like seeds, and has also been a gas merchant for the last three years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to improve her crops and purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea and liquids. With help from the loan she’ll obtain better benefits.  Her dream is to own a house and in her free time she enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to improve the harvest and purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea, and liquids

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La señora Águeda  tiene  treinta cuatro años de edad  se dedica a la venta de pollos  y flores es una señora trabajadora llena de energías para  darle lo mejor a sus hijas ya  es viuda.
Ella nos cuenta que desde  hace  dos años se ha dedicado a la venta de pollos  para poder  ayudar  sus hijos y vende flores para tener un dinero extra para cualquier emergencia.
Pidió el préstamo para  la compra  de mas pollos para la venta  le da las gracias a fundación  por ayudar a las personas con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Águeda is 34 years old.  She sells chickens and flowers for a living.  She is a hardworking person who is full of energy to give her daughters the best since she is a widow.

She tells us that she has sold chickens for years to be able to help her children and she sells flowers to have extra money in case of emergency.

She asked for this loan to buy more chickens to sell.  She thanks the Foundation for helping people who want to better themselves.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a food shop or carenderia that sells snacks & meals like caldereta (beef stew), afritada (tomato based stew) & halang-halang (spicy chicken). She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making meals & snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Margarita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making meals & snacks.

loans.name: Sebognan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEBOGNAN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adèle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adèle est âgée de 31ans et vit au Bénin. Adèle a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Adèle est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé, mais qui est à leur charge. Adèle vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Adèle vend depuis sept ans, des poissons frais de façon ambulante. Adèle s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adèle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEBOGNAN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The SEBOGNAN group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood.  This is the first time this group is requesting financial aid from Alide, in order to grow their business.  The representative of the group, named Adele, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Adele is 31 years old and lives in Benin. Adele stopped attending school at the primary level.  She is married to Antoine. The couple have one child who is not yet attending school, but their dependent.  Adele lives with her husband and child. The couple together take care of their household expenses.  In order to cover all their household costs, Adele has been a street vendor of fresh fish for seven years.  Adele stocks in Benin. In pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and income, Adele and the other members of SEBOGNAN group are requesting a first loan from Alide.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is from Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years of age, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marcelina sells her rice harvest at the public market of her town. Marcelina had been in this business for five years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP per month. 

This is the primary source of income of Ms. Marcelina. She came to the GDMPC office and applied for a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of her rice. Marcelina revenue will be reinvested back into the business to double the return and a portion of the profit will be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of her rice.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 60 years old with 5 children. She lives in D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Evangeline is providing a recycling service business to local members to make a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in yams and gari (powdered cassava). She usually sells in Amanfro (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 8 years. Elizabeth is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Elizabeth wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of yams and gari, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty foods. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her to expand and to meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of yams and gari.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes es una señora que trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante, con ayuda de crédito ha mejorado su vivienda la que aun le hace falta algunas partes que mejorar lo que  ha venido realizando con muchos esfuerzos por partes por motivo de que sus ingresos son muy bajos, María Mercedes también se ayuda económicamente con el aporte de sus hijas quienes también trabajan para otro restaurante como meseras, juntas unen sus esfuerzo para sacar adelante la vivienda familiar. Doña María Mercedes solicita el crédito para comprar materiales y continuar con la puesta del techo en la parte del porche, así podrán disfrutar de un nuevo espacio tranquilo y acogedor.

loans.use: María mercedes solicita el crédito para poner el techo del porche de su vivienda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy a dairy cow and add 200 chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Mau

texts.en: Mau is 45, and her husband is 55. They have three children, whose ages are 25, 23, and 21. All of the children stopped going to school when they didn't pass primary school, to help their parents earn money in other provinces. Their income is about $10 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 so that they can expand and supply their soft drinks shop. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To expand the sales of her soft drinks shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his stock of bricks.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya, pictured here in our loan office in Ivano-Frankivsk, has two little daughters, aged 3 and 2. She and her husband, Igor, have a successful children’s clothing sales business at the busy Pyatachok market in Ivano-Frankovsk. Both work together in the business which is the primary source of income for their family. In a typical month they make around 4,000 Ukrainian Ghrivna in profit which equals about $900. Mariya has an education in business and accounting. She had worked for someone else previously, but then decided to become self-employed.

Mariya has requested a loan of $800 to purchase some new items for the business. She’d like to buy a good supply of t-shirts, pants and children’s suits. With profits from their business, Mariya and Igor hope to pay off their apartment and purchase a car. They also have announced that they are expecting an addition to the family with their third child on the way. Nadiya Ukraine is happy to be able to support hard-working, dedicated entrepreneurs like Mariya and Igor. We wish them continued success with their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
LUCRECIA and her husband work selling fruit and vegetables in areas outside the city that have no vendors. They hire a private car to transport their goods. Lucrecia is 35 years old, has 3 children and is part of a group called Santiago 4 along with Dionisia Ruiz Ruiz (artisan) and Adela Velasco Velasco (traditional food sales). Lucrecia will use the loan to purchase a variety of fruit and vegetables, Dionisia: colorful fabrics and thread, and Adela: kitchen utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

LUCRECIA junto con su esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras llevando a los alrededores en donde no hay vendedores. Para transportar su mercancía contratan un carro particular. Ella tiene 35 años, tres hijos, pertenece al grupo llamado Santiago 4 junto con doña Dionisia Ruiz Ruiz (artesana) y doña Adela Velasco Velasco (venta de comida tradicional). Lucrecia comprara un surtido de frutas y verduras, Dionisia en telas e hilos en diversos colores y doña Adela en utensilios de cocina.

loans.use:
FRUIT AND VEGETABLE SALES

VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr:
Born in Djita in the Vo prefecture, Mr. Kokouvi K. is a 25-year-old father of three (3) children. He specializes in growing tomatoes, which are in heavily sought after by the local women. To satisfy the demand, he would like to increase his production by buying plant-care products, which will give him a greater production yield. As he lacks the financial means to do so, he is requesting a loan of $800, which will allow him to buy fertilizer and thus to increase his production yield.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Djita dans la préfecture de Vo, Monsieur K. Kokouvi est âgé de 25 ans et est père de trois (3) enfants. Spécialisé dans la culture de tomates, il est sollicité par beaucoup de bonnes femmes. Pour satisfaire toutes ses demandes, il voudrait augmenter sa production par l’achat des produits phytosanitaire qui lui permettront d’avoir de grands rendements. Par manque de moyens financiers, il vient solliciter $800 qui lui permettra d’acheter de l’engrais afin d’augmenter son rendement.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and plant-care products

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en: Viviane is a 25 years old young woman. Viviane owns a clothing store and she needs to purchase new merchandise for her business. This is the 3rd time Viviane is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. Viviane is an independent and ambitious micro entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Señora Juliana belongs to the communal bank called 'Guadalupe' which is located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 55 years old and a mother of 4 children. Two of them are adults and the other two still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband is a shopkeeper. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up her own business buying and selling wood.

She currently buys and sells wood of different types. She gets up about 5:00 am to go to the many sawmills where she purchases wood and then cuts it and sells it in planks at a higher price.

With this loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase different types of wood such as shihuahuaco, tornillo, moena, lupuna, cachimbo, etc.

Juliana is very happy because she works together with her sons and this gives her a piece of mind. Even though, she has had many difficulties in life, but she always finds ways to move ahead with a lot of hard work and dedication. She's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she's giving her in making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juliana pertenece al banco comunal Guadalupe, ubicado en Jr. 30 de Agosto 203, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años y es madre de 4 hijos, dos son mayores de edad y dos aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de compra y venta de madera. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de madera de todas las especies, se levanta a las 5 a.m. para ir a los diferentes aserraderos y comprar la madera para luego aserrarlos y venderlos en forma de tablones a un mejor precio. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de madera de diferentes especies como shihuahuaco, tornillo, moena, lupuna, cachimbo, etc. Juliana se siente muy feliz porque trabaja junto con sus hijos y eso le da mayor seguridad y tranquilidad y a pesar de las dificultades que se le presentaron en la vida siempre supo salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y además está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos y también por la facilidades que le permiten seguir creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase different types of wood

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
M. Gavhar is 45 years old. She is married with three children. 

Gavhar is selling clothing for kids. Having a trading place in the central market, Gavhar has got lots of clients. She tries to diversify the range of goods. Most of the goods are attractive for clients with average levels of incomes. Gavhar purchases the goods in the neighboring city. And now she is planning to travel in order to purchase clothing for kids for the spring season. For this purpose she requests 500.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. Gavhar has gotten loans from IMON several times and has proved herself as a reliable client. Today she thanks everyone supporting her and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for kids for selling

loans.name: Armando Maculane

texts.pt:
Armando Maculane C. was born in June, 1962. He studied until the 4th grade and had to stop attending school because his family could not afford it. He has 2 brothers and he is the oldest. He married when he was 42 years old and he now has 2 children, the oldest is 12 years old. In 1979 he moved from Inhambe to Maputo in search of a job. He worked with coal and charcoal in the Boane district. In 1980he started to work as a baker in Boane. He worked there for 12 years.

Since 1992 he has been working at the Caminhos de Ferro de Mozambique – Mozambique Rail Road – as a track operator. He was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA by his co-workers. With the loan of 11.000mt Armando plans on buying construction material for his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 3 - Boane Cliente:Armando Maculane C. Actividade: Habitação Valor de credito: 11.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 10/03/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Armando Maculane C. nasceu em inhambane em junho de 1962, estudou ate a 4ª classe e por falta de condições teve que parar de frequentar a escola. Tem 2 irmãos e ele mais velho.Casou se oficialmente aos 42 anos de idade e tem actualmente 2 filhos e o mais velho tem 12 anos de idade. Em 1979 saiu de Inhambane a Maputo a procura de emprego. Trabalhou como carvoeiro no distrito de Boane. Em 1980 começou a trabalhar como padeiro na padaria velhinho em boane, tendo trabalhado 12 anos. De 1992 ate entao encontra se a trabalhar nos (CFM) Caminhos De Ferro De Moçambique como operário da fabrica de travessas de linha ferrea.

Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA graças a converças com colegas do servico. Com emprestimo de 11.000,00MT pretende dar continuidade com a construcao da residencia principal da familia que ainda nao oferece minimas condicoes. A sua prespectiva futura é ter outro credito para aplicar no apetrechamento da casa.

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Šemsa

texts.en:
Šemsa is a 35-year-old married woman from the small village Tojšići, near the town of Kalesija. Her husband is a seasonal construction worker and earns about 600 KM monthly.

Šemsa earns additional money for her family by doing agricultural work and breeding cattle. She intends to buy chickens to fatten and sell in order to expand her agricultural business and earn enough money to support her two children, who go to primary school.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
C. Mehriniso is 55-year-old mother of five children. Her husband is a driver, and they both are loving parents. Mehriniso and her husband are working hard to ensure the future for their children. Mehriniso has her own business for eight years already. She started as the seller of clothing. Gradually she is becoming more involved in this business and is dreaming of opening her own trading place. Now she is selling women's clothes and shoes in the store which is located in the central local market.

Mehriniso is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify the range of goods to satisfy the needs of the clients with the various levels of income. The business is stable, allowing Mehriniso to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. Her children are growing up and their expenses are increasing too. Thus she wants to develop her business. With this purpose Mehriniso requests $1000 for purchasing new summer clothes and shoes for women to sell. The loan will be repaid within 12 months. Mehriniso thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner, as she used to do with her previous loans.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for increasing the stock

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi K. was born December 31st, 1964 in Agoè, a neighborhood of Lomé. She grew up in this neighborhood and had two children but is divorced. In 1998 she opened shop selling basic goods, haberdashery items, and jewelry. In her store “Ets Jesus T’aime,” she welcomes many customers because of the diversity of her merchandise. This is her first time borrowing from WAGES and she is seeking this loan to buy 10 crates of tomatoes, 50 necklaces, and five bolts of poplin fabric.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Ablavi est née le 31 décembre 1964 à Agoè, l’un des quartiers de Lomé. Elle a grandi dans ce quartier et a eu deux enfants mais est divorcée. Depuis 1998, elle a ouvert un établissement de vente des produits de premières nécessités, de mercerie et de bijoux. Dans son magasin « ETS JESUS T’AIME » elle accueille beaucoup de clients compte tenue de la diversité de ses marchandises. Elle est à son premier crédit auprès de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de boîtes de tomates, 50 colliers et 5 rouleaux de popeline.

loans.use: Retail of basic goods, haberdashery items and jewelry

loans.name: Foday's Group

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs are Foday S., Patrick M. M., Musa C., Bai K., and Mohamed S.. They are working with the military in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 4,100,000.00. The various members of the group will invest this loan in different types of businesses, agriculture, or invest on some developmental programme like buying a plot of land.

Foday, who is the leader of this group, is 26. He was born in Kailahun, Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married with 3 children. His wife will use the loan to invest it in her current business. She sells fish, rice, and palm-oil. She has been in this business for 5 years now. In this way, the family`s livelihood will improve as Mr Foday`s wife will now be able to earn more money to support the family.

loans.use: Buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia is 25 years old. She finished primary school completely. She lives with her partner, and is the mother of one 7 year old son. She lives in Jr. 28 de Julio s/n – Mazocruz.

She has been a member of the Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz since the year 2001, the date she started working in her restaurant. She thinks it has been two years since she began selling alpaca meat and sheep weekly on Wednesdays and Fridays, delivering 30 or 40 beheaded ones to the middlemen in the city of Tacna.

With this loan of S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy 1 sack of potatoes, 5 bags of rice, 1 bundle of carrots, and other things for her restaurant. She will also buy 5 head of alpaca for her sales in meat.

Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Ilave and to have her restaurant. She is very dedicated to making her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Aurelia tiene 25 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente, madre de un niño de siete años, vive en el Jr. 28 de Julio s/n – Mazocruz. Es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, desde el año 2001, a la fecha viene trabajando en su restaurante, a su vez hace dos años inició con la venta de carne de alpaca, ovino entregando los miércoles y viernes semanalmente de 30 a 40 degollados a los intermediarios de la ciudad de Tacna. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas comprará 01 saco de papa, 05 bolsas de arroz, 01 arroba de zanahoria y otros para su restaurante, a su vez comprará 05 cabezas de alpaca para su venta en carne. Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave y poner su restaurante, ella está muy decidida a concretar su sueño.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and livestock (alpacas).

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is 30 years old, married with four children aged between 11 and 2 years. She has been a bricks seller since 2002. She works every day from 6.30am to 6.30pm at her business.

Zena is now looking for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Omega

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Omega P. N. from Kyela. Married with a one-year-old child, she is responsible for supporting one dependent whose parents died of HIV. Omega has been running a tailoring business making dresses and trousers and selling clothes since 2005. Assisted by her husband, she works 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about $120 each month from her business.

Omega is requesting a loan of $450 in order to buy material in bulk to make clothes. In the future, she plans to enlarge her business. Omega thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothing material in bulk.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric B. D. sells wedding accessories and general goods including shoes and clothing. Eric has received a senior high school education.  He is married and has 3 children, and his wife is a trader. Eric has been selling wedding accessories and general goods since 1996. He is responsible for paying the utility bills, clothing expenses and the children's school fees. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him increase the stock of goods, especially fabric and shoes for resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in his children's education and also pay for other family expenses.

loans.use: Increase the stock of goods, especially fabric and shoes, for resale.

loans.name: Nezikokolima Group

texts.en:
Yeko is Chairman of the Nezikokolima Group in Nkokonjeru, a rural agricultural village in the Mukono region of southeastern Uganda. She is married, 45 years old, and has six children, ages 6 to 22. Yeko also takes care of two grandchildren and her husband’s second wife’s daughter. 

Yeko is a light-hearted and clever purveyor of fresh fruits and matoke, a traditional local dish made from bananas.  She uses her loans from Pearl Microfinance to purchase passion fruit, sweet bananas and sweet potatos from local farmers in her village, and she sells them and the matoke in the Lugazi Food Market, seven miles away, every Tuesday and Wednesday. On a good day, Yeko will make a 20,000 Ush profit for her efforts. She invests her profits in coffee. She buys 200 kilos of whole coffee beans for 1,000 Ush per kilo, then dries, roasts and packages them for sale to a variety of retail food stores and markets in and near her village. Yeko’s husband, a home builder, spends most of his time with his other wife and does not contribute any of his income to supporting his primary family. Yeko depends on the income from her food businesses to keep her children in school and pay for living costs.

Other members of her loan group are in similar situations.

loans.use: Purchase passion fruit, sweet bananas and sweet potatos from local farmers in her village.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente y la apoya en lo posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas al por menor dentro de su vivienda, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, y la complementa con la venta de comida (parrilladas y ceviches) los sábados y domingos, ya que son los días cuando hay más demanda. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera muchos ingresos, los   cuales fortalecen la economía de su hogar y como cuenta con una fiel clientela, le va bien hasta el momento. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita construirá un local adecuado para vender sus bebidas y comida, como también para brindar a sus clientes una mejora atención.
texts.en:
Laura is 58 years old and lives with her husband, who is a shop assistant and helps her where possible. She sells drinks on a retail basis in front of her house. This is an activity she has undertaken for the last two years, and complements with the sale of food (barbecue and ceviche) on Saturdays and Sundays, as these are the days on which there's most demand. What she likes most about her work is the extra income that it generates, which strengthen her family budget, and because she can count on a faithful clientèle, it has all gone well up until now. This is her sixth loan with MFP. With the money she is asking for, she will construct an adequate site to sell drinks and food, in order to provide her customers with a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a site for her business

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina ha sido padre y madre para sus dos hijos. Uno de ellos ya es independiente, por ahora solo se encarga de su menor hija.  Anteriormente ella se encargaba de vender ceviches los fines de semana con la ayuda de su hija. Una vez que ella creció tuvo que dedicarse por entero a sus estudios por lo que Justina pensó en cambiar de negocio. 

Es así que hace unos años abrió una bodega donde vende dulces, gaseosas y cervezas. Como el local de su tienda es grande, por las tardes se convierte en una fuente de soda donde recibe la visita de más clientes. 

Gracias a su trabajo no solo ha podido educar y mantener a sus hijos, también ha podido mejorar la fachada de su tienda y ha podido ponerle piso también. Justina quisiera abrir un restaurante en su casa más adelante, para poder trabajar solo en las tardes y dedicarse a su hogar por el día.
texts.en:
Justina has been both father and mother for her two children. One of them is now independent and she is now only responsible for her younger daughter. In the past, she would sell ceviche on the weekends with the help of her daughter. Once she grew up, however, her daughter had to wholly devote herself to her studies. For this reason, Justina decided to switch businesses.

A few years ago, she opened a grocery store, where she sold sweets, sodas and beer. Because her store premises is large, in the afternoons she turns the store into a soda fountain where she can serve more clients.

Thanks to her business, she has not only been able to educate and care for her children, but also improve the store facade and add flooring. In the future, Justina would like to open a restaurant in her house, so she can work only in the afternoons and take care of her home during the day.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store merchandise

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía se dedica a su negocio desde hace cuatro años. Anteriormente trabajó de cocinera durante ocho años, pero prefirió empezar su proprio comercio.  Ella cría y vende cuyes desde su casa. Sin embargo, recién la semana pasada, empezó también con un puestito de ceviche cerca del mercado de San Martín de Porres. Lo pidió prestado a una amiga para ver si en este negocio había más salida que en la venta de cuyes.
Hasta ahora lleva tres años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO.
