No obstante, a sus edad, cuarenta y nueve años, aún no tiene muchos planes por el futuro ya que por ahora todavía llega a cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la familia, con la ayuda de su esposo. Lucía tiene dos hijos, un joven casi mayor de edad, y una niña.
texts.en:
Since four years ago, Lucia has had her own business. Before that, she was a cook for eight years, but she preferred to start her own business. She breeds and sells guinea pigs from home.

Yet, just last week, she set a little stall of sea food near "San Martin de Porres" market. She borrowed the money from a friend to see if this new business was more profitable than the guinea pigs selling. She's used EDAPROSPO loans for three years, so far. Nevertheless, she is 40 and has not many plans for the future, because she still takes care of the house and family expenses, with her husband's help. Lucia has two children, an almost adult young man, and a girl.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: food for guinea pigs breeding

loans.name: Enea

texts.en:
Enea S. is a married woman with four children (ages 25, 23, 20, and 17). She also cares one other dependant. She owns and operates a poultry business in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She is a member of the Frelimo B loan group (Group code 2028). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $200, and she works for 12 hours at her business on a daily basis.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more feed for her poultry. In particular, she hopes that this loan will enable her to: generate an increase in her profits; expand her business; provide more food for her family; and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional feed for her poultry

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah E. is 45 years old and is married. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are in school and the others are working. She lives in Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Her husband is a crop farmer and has been very supportive of her. Life, she says, has not been as easy for her as she had expected, but she hopes and trusts in God that her dream of becoming well to do will come to pass. Hannah is very hardworking and dedicated to the upbringing of her children. She sells sweet potatoes and lemons, and it is from the proceeds of her business that she has managed to support her family. Hannah has mounted a stand by the major road side of Cape Coast where she sells her products. She takes delivery of stock from the surrounding farming communities and has been in business for twenty years now. She needs a loan to buy more sweet potatoes and lemons so that she can meet the demand from her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance. She hopes to receive GHS800, which would help her grow her business by restocking its inventory. This would enable her to save more money so she can help her husband take care of their children's educational needs. Hannah belongs to a group called ‘Gina Pin Tin’ which means 'stand firm'.

loans.use: To buy bunches of potatoes and lemons.

loans.name: Och's Group

texts.en:
There are three women requesting this small loan, all residents of the province of Siem Reap. The members have selected Mrs. Och O., 43, to be the group leader. Mrs. O. is a widowed mother who takes care of six children who are single; one of them, a daughter, is employed as a building worker and the others are still studying in the local public school.

O. currently earns a living as a rice trader. She usually orders rice from farmers to stock in her home to resell later to gain income. Because the mature rice seasO. is coming and the rice is now commanding low prices, she is proposing to buy rice to store for sale. Therefore, she decided to seek a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to be used to make that possible.

The other two borrowers are: T., a widowed villager raising pigs for sale, is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for raising, and L., who sells vegetables in the market and applies for a loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy rice to store for sale

loans.name: Monchita

texts.en:
Monchita A. is a consistent, very good member of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a Kiva partner. She is a 60-year-old woman who is married to Salvador A., a jeepney driver. She has four children: two sons and two daughters. The eldest daughter, Iramae, is a 31-year-old high school graduate. The youngest son, Nermie, is a 21-year-old high school graduate. All four of her children are dependent and still at her side as they don’t have families of their own yet.

Before, Monchita raised hogs as her primary source of income. But because the price of feed pumped up, she opted to shift the direction of her business. Now on her fourth loan cycle, she proposes the amount of 20,000 pesos as capital to her planned business. The amount will be spent to pay for 67 sacks of rice for retail sale. She is positive that the business will grow fast since right after the harvest, farmers automatically sell rice. With that, the in-and–out of the money would be fast and it could bring them good proceeds to sustain their family needs.

Her greatest dream is to support the schooling needs of her grandchildren someday, since she was not able to send her children to college. And someday, will have her own space in the market.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice for retail

loans.name: Muhammad Tamim Group

texts.en: This is the M. Tamim group, led by M. Tamim. There are three members of this group. M.  Tamim and Zheuduin are seeking loans for their general stores. Bebe Del Jan has a tailoring business. They all hope to expand their businesses with this loan of 30000 Afghani, and are happy to apply for a loan that helps support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Shahanie

texts.en:
Shahanie is engaged in a general store business and is asking to borrow PHP 7,000 from the lenders. She considers the amount to be a big help towards the development of her business. She has also managed a livestock business (hog raising) for already five years. She is hoping that, through the amount she expects to obtain, she will someday be able to expand her business into a bigger one so that she will be able to increase her daily income.

Shahanie is now 31 years of age and is married to Jerry S., a construction worker in their town. They are blessed with three children namely: Jerric - 12 years old; Joanna Camille - 10 years old; and their youngest, Sherry Mae - 5 years old. Shahanie wants a better life for her children and is thus doing her best to become successful in her chosen livelihood project.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 40 years old. She is married with four children. Currently, two of her children are in school. She is a trader who trades in used curtains and bedspreads.  Used curtains and bed sheets are patronized by many people since new curtains and bedspreads are expensive, and with this, Elizabeth has many customers. However, with a small capital, she can barely sell enough to make more profit. She wants the loan to buy more bales of used curtains and bedspreads in different styles and colors to meet the desire of her customers and increase the income for her family.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette femme est  veuve et mère de 06 enfants. Pour subvenir convenablement aux charges de ses enfants, elle a entamé le commerce de céréales. Une partie de son stock étant épuisée, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 4 sacs de maïs, 3 calebasses d’ignames et divers.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow and the mother of six children. To support the needs of her children, she has started a business selling cereals. One part of her stock has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 4 sacks of corn and 3 calabashes of yams and a variety of other items.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains/ cereals and various other items

loans.name: Josephin

texts.en:
Josephin V. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 42 years old. Josephin is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Josephin owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephin is just starting this business.

In 2000, Josephin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josephin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Josephin from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
La señora  ALCIRA L. V., tiene 60 años, vive en el distrito de Larco , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MANATIAL DE VIDA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , tiene 4 hijos y ninguno depende economicamente de ella.
ALCIRA se dedica a la preparación y venta de chocotejas (chocolates), los cuales reparte en diferentes bodegas, tiendas, clínicas, oficinas, y hospitales
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos como: chocolate en barra, mantequilla, colorantes, pasas, guindones, manjar blanco, pecanas, moldes, etc
Este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos para elaborar sus  chocolates (chocolate, manjar blanco, pecanas, etc.).
Paralelamente se dedica a la preparación y ventas de tamales (comida criolla) en un local que tiene su esposo en sociedad con su cuñado (en el centro de Trujillo) .
ALCIRA sueña con  tener un restaurante que le permita tener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: compra de productos para elaborar sus  chocolates.

loans.name: Afi Mawuli

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits de mercerie dans le quartier d’Avénou à Lomé. Elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce en 2008 parce que la plupart des tailleurs et couturières du quartier étaient obligés de parcourir de longues distances, en se rendant au Grand Marché, avant de pouvoir s’approvisionner. Actuellement elle reçoit les demandes de tous ces tailleurs, ce qui lui permet donc de réaliser de bonnes affaires. Cette activité lui permet aussi d’apporter sa contribution financière  à son mari pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs 02 enfants. C’est pour renouveler son stock en état d’épuisement qu’elle sollicite une crédit de WAGES pour commander des fils de surfilages, des fils à plinthes, des tissus de bonne qualité et des bazins de différents motifs.
texts.en:
This is a lady who opened a store for selling sewing supplies in her district of Avénou in Lomé.  She got started in this commerce in 2008 because most tailors and seamstresses in the area were compelled to go far, all over the place at the Grand Market, in order to supply themselves.  Right now, she's receiving orders from all the tailors, which therefore allows her to do a good business.  Her work also enables her bring to her husband her financial share of educating their two children.  To renew her presently exhausted inventory, she's requesting a WAGES loan to order some overcasting thread, sewing machine thread, and some good-quality cloth and damask fabrics of different motifs.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta C. is from the village of Minang. She is 65 years old. Marietta is married and has 1 adult-aged child. Marietta owns & operates a business running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2006, Marietta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Marietta is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Marietta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 57 años, es viuda, tiene 7 hijos y vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Tras la muerte de su esposo, añadió a su labor diaria de pastear sus vacas y carneros el cultivo de papas y arvejas como lo hacía su esposo. Ahora Elsa, en compañía de sus dos menores hijos, se dedican a la siembra y cosecha de sus productos, los cuales comercializa en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad. Terminada tal labor, retoma la atención y el cuidado de sus animales, ya que  Elsa, como mujer precavida no se confía sólo de la agricultura, por ello trata de mantener sus dos actividades, aunque lo que más le gusta es pastar sus animales porque le es rentable todo el tiempo, mientras que son sus cultivos ve las ganancias después de la cosecha.
Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y en sus anteriores créditos nunca ha dejado de pagar alguna cuota pese que tuvo dificultades tras la muerte de su esposo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Elsa is 57 years old, is widowed, and has 7 children. She lives with two of them in her own home. After the death of her husband she has added to her daily work of grazing her cows and goats, the cultivation of potatoes and peas as her husband used to do. Now Elsa, in the company of her two youngest children, works planting and harvesting her produce which she sells at the whole-sale market in the city. After said work, she goes back to tending and caring for her animals. Because Elsa is a cautious woman, she doesn’t rely completely on agriculture and instead tries to maintain both her endeavors. Even so, she prefers grazing her animals because all of her time is income producing, whereas with crops she sees the profit only after the harvest.

This is her eighth loan with MFP and in her previous loans she has never missed a payment in spite of the fact that she had some difficulties after the death of her husband. The money she is requesting now is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets to construct a bar at the nearby market. Charity is 36 years old and is single with no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by opening a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets to build a bar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Preparation and sale of food items

loans.name: Gudilla

texts.en:
Gudilla S. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 60 years old. Gudilla is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Gudilla owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gudilla has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gudilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gudilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gudilla is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gudilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 1 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 24 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.
Verónica se dedica a la venta de artesanìas y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró los materiales necesarios para hacer las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà lana y bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su negocio y capital propio. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Ms. Veronica has been a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima-Juli Community Bank for the past year. She lives in the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. Ms. Luz is 24 years old and finished high school. She is a single mother and has 1 child. Luz sells crafts for a living. She would like the lenders to know that with the first loan she obtained from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, in the amount of 500 new soles, she bought supplies for craft-making. She has asked for a loan of 600 new soles to buy wool and flannel. She hopes to one day own her own business and be able to finance it on her own. Her favorite thing about Banco Comunal is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY WOOL AND FLANNEL

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eladio G. tiene 52 años, esta casado con la Sra. María tiene 2 hijos mayores que ya no dependen de el ellos ya son profesionales e independientes.
 Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de aproximadamente 8 años,  el comenzó a trabajar en forma independiente gracias a sus ahorro que venía juntando de otros trabajos que realizaba anteriormente. Es decir, que  el negocio fue montado con  las ganancias que  obtenía de las ventas de mercaderías, el cual realizaba en forma ambulante. 
Hoy día don Eladio y la Sra. Maria atienden el negocio; que gracias a sus esfuerzos  esta a nivel de la competencia y con un crecimiento sistemático.
 El Sr. Eladio  tiene casa propia, necesita aumentar sus compras y así consigue descuentos interesantes y en consecuencia logra mayor margen de ganancia en sus ventas.
 El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es através de los créditos, por que le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo, razón por el cual opta por este pedido. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Eladio G. is 52 years old. With his wife Maria, he has two grown children, who are working professionals and independent. His business is about 8 years old. He was able to start working for himself with the help of savings he accumulated from jobs he held previously. That is, his business is the result of earnings derived from his work as a traveling salesman. Today Eladio and Maria run the business, and through their efforts it has experienced regular growth and stands up to the competition. Eladio has his own home. He would like to purchase in larger quantities, to benefit from discounts and thus enjoy a larger profit margin from his sales. He states that the only way to grow is through credit, because it would be hard from him to accumulate operating capital. This is why he is requesting a loan. He is a responsible person, eager to achieve, and he has a cheerful outlook. He is enterprising, and there is no doubt but that he will reach any goals he sets for himself.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pasta products, Yerba mate, rice, sugar, flour, and other commodities

loans.name: Jeanelyn

texts.en: Jeanelyn, 33 years old, is a rice farmer. She also raises pigs in her village. She has been able to earn income from her small farm and piggery which she uses to supply her family with food, clothing and other basic needs. She would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and buy farming necessities. The loan will also help a lot in buying additional piglets and feed.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pigs

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en: Erdenebaatar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a “ger”. His oldest son aged 8 goes to school while his youngest two have not reached school age yet.  Since 2004, he and his wife have made Mongolian traditional shoes which they sell at a local market. At first their working capital was 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). Over the years he gained much experience and established strong customer base. Their products are well known amongst customers by their quality and style. Now their working capital has reached 700,000 tugrugs (~490 USD). With his earnings he was able to buy a car for family use. He says, “I want to expand my business for the future.” Erdenebaatar is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (approx. $350 USD) loan to purchase leather, glue and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase leather, glue and other necessary materials

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Arroyo Porá viviendas surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación . Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de ropas, kiosko, venta de cosméticos, venta de panificados, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de artículos escolares y fotocopias ,venta de golosinas    etc. 
Cada una realiza una actividad independiente así como la señora Vilma quien se dedica a la venta de ropa en un salón que ella instaló después de formar parte del comité de mujeres Kuña Guapa.
Ella abre su negocio desde muy temprano y ofrece sus mercaderías a muy buen precio para todos sus vecinos, el negocio es atendido con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Comenta la señora Vilma que el ingreso del negocio ayuda mucho para os gastos que sustentaba solo su marido por ello, agradece bastante al comité ya que mediante ella se animo a abrir su negocio propio.
texts.en:
This group from the “Barrio Arroyo Porá” apartments grew as a result of making contact with one of the foundation’s constituents. All of the women are involved in productive activities, such as: clothing sales, kiosk (snack) sales, cosmetic sales, sales of baked goods, fruit and vegetable sales, sales of school supplies and photocopy services, sweet treat sales, etc. Each lady runs her own business. Vilma sells clothing in a boutique that she created after becoming part of the Committee for the Women of Kuña Guapa. She opens her business very early and offers good quality merchandise to all of her neighbors. She attends to her business with the help of her children. Vilma tells us that the income from her business helps meet the household expenses that they used to rely solely on her husband’s income for. She appreciates the committee very much. It is because of it that she was inspired to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en: Jennifer F. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Jennifer is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. Jennifer plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nosa

texts.en:
Nosa E. is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a grocery store where she sells various kinds of groceries, foodstuffs and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She has been in the grocery business for a long time and uses her experience in business to attract and retain customers.
Nosa is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. Nosa says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria B. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Victoria is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Victoria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jamiyansuren

texts.en:
Jamiyasuren is 39 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent). One of her children is a university student and one of the others helps with the parents' business. Four of her children are secondary school students. Her husband, Dalhsuren, operates an auto repair service. 

Jamiyasuren operates a cafe. She and her husband both started their businesses in 2005 after they had finished building workspace for both. Over the years, they have steadily expanded their businesses. With their earnings, they have built a house for their family. In addition, they own a micro bus and sometimes transport cargo to earn extra income. Jamiyasuren has temporarily stopped her business during the winter time but will continue operations once the weather begins to warm up. 

The auto repair service has a monthly profit of 250,000 – 500,000 tugrugs (~ $180 - $355 US). Over they years, Jamiyasuren and her husband have built a loyal customer base for both businesses. They are very hardworking people who are trying to make a better life for their family. Jamiyasuren says, “I would like to save money with my business profit in order to invest for my children's education.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase spare machinery and parts, including tires and other necessary materials, for auto repair.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for auto repair

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Santiago is the coordinator of his group Cristo La Solucion (Christ is the Solution), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and three children.

Santiago is excited to be taking his fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business selling medication by purchasing more merchandise to sell in his small pharmacy. He will use the profits to cover the basic needs of his family as well as save towards purchasing a vehicle for the pharmacy so that he can make deliveries and retrieve orders. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase medicine to sell in the pharmacy

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro city. He is 36 years old. Lolito is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lolito owns and operates a service-based business providing motorcycle service to transport passengers between local communities. Lolito has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lolito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve his living situation and engage in business activities. Lolito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to repair a vehicle used by the business. Lolito is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

NOTE: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve and expand motorcycle transport business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maximina Raquel

texts.es: Nuestra socia Maximina Raquel tiene 34 años de edad está casada tiene 2hijos menores de edad a su cargo, se dedica al comercio informal de ropa, pues dio inicio con esfuerzo propio con mucha dedicación, pues siempre eta preocupada por proporcionarle a sus hijos los estudios necesarios.  Invertirá su crédito en surtir su negocio pues tiene que viajar hasta Managua para comprar ropa favorable y surtida por lo que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos. El deseo de ella es seguir trabajando para seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Our partner Maximina Raquel is 34 years old and is married with two young children. She works selling clothing, a business she started with her own hard work and dedication. She started the business because she is very concerned with providing her children with the education they need. She will invest her loan in restocking her business. She has to travel to Managua to buy the clothing because there she gets better prices and more variety. Her hope is to continue working and to be able to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Robila

texts.es: Robila, de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy dedicada y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor de 36 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El cultivo de papa y arveja es la actividad que realiza diariamente Robila. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, eso ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y le resulta muy agotador. Más adelante, desea tener un puesto en el mercado mayorista, para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su grupo comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en estos meses.
texts.en:
Robila, age 36, is a very dedicated and kind mother. She lives in her own house with her 36 year old husband, Víctor, and their five beloved children. Her children are her primary motivation for all of her efforts. Robila farms potatoes and peas everyday. Through much effort she has made her land very productive. This has generated very good quality crops, and they are very much valued in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What she likes most about her work is taking care of her crops. She has been doing this activity for 18 years. The most difficult part is transporting her products to the wholesale market in the city. The sacks that she takes are very heavy, which is exhausting to her. Later, she wishes to have a stand in the wholesale market in order to improve her earnings. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She plans on being very punctual with her payments as she does not want to cause problems in her communal bank. She is very happy in her communal bank. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is requesting to buy pea seeds. This vegetable plant is selling very well in these months.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds

loans.name: William

texts.en: William M. Jr. is from the village of Tablon, Digkilaan, Iligan City. He is 34 years old and is married with three school-aged children. William owns and operates a business providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, William joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating his business

location.town: Tablon, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa J. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 34 years old, single and loves helping her family. Lisa owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

Lisa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lisa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Lisa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce E. produces locally-made soap for sale at Takoradi. Her loan will be used to buy extra ingredients to prepare soap for sale. She hopes to reinvest in her business the new profit she anticipates earning from her sales.

Joyce has been educated up to junior high school level. She is married to a secondhand-clothes seller and has three children. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy extra ingredients to prepare more soap for sale

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity R. is thirty two years old. She is married and they have a daughter aged five years old. Her business is located at a residential area known as Tassia in Nairobi. Charity owns a salon which has been providing hair and beauty services to the local women. Besides the salon, she also runs a general store in which she sell items like sugar, flour, rice, detergents etc. She says that this business is profitable and the only major issue she tries to manage is the lack of trust for employees. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more hair weaves and chemicals to expand her business. She also hopes to use part of the loan to increase the stock for her general store. In future, she hopes to prosper in business. She describes herself as an aggressive business person.

loans.use: To stock of hair products and items for general store like rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en: Elpedio R. Jr.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. He is a 35-year-old single man from the village of Poblacion, Initao, Misamis Oriental. Elpedio has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Elpedio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Elpedio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 44 years old and she is married with eight children.  Jeanne has owned a knitting machine and it is by using this machine that she earns the basic income for her family.  Jeanne has been in this business for about three years and the business hours are from 8 am until late in the evening.

Jeanne needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she expects to buy two additional knitting machines and some other clothing items.  If she gets these two additional knitting machines, she really hopes that her customers will increase as well as her profits.  By getting enough profits, she will continue taking care of her family and keep reinvesting in her business for a better future.

loans.use: two additional knitting machines and some other clothing items

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita P. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Sherlita is widowed and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Sherlita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized store. While not her only means of generating revenue, Sherlita’s main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, and also selling dried fish in the local community.Before shes engaged into a sari sari store business and later shifted to fish vending business.

Sherlita joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in businesrs activities. Sherlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP on Kiva that was her 2nd loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sherlita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase addtional product for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sherlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her retail store.
 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional product for sale

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites A. is from the town of Banga. She is 32 years old. Marites is married and has two children aged 10 and 3. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marites has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Early this year, Marites joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marites is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto forma parte del banco comunal “Con Fuerza y Unión” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó. Él se dedica a la preparación de salsa de ají y condimentos, desde hace 30 años. Vende sus productos en una feria de la ciudad  todos los días de la semana junto a su hija.  
Con este préstamo comprará condimentos. Su meta es terminar de ampliar su casa. 
A Gilberto le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza para seguir con su negocio. Además disfruta mucho el tiempo que pasa en las reuniones de grupo.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de una belleza mágicamente natural.
texts.en:
Gilbert is part of the ‘Con Fuerza y Union’ Communal Bank located in the city of Curicó.

Gilbert has been making chili sauce and condiments for 30 years, which he and his daughter sell every day in a market in the city. Gilbert will use this loan to purchase condiments. His goal is to complete the extension on his house.  Gilbert’s business has benefited a lot from the previous loans he has taken out with Fondo Esperanza, and he also enjoys the time he spends in the group meetings.

Curicó is part of the region of Maule, located in the centre of Chile. It enjoys a mediterranean climate and is considered to be one of the most pleasant climates in the country. Curicó is known for its wine culture and the magical beauty of its natural surrounds.

loans.use: Condiments

loans.name: Altantuul

texts.en:
Altantuul N. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son currently attends a construction college and her younger daughter is in kindergarten. 

Altantuul operates a vegetable business to support her family. She sells a variety of vegetables in Narantuul, the main market in the city. She has been engaged in this trade for 11 years and has gained significant experience and many regular customers. 

She has been planning to expand her business and have her own work place. Altantuul is requesting a 2500000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of vegetables when prices for such produce are cheap.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a front wall on her property.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José Miguel,  es un señor entusiasta muy dedicado a sus labores, tiene 52 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután vive con su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, sembrando maíz y hortalizas, estos cultivos los comercializa y también sirve para consumo familiar.
Él está en proceso de sembrar maíz y hortalizas por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales y realzar una buena siembra, comprando abono y fertilizantes que es lo necesario para llevar a cabo esta actividad.
Don José espera tener una buena producción y comercializarla a buen precio, además de cancelar oportunamente este préstamo.
texts.en:
José Miguel is an enthusiastic man who is very committed to his work.  He is 52 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department, with his wife and children.  He works in agriculture, growing corn and vegetables.  He sells his crops and also uses some for his family's own consumption.

José Miguel is in the process of sowing corn and vegetables and is requesting a loan to buy the materials he needs to ensure a good sowing season.  He would like to buy manure and fertilizers which is what he needs to carry out this activity.  José hopes to grow his crops well and sell them for a good price.  He also hopes to pay off this loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to sow his corn and vegetables

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua K. is a 46 years old man who is married to Miriam Chemjor, a housewife. He is the sole breadwinner in his family with six children aged between 18 years and 9 years old.  He practices farming where he plants fruits which he later cultivates and sells at a profit. He has been in business for two years right now, with a monthly income of Kshs 10,000.

Joshua has applied for a loan of Kshs 40,000 from KADET LIMITED and he plans to buy more pipes for irrigation on his farm to replace the old ones. This will improve the farming business and he plans to save the anticipated profits for future use in his children school fees.

His future dreams are to become a great farmer who will be supplying fruits to other parts of the country.

loans.use: To buy new pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Meland

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 26ans, célibataire avec son niveau universitaire qui se débrouille devant au coin de sa ruelle pour pallier à son état de chômage.

Il a un kiosque où il vend un peu de tout au passant et aux habitants de son secteur tels que : bonbons, biscuits, chips, stylos a bille, crayons, gomme, papier hygiéniques, mouchoirs à jeter, pains, beurre, …

Par jour, il vend 20.000F et 25.000F, il a remboursé le prêt passé et veut s’engager avec le deuxième prêt pour réaliser petit à petit son but :
- devenir homme d’affaire.
-   Faire des voyages afin d’importer certains produits rares sur son marché.
-   Fonder une famille.
-   Vivre dans les meilleures conditions.
Il compte acheter  pour ce prêt  1carton de biscuits de différentes marques, 1carton des savons en poudre,  des pots  de : (margarine, pâté, chocolat a tartines),  1carton de petites boites de lait concentré, des sachets de bonbons, des sachets de chips, du sucre, du sel . Il compte évoluer dans ce commerce jusqu'à ce qu'il atteigne son objectif, celui de devenir un homme d'affaire célèbre
texts.en:
This is a young, 26-year-old single man. He is unemployed despite having pursued university studies. He makes a living by selling miscellaneous items from a booth at the corner of his street. He sells candy, cookies, chips, ball pens, pencils, gum, toilet paper, paper tissues, bread, butter, etc. to passersby and local residents.

His daily income ranges from 20,000F to 25,000F. He has already repaid a previous loan, and plans to use this second loan to achieve his goals of becoming a businessman, traveling abroad to import products that are hard to find locally, starting a family, and improving his living conditions. 

With this loan, he plans to buy one carton of cookies of various brands, one carton of detergent soap, jars of margarine, pâté, and chocolate spread, one carton of small cans of condensed milk, bags of candy, bags of chips, sugar, and salt. He plans to continue with this activity until he achieves his goal of becoming a famous businessman.

loans.use: To stock up on cartons of milk, butter, sweets, soaps and detergents

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto, es un exitoso hombre de 42 años, que junto a su esposa Antonia cuidan de sus 5 hijos. Ambos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pongo. La principal actividad económica del lugar es la “agricultura”. Ernesto lleva 20 años dedicándose a ello; sus sembríos constan de lechuga, papa y arveja. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la unión de su familia, ya que todas las mañanas sus hijos y esposa, le ayudan en los cuidados que diariamente brinda a sus cultivos. Ahora él se está preparando para la campaña agrícola, donde obtendrá mejores ganancias de acuerdo a la calidad de sus cultivos. Ya los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad de Tarma, lo conocen, por su honestidad y trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Paraíso al progreso”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se compromete a ser responsable con los objetivos de su asociación. Ernesto, cosechará dentro de muy poco 10 sacos de papa de la variedad “Yungay”, por ello con el crédito esta pensando comprar 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, para poder esparcirlos en sus terrenos agrícolas, luego de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Ernesto is a successful 42 year old man, who together with his wife Antonia takes care of his 5 children.  They live in their own home, located in the village of Pongo.  Their principal economic activity is farming.  Ernesto has been farming for 20 years.  His plantings consist of lettuce, potatoes and peas.  The thing he likes most about his work is the togetherness of his family, since every morning his children and wife help him in the daily care of his crops.  Now he is preparing himself for the agricultural campaign, where he will get more money for better quality products.  The bulk buyers from the city of Tarma already know him for his honesty and hard work. 

He is part of the village bank "Paraiso al progresso" and this is his third loan with MFP, where he commits to being responsible with the objectives of the group.  Ernesto will soon harvest 10 sacks of "Yungay" variety potatoes, and so he is thinking of using this loan to buy 2 bags of pea seeds to spread over his farmland after the harvest.

loans.use: Buy 2 bages of pea seeds

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
La señora Fátima G. Ortiz se dedica a la realización y venta de nacatamales comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo que se consume generalmente los fines de semana	 y cosa de horno postre a base de maíz desde hace dos años.
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de cerdo y maíz.
texts.en:
Sra. Fátima G. Ortiz prepares and sells Nicaraguan tamales, a traditional dish made of corn and pork that is usually consumed on the weekends. She also makes baked desserts made of corn. Fátima has been in this business for two years.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of pork and corn.

loans.use: Purchase pork & corn

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is age 44 and a farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya. He is married with five children between 1 and 13 years old. He has been doing mixed farming for 12 years, producing cabbages, sugarcane and bananas all of which he sells locally. He earns additional income from employment.

Thomas has requested for this loan 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes the dairy cow will generate enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's living standard as well as pay school fees for the children. He is also focusing on buying a motorbike to help in transporting the produce to the market in future.

Thomas, however, faces the challenges of poor roads, price fluctuations and pests. He remains optimistic on successfully repaying the first loan and requesting more.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her store such as milk, yogurts, cereals & fruits among others

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Pacita works hard to support her family.

Pacita has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Pacita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to allow her to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Mrs. Savath Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of ten members. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family’s standard of living. Mrs. Savath is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She was born in 1969. She is a widow with seven children. Three of her children are seamstresses in garment factories while the others attend the local public school. She is a Khmer cake seller and a chicken breeder who is able to earn some profit with which to support her family. Although she tries to work hard, she can only earn a small income. To improve this situation, Mrs. Savath is applying for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for merchandise and showcases.

loans.name: Andres Dario

texts.es: Andres es un joven de 19 años que desde los 16, inicio su vida laboral  trabajando con unos amigos como ayudante en un almacén de repuesto y lujos para carros en el  barrio 7 de Agosto en la ciudad  Bogotá;  Posterior a esta experiencia con recursos propios emprendió hace un año y medio su propio negocio de instalación de alarmas, bloqueos, radios y venta de cajas de sonido para carros; él vive con sus padres y su hija de 4 meses que está  a su cargo y es su mayor motivación para con su negocio construir un futuro prometedor, que la lleve a alcanzar el éxito de manera conjunta. En su negocio vende alarmas para autos, alarmas y bloqueo central, radio e instalación, así mismo fabrica parlantes y cajones de sonidos para carros. Su poco capital de trabajo lo obliga a hacer compras en pequeñas cantidades y con mucha frecuencia porque después de vender el artículo, con ese mismo dinero surte y reemplaza el articulo que vendió. Esta es una de las razones por las cuales recurre a su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cajas de maderas, alarmas, parlantes, bloqueos automáticos, radios y herramientas para mejorar la oferta de su taller, donde ofrece el servicio de instalación de  equipos, sonidos para autos y fabrica tambien parlantes. Su sueño es posicionarse en el mercado, dándose a conocer por el servicio de buena calidad que ofrece y por los productos que vende en su almacén, porque en la actualidad surtirlo es su mayor desafío, así como el no tener una vivienda propia. Mientras Andres construye sus sueños persiste en su trabajo responsable y disciplinado para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Andres is a young man of 19 years who, since he was 16, began his career working with some friends as a helper in a car parts and lights store in the 7 de Agosto neighborhood in the city of Bogotá. After this experience, with his own resources, he started his own business installing alarms, locks, radios and selling sound boxes for cars a year and a half ago. He lives with his parents and his 4-month-old daughter who is in his care and is his greatest motivation to build a promising future with his business that leads to success together.

In his business, he sells car alarms, alarms and central locking, radio and installation, as well as making speakers and sound boxes for cars. His little working capital obliges him to make purchases in small quantities and with a lot of frequency because after selling the item, with that same money, he stocks and replaces the item he sold. This is one of the reasons why he uses crediKiva, which is the first loan that he made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with which he will buy wooden boxes, alarms, speakers, automatic locks, radios and tools to improve the offerings of his shop, where he offers the service of installing equipment, car audio systems and makes speakers as well. He dream is to position himself in the market, becoming known for the good quality service that he offers and for the products that he sells in his store since, currently, stocking is his greatest challenge, as well as not having his own home. While Andres builds his dreams, he persists in his work in a responsible and disciplined manner to achieve them.

loans.use: To buy wooden boxes, alarms, speakers, automatic locks, radios and tools to improve his shop's offer.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa makes soap locally called "Don’t Touch Me" for sale at Abura. Yaa has received education up to the junior high level.  She is a widow and has seven dependents. Yaa has been making soap for sale for 5 years. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients to prepare soap for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare soap for sale.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a young mother of one son. Sawsan and her husband have a small clothing store that they managed to open using their savings. Sawsan and her husband are teachers in the UNRWA ( United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestinian Refugees).

Sawsan, who is photographed in FATEN's office, and her husband want to increase their income, so they took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more clothes to exhibit in the store as well as changing the store's decoration to adapt to the new clothes they want to purchase.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell and redecorate her clothing store.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny es una mujer de 20 años soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en la parroquia rural de Pifo en Quito-Ecuador en una vivienda propia desde hace una año en el barrio “Amazonas”. Ella tiene estudios secundarios completos.
Hace dos años empezó su negocio de crianza de cerdos que aprendió de sus padres. Para ello arrienda una estructura metálica en la cual tiene a sus cerdos. Ella quiere un crédito para comprar balanceado y más cerdos; de esta manera ella ampliará su negocio mejorando sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. Este es su primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa.
En su vida uno de sus principales obstáculos es trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo porque ella trabaja sola y debe criar a su hijo, pero este es un esfuerzo necesario para su superación personal.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 20 year old single woman, and she has a son.  She lives in the rural parish of Pifo in Quito, Ecuador.  She has lived in her own house in the Amazonas neighborhood for one year.  She has a high school education.

Two years ago she started a business of raising pigs, which she learned from her parents.  In order to do this, she rents a metal structure where she keeps the pigs.

She wants the loan to buy balanced feed and more pigs.  That way she will expand her business, which will improve her income and her quality of life.  This is her first loan with the Fundación Alternativa.

One of the primary obstacles in her life is working and studying at the same time.  This is because she works alone, and she needs to take care of her child.  However, this is a necessary endeavor for her personal development.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and more pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 39 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Magdalena estudió la primaria.
Se dedica a la venta D. comidas en la plaza D. ganados, también tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, la que atienD. personalmente.  DesD. hace cinco años  trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer  préstamo solicitado fue por la suma D.  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite, huevo y otros insumos para seguir implementando su bodega.
Su sueño es tener buenos ganados, venderlos a buen precio para tener buena ganancia y solventar económicamente los estudios D. sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the “Virgen D. la Asunción” (Virgin of the Assumption) communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 39 years old, married and has four children.  Magdalena went to elementary school.

She sells meals in the livestock exchange and she also has a grocery store that she tends to personally.  She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last five years.  Her first loan request was for 300 new soles that she invested in her business.  She will use this new 1500 new sol loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, eggs and other ingredients to continue stocking her store.

Her dream is to have good livestock and sell it for good prices to have profits and meet her children’s educational expenses.  What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings, the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rose Nancy

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old, married, and has five children aged between three and eighteen. She operates a restaurant at a local market in Kisumu. She has been in this business for two years now and hires three employees. She says the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints.
Rose plans to use this loan to purchase foodstuffs to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business to a big hotel. She also has hopes to educate her children. Rose describes herself as a visionary woman.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 30 years old and married, with 3 children.  She earns a living by making ice cream in the Philippines. Lucille is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.  Lucille has been making ice cream for 3 years and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop, pig fattening and retail selling of gasoline.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and send her children in college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
In the picture, Analisa and her husband stand in front of their rented house.

Analisa is 32 years old and a mother of two daughters, Andriana (8) and Aira (2). In 2006, she started selling fried rice in Jalan Dewi Sartika, a village in Cawang. The business is running well. From the income, she can pay the rent for their house and help her husband to pay for Andriana's school fee. 

Now, she asks for 2,000,000 Indonesia Rupiah (IDR) to pay for t-shirts to resell in her village. She hopes she can send Aira to a preschool when Aira is 3 years old. In the future, she hopes to save her money to buy a little house.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts for resale.

loans.name: Richard Sergio

texts.es: El Sr. Richard es soltero, se dedica a la venta de productos Agroquímicos como insecticidas, fertilizantes, urea, fosfato, desde diciembre del 2010, el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de estos productos que son utilizados en la campaña de Arroz por los Agricultores de la zona, y así poder tener más ingresos para lograr el crecimiento de su negocio. Su mayor sueño del Sr. Richard es adquirir un terreno y lograr tener la casa propia, a la vez esta muy agradecido por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le dan para lograr sus sueños.
texts.en: Sr. Richard is single and sells agrochemical products such as insecticides, fertilizer, urea, and phosphate.  He has been in business since December, 2010.  He plans to use the loan to buy these products for the "Rice for farmers" campaign coming up in his area.  This will allow him to increase his income and expand business.  Sr. Richard's greatest dream is to buy his own land a build a house.  He is very grateful for the support and the opportunity to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase agrochemical supplies, such insecticide, fertilizer, and phosphates

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
An enterprising business lady, Eva is 50 years old. She is married to Ngugi. They are blessed with three children who are adults. She has been distributing donuts for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

Eva is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Eva will use the loan to buy sugar, wheat flour, and salt for making donuts. 

She will use the anticipated profit from the business as working capital. Her dream is to open a bakery shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, and salt for making donuts

loans.name: Salamat's Group

texts.en:
Salamat is the leader of this group. She is 50 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she has raised eight children: three daughters and five sons. The older children are married and live separately with their families and the younger children study at school. In order to earn additional money to meet the daily needs Salamat breeds livestock and cultivates agricultural products. She has applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wishes to build a big nice house for her sons. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 30 лет. Она не замужем. У нее среднее образование. Мукарам уже два года как занимается торговлей.  Она у себя дома продает полотенце, мужское и женское нижнее белье, носовые платки и носки. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Mukaram lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 30 years old and single.  She has a secondary education.  Mukaram has been involved in retail sales for two years.  She sells towels, men's and women's undergarments, handkerchiefs and socks at home.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise in order to expand the assortment of her goods.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Roberto Enrique

texts.es:
En las Peñitas uno de los lugares mas turísticos y visitados por los turistas localizado en la ciudad de León , habita el señor Roberto , de 39 años de edad un sencillo comerciantes, dueño de una pulpería que administra junto con su esposa , es padre de tres hijos 16,12 y 8 años de edad, todos ellos están en a escuela. Don Roberto toda su vida ha sido comerciante, el ha sido vendedor ambulante desde los 19 años de edad, ha trabajado todo tipo de electrodomésticos, bisuterías, ropa, zapatos, utensilio del hogar. El puso una pulpería desde hace 8 años que su esposa administra, el trabaja también como vendedor de electrodomésticos a una empresa, de esta manera es que se gana la vida diariamente.
El realizo este crédito para comprar dulces, sopas, jugos, agua, gaseosas, pan, arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, huevos, carne, productos de limpieza. Pues estos son parte de los productos que requiere y más buscan sus clientes y con el crédito se ayudara a surtir mejor su pulpería. El desea poder construir su casa para que sus hijos vivan en un lugar digno y con las condiciones básicas y necesarias para vivir.
texts.en:
In the Peñitas, one of the most visited tourist sites in the city of Leon, lives Roberto a 39 year old simple merchant, an owner of a small grocery store that he and his wife run together. He is the father of three children who are 16, 12, and 8 years of age, with all of them in school. 

All his life Roberto has been in business. He has been a street vendor since he was 19 years old, and has worked with all types of appliances, costume jewelry, clothing, shoes, and house utensils. He has had a grocery store for 8 years that his wife manages, and he works also selling appliances, and this is how he earns his daily bread.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy sweets, soups, juices, water, soda, bread, rice, sugar, oil, beans, eggs, meat, and cleaning products. These are some of the products that he needs and are most requested by his customers and with the loan he can better supply his store. His dream is to be able to build a house for his children so they can live in a decent place in an environment of a basic and normal life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soups, juices, water, soda, bread, rice, sugar, oil, beans, eggs, meat, and cleaning products

loans.name: Sopey Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est 27 août 2009, il est constitué de neuf de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et une parfaite entente règne entre elles.

La responsable madame Katy est âgée de 40 ans, mariée elle est mère de deux enfants, et a un autre en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce d'habits et parfums. Elle a une bonne expérience de plus de deux ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en corsage blanc et pagne noir.

Elle s'approvisionne  dans la capitale et revend dans les quartiers de la ville.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des habits, parfums en grande quantité afin de se faire plus de revenus à la vente.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
SOPEY MOHAMED Group was established on August 27, 2009. It is made up of nine women who live in the same neighborhood, and who get along very well.

Mrs. Katy, age 40, is responsible for the group. She's the one standing on the right in the photograph, wearing a white top. She's married and the mother of two children, and has another one to support.

For more than two years, she's been selling clothes and perfumes, and has a good experience in this business.

She gets her supplies in the capital, and resell in the neighborhoods of the town.

She would like to use her loan to buy clothes and perfumes in large quantities, in order to increase her profits on sales.

She intends to use her profits to help her husband in taking care of the family, and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes

loans.name: Sahr Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They want a loan of 7,200,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) in order to solve their immediate financial problems. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the repayment on their behalf. 

Sahr is the leader of this group of teachers. Sahr is 41 years old. He is a native of Njaiama Nimikoro, in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married and has one child who is attending primary school. Sahr has been in the teaching profession for 21 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy household equipment and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy household equipment and invest the rest in his business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is married and has four children ranging from 12 to 26 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. Regina runs a retail store. The business is faced with the problem of increasing costs. She will be using this loan of KES 20,000 to add to her stock of goods. Regina looks forward to expanding the business in the future.

loans.use: to add stock to the retail store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 50 años, está casada, con Ervin, con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos: Lisbet, de 4 años, a la que educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo.
