Norma ha sobresalido increíblemente, hace dos años, que Norma sufrió la pérdida de su casa; producto de un desastre natural, producido por las lluvias y deslizamientos de tierra. Gracias a la ayuda de su banco comunal pudo salir adelante y ahora retoma las riendas de sus negocios como lo hacia antes.
De esa manera pudo acondicionar a su negocio de comestibles, bebidas y cervezas. 
“La venta de gaseosas y cervezas es rentable, por el sofocante calor de la zona y más aún los fines de semana”, comenta. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Norma; ya también cuenta con terrenos agrícolas donde siembra café, cosechando una vez al año vendiendo el grano a los acopiadores de la ciudad de La Merced.  A ella, le va muy bien en su negocio y en sus demás actividades paralelas, por ello más adelante está pensando ampliar su negocio no solo con bebidas, también abrir un restaurante, donde venda las ricas comidas que solo ella sabe preparar.   Con su ayuda, Norma accedería a su préstamo número 10 de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Comenta que le agrada trabajar con su banco comunal por el apoyo desinteresado que obtiene de sus compañeros. De obtener el crédito, comprará cajas de cervezas, gaseosas y otros comestibles, para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is 50 years old, and she is married to Ervin.  They have three children.  They live with only one of them, four year old Lisbet.  They are educating and raising her in their own home in Puente Paucartambo.

Norma has excelled incredibly.  Two years ago Norma suffered the loss of her house.  This was due to a natural disaster produced by the rains and landslides.  Thanks to the help of her communal bank she was able to get ahead.  Now she retakes the reins of her businesses like she did before.

This way she was able to set up her food, drink, and beer business.  “The sale of soft drinks and beer is profitable because of the suffocating heat in the zone.  It is even more profitable on the week-ends,” she says.  However, Norma does not do only do this; she also has farmland where she plants coffee.  She harvests once a year and sells the grain to the wholesalers in the city of La Merced.

Her business and other activities are going very well for her.  Therefore, she is thinking of later expanding her business with more than drinks.  She is also thinking of opening a restaurant where she would sell the delicious foods that only she knows how to prepare.

With your help Norma will access her tenth loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She says that it pleases her to work with her communal bank because of the support she gets from her colleagues.  Upon receiving the loan she will buy cases of beer, soft drinks, and other food to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer, soft drinks, and products to stock her business.

loans.name: Begali

texts.ru: Бегали житель района Джиликул. Возраст, 33 года. Женат. Имеет шестерых детей. Он занимается посевом хлопка, пшеницы и выращиванием овощей. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Begali lives in the Jilikul district. He is 33 years old, married, and has six children. He harvests cotton and wheat, and grows vegetables. He is requesting a loan to buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Visitasion

texts.es:
Visitasion tiene 44 años edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene seis hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero actualmente vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja.  Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Visitasion se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, venta de chicha y venta de verduras, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo pollos.   
 
Visitasion es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Visitasion, age 44, is married and has six children.  She was born in the Urubamba province, but she currently lives in the Rumichaca Baja village.  This village is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department, Perú.

Visitasion raises young animals, sells “chicha” (a corn based drink), and sells vegetables.  She needs the loan to buy young animals like chickens for example.

Visitasion is a member of the “Los Girasoles de Romichaca Baja”  (The Sunflowers of Romichaca Baja).  It is comprised of 19 members who live in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This is where they carry out their business activities.

loans.use: to buy young animals like chickens for example.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима замужняя умная женщина. Она добросовестная и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 5 лет она занимается купле- продажей скота. Имеет хороший опыт и хорошо справляется этим бизнесом. Она начала данный бизнес с купли- продажи мелкого рогатого скота, постепенно расширила бизнес и добавила несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. Муж помогает по бизнесу,  и они вместе продают скот на рынке. Постоянно она советуется с членами семьи, которые поддерживают её и помогают ей. Данный момент Фотима нуждается в средствах для постройки сарая и заготовки корма на зиму.  С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту. Спасибо!
texts.en: Fotima is a smart, married woman.  She is a conscientious person and is raising four children.  She has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over five years.  Fotima has a good experience and manages this business well.  She started this business with buying and selling small livestock, then gradually expanded the business and added several heads of cattle.  Her husband helps her with the business, and they sell livestock together at the market.  Fotima constantly seeks advice from family members, who support and help her.  Currently, she needs money to build a barn and stock up on fodder for the winter.  This is why Fotima is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000.  She relies on your help and kindness.  Thank you!

loans.use: to build a barn and stock up on fodder for the winter

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with two children. Thelma is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga.

To earn a living, Thelma engages in manicure/pedicure business. She has requested a loan of 34,000 PHP to purchase equipment for her beauty salon. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3900. Thelma has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Eminat

texts.en:
Emiriat Z. is 68 years old and married to two women. He has 6 children and has been a carpenter since 1980. He started his work with a capital of Ug. Shs.100,000. It expanded and right now he has capital of Ug. Shs. 150,000.

However, he has experienced problems due to fluctuating prices in the timber that he uses in his workshop. He is also struggling to pay school fees, and this has led to some of his children sitting at home due to lack of enough money to pay their school fees.

However, he is requesting a loan of $800 to help him boost up his business and also improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To raise the capital of carpentry.

loans.name: Rakhshanda

texts.en: Rakhshanda is an Internally Displaced Person(IDP) from the occupied Agdam district since 1993. She started her own business in 1998 using her own resources. During 2005-2006 she borrowed twice from the Normicro Baku branch a total of $2,100 and has expanded her business considerably. Now she would like to borrow $1,200 to increase the variety of goods and amount of trade goods in her store.

loans.use: To increase the variety and volume of goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Alaude

texts.en: Aluade Jospeh is from Haiti and now lives with Santilis Silvestre in Munoz, Puerto Plata. Despite not knowing how to read or write, she has owned and operated her own business - a small grocery store based next to her home. She is requesting this loan so she will have the capital to purchase stores of her best-selling products: rice, sugar and cooking oil. Alaude has gone through Esperanza's business training program and is a member of a group of women who run their own micro-businesses in the same community. The meet every two weeks to pay off a portion of their loan together, exchange business advice as well as offer social support.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar & cooking oil

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
My name is Gloria Isabel, I am a merchant and I own a small business located in the center of my city. I have been doing this for 2 years, and it generates the income I need to pay for the family expenses and to pay my providers.

My biggest wish is to own my own store, so that I don't have to drag around my merchandize every day.

At this moment, I need to better assort my business because the national holidays are getting close and the sales volume is increasing.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

Mi nombre es Gloria Isabel, soy comerciante y cuento con un pequeño negocio ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para aportar con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores.

Mi mayor deseo es poder tener nuestro propio local y no tener que estar acarriando la mercaderia todos los días.

Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se acercan las fiestas patrias y el volumen de venta aumenta.

loans.use: Rubber sandals, men's t-shirts, women's skirts, children's pants, and underwear

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria's first loan with Esperanza, which she is taking out collectively with four other women in her community. She is 32 years old and has six children. She now also has a granddaughter, the daughter of her 15-year-old daughter, whom she also looks after.

Maria is going to use her first loan to stock her little store with products such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, beans, soap, and charcoal. She is going to sell these products to her community, whose residents often don’t have the ability to make it to the town to buy food and household products.

NOTE: This $750 loan will fund Maria's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and will pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To invest in starting up a little convenience store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in many different products for retail

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: I request a loan of $175 for my husband, who is a welder. He needs this loan to buy items such as welding machines and drills, etc. I am a mother of five: four daughters and one son. I am not educated, but I do not want the same fate to befall my kids, therefore I send them to school except the youngest two, who are not of school-going age yet.

loans.use: Expand welding business

loans.name: Star Fish Group

texts.es:
Star fish are beings that live under the water and are known for their beauty and at the same time as a species that is in danger of extinction, same as the women that make up this group. Their decisiveness, perseverance and tenacity make them like the starfish, women that are hard to find in this day and age.

This society is made up to 17 partners that have been in the main center of Villa Adela.

Their main activity is the sale of handicrafts and textiles, hand made products, weaves, embroideries, finished products such as hats, blankets, shawls and others, which they sell in wholesale centers and markets. The majority do not have permanent stalls and have to rove from one space to another offering their products, in many cases on credit or on consignment, this being the only way for them to sell their products daily and meet their obligations.

Currently they are in need of funds to improve their products and buy sales stands, which will give them a better way to make sales and stop having to roam the streets selling sometimes without result. This way they can support their families, since the divorce rate among them is high and therefore the women function as mothers, fathers and financial supporters for their whole family.

Translated from Spanish by L. Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Las estrellas de mar, son seres que viven debajo del agua, y son muy apreciados por su belleza y al mismo tiempo por ser una de las especies en peligro de extinción, así como las mujeres que conforman esta sociedad. Su decisión, perseverancia y tenacidad, hacen de ellas al igual que las estrellas de mar, mujeres muy difíciles de encontrar hoy en día.

Esta asociación cuenta con 17 socias que se encuentran ya dos años dentro del centro Focal de Villa Adela.

Su principal actividad es la venta de artesanías y textiles, productos hechos a mano, tejidos, bordados, acabados, como sombreros, mantas, mantillas y otros que venden en centros de abasto o ferias. La mayoría no cuenta con puestos de venta fijo, por lo que se dedican a deambular por los puestos ofreciendo sus productos, en muchos casos al crédito o en consignación, únicas maneras de conseguir una venta diaria para hacer frente a sus obligaciones.

Actualmente ellas precisan de capital para poder mejorar sus productos, comprar puestos de venta, que es la manera más adecuada para poder vender y dejar de ambular por las calles, muchas veces sin éxito, y de esta manera poder llevar el sustento a sus hogares, tomando en cuenta que esta asociación tiene índices de divorcios altos, por tanto las mujeres fungen como madres, padres y gestores de recursos económicos para toda su familia.

loans.use: They are in need of funds to improve their products and buy sales stands, which will give them a better way to make sales and stop having to roam the streets selling sometimes without result.  This way they can support their families, since the divorce rate among them is high and therefore the women function as mothers, fathers and financial supporters for their whole family.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Agness M.. She is married with three children, aged 11, 12, and 14, and has one other dependent, her nephew.

In 2005 Agness established a general retail business. She now requires a new loan in order to diversify her business by adding a clothing section to her shop. Agness thanks you for your support.

loans.use: For business diversification and to purchase stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa A. is a fishmonger. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells the fish to her customers. She is married to a commercial driver and has five children. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Maria Fidencia

texts.es:
Maria started the business, a small general store, 4 years ago with the hope that she could contribute to paying household expenses and to building an extra room for her parents who live with her. They're a large family for a small house and space is tight. Maria is married and has 2 children, 14 and 12. Her husband is a construction worker.

Maria is applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, Maria can move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María Fidencia inicio el negocio hace 4 años una pequeña tienda de abarrotes lo realizo con la ilusión de poder contribuir económicamente a los gastos del hogar y construir un cuarto ya que viven en casa de sus padres y son muchos de familia para esa casa, por lo que viven en condiciones limitadas. Ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años, su esposo trabaja como albañil.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu contribución María seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Haldifote L Group

texts.en:
Alpha Umaru J. buys and sells cows. He is 33 years old and the father of 2 children, and he is married. Alpha is a Kiva client who completed payment of his installments and would like to take more loans to expand his business. With his previous loan, Alpha could purchase 2 to 3 cows at a go and sell them in Freetown. He increased his income and was able to purchase a cow for the family to rear on the farm, while he continues the buying and selling.

Ibrahim also increased his stock of goats and would like to start buying and selling cows. The members are therefore requesting a loan of le.2.200,000.

loans.use: To expand their business of animal sales

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.

She is 59 years old, married, has four children, and was born in the city of Cuzco. With the help of her husband, she runs a recreation area called Tradiciones Cuzqueñas y Huamanguinas in a rented space located on the main avenue in Ayacucho. On weekdays she sells a range of meals, and on weekends she specializes in local dishes from Ayacucho and Cuzco. She also runs a catering service for various events.

Rosa needs a loan of 1600 soles in order to buy rice, sugar, oil, meat, and potatoes.

Her dream is to expand her business, to have her children work in the same business, to improve her premises, and to better market her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.

Rosa es casada, tiene 59 años y 4 hijos, Rosa es natural D. la ciudad D. Cuzco, Rosa tiene un recreo llamado Tradiciones Cuzqueñas y Huamanguinas en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida principal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo, los días lunes a viernes ofrece platos variados, mientras que los sábados y domingos venD. comida típica D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y D. Cuzco. Además Rosa brinda el servicio D. preparación D. comidas para diferentes compromisos.

Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne, papa.

Los sueños D. Rosa son ampliar su negocio, que sus hijas tengan el mismo negocio, implementar más su local y promocionar su restaurante.

loans.use: Rosa is requesting a loan of 1600 soles which she will use to buy rice, sugar, oil, meat, and potatoes.

loans.name: Trung

texts.vi:
Mr. Trung and his wife have 1.5 acres of land to grow rice and there are 5 people in the household. However, the land is not very fertile and quite dry, and due to lack of water they could only grow a small amount every year. Last year the rice was diseased and, therefore, their income was minimal. Due to their small lot of land, Mr and Mrs Trung also work as laborers for people in the area, earning about 62 USD per year to raise and educate their children. One child has a scholarship from the project VN Pus; however, that child has joint inflammation so the family has to buy medication regularly for the child. The family wants to raise chickens, making use of the little rice they produce. Average income is 12 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình anh chị Trung có 1,5 sào đất trồng lúa và có 5 người trong nhà, nhưng vùng đất xấu và khô căn, thiếu nước nên mỗi năm chỉ trồng được một vụ. Năm vừa rồi lúa bị bệnh nên thu nhập không có bao nhiêu. Vì ruộng đất ít nên 2 vợ chồng đi làm thuê cho người dân trong vùng mỗi năm được khỏang 10 triệu lo cho các con ăn học. Nhà có một cháu được nhận học bổng của dự án VN Plus, tuy nhiên cháu hay bị đau nhức các khớp nên gia đình phải thường xuyên lo thuốc thang cho cháu. Nay gia đình muốn CN gà, tận dụng ít lúa sản xuất được. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000 đ

loans.use: Raise chicken

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Laura Maria M. is 44 years old, is single and has a son who is studying high school, her partner works by his own in agriculture, the purpose of the credit she is requesting is to strengthen her economic activity which is the source of income to her home, at the same time she wants to improve her life and wants to install a mini store in order to satisfy her current market, her greatest dream is to see her son turn into a professional. Her business is a grocery store, at her house, for the last 11 years, it started when she followed her parent’s steps, they used to sell milk and later on she started selling first necessity items like rice, sugar, bread, coffee, wood until she got to where she currently is. The loan will be used as working capital, to buy more supplies, rice, sugar, oil, soap, beverages, bread, chicken, milk and other products, later on she wants to get a showcase and increase the products until she gets a very well diversify store.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Laura Maria M. tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un hijo que actualmente cursa la secundaria, su compañero trajaba por cuenta propia desempañando el cargo de agricultor, el proposito del credito es para fortalecer su actividad economica como fuente de ingresos fija al hogar, al mismo iempo ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida, su mayor deseo es llegar a instalar una mini distribuidora, de esta manera satisfacer su meracado actual, su mayor sueño es ver a su hijo realizado profesionalmente. En cuanto a su negocio este es una pulperia, ubicada en su domicilio, teniendo 11 años de ejercerla, su negocio dio inicio como una continuidad a lo que sus padres habien iniciado ya que antes vendia leche y posteriormente con el tiempo le motivo ir poniendo a al venta productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, como es arroz, azucar, pan, cafe, leña, bisuteria en general hasta llegar a lo que es hoy. El credito sera utilizado siempre para capital de trabajo, como es la compra de mas mercaderia, arroz, azucar, aceite, jabon, gaseosas, pan, pollo, leche en bolsa, y otros productos del hogar, mas adelante pretende adquirir una vitrinas e ir poniendo mas productos a la venta, hasta llegar a instalar una mini distribuidora bien surtida.

loans.use: Working Capital / CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Boutros

texts.en: Boutros is 41 years old, single, and lives in Dekwaneh, located in the suburban regions of Beirut. Boutros owns a mini-market near his home. Boutros's enthusiasm and willpower have helped his business grow every day. He has requested a loan of $500 from A. Majmoua to expand and improve his market. This is the first time that Boutros has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for Boutros's grocery market

loans.name: Mrs. Ky Hea Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ky H. is the group leader of five who all live in Chrok Sangke Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Ky H. owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Since her plantation is currently infertile, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to improve her soil. Her husband, Mr. Vong Khon, is a laborer in a coal kiln and he also makes a small income to support his household.

Mrs. Ky H. is 46-years-old and the mother of nine children. Four children are employed in different business activities while two of them work on their parents plantation. The remaining three children are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to improve the soil for rice crops.

loans.name: Marcos Adony

texts.es:
El señor Marcos C. Montoya se destaca por ser muy trabajador y además por ser un excelente padre para sus dos pequeños hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual ha atendido desde hace 2 años 

Desde que el inicio en este negocio  se ha  venido esforzando porque ha  podido  sobrevivir  con su carga familiar  y una de las necesidades que  le está perjudicando es la de obtener dinero para la compra de productos para abastecer su negocio y es por eso que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un préstamo para poder mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo ya que de esta manera beneficia a su familia llevando el alimento a su mesa.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos C. Montoya stands out because he is very hard working and an excellent father to his two young, school age children. He puts a lot of effort into his general store, which he has had for 2 years. From when he began the store, he has been working very hard to ensure that he can take care of his family. One thing that has been hurting his store the most is lack of money to buy products to stock his store. To fulfill this necessity he went to Ceprodel to obtain a loan so that he may improve and expand his business, so that it can ensure he can provide for the basic needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for store

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: Habib, 40, lives in Saida, a town in southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Habib has been a taxi driver for ten years. He is requesting a loan of$ 700US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new taxi car. His clients are his friends and tourists. Habib has been a micro-credit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase a new taxi car.

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Raoth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-seven people who live in tH. Angkrang Village in tH. Kampong Cham Province form this village bank loan and all tH. members will use tH. loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Touch R. is tH. village bank president who has been selected by tH. members. SH. is a fruit seller in tH. local market. Since her business is going well, sH. wants to expand it; so sH. decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell to her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chaem Chim, is a construction worker who makes a rather small income to support tH. family. Mrs. Touch R. is 38 years old and tH. mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker, and tH. remaining four are attending tH. local school.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and tH. rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on tH. loan until tH. very end of tH. loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are tH. most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of tH. principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before tH. end of tH. loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria Es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Maria es viuda tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, regalos, artículos de librería, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija de 11 años.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos y otros útiles escolares para la campaña escolar.
Los sueños de Maria son ampliar su negocio, sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos brindándoles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Triunfo Community Bank. She is a widow, is 37 years old and has 2 children. Maria has a store in her home where she sells groceries, gifts, and paper and stationary items. She works every day with help from her 11-year-old daughter. Maria is asking for a loan of 1,000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of notebooks and other school supplies for the school year. Maria’s dream is to increase her business and help her children get ahead by giving them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks and other school supplies

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 42 años, vive en casa de su madre y su hijo. Ella ofrece el servicio de prótesis dental  desde hace más de 18 años, estudió para este oficio, el cual la apasiona y es su fuente principal de ingreso. Hace varios años atrás decidió dedicarse a su profesión de manera independiente. Durante los meses de enero y febrero viaja a los asientos mineros para atender a allí, luego desde abril hasta agosto atiende en la ciudad de Lima, y finalmente desde setiembre hasta diciembre  se queda en su ciudad, donde tiene su consultorio en su casa. Lo que realiza principalmente son prótesis dentales y con la larga experiencia que tiene lo que produce es de excelente calidad, por lo que sus clientes satisfechos la recomiendan a otras personas y de esa manera consigue nuevos clientes. Es la tercera vez que Vilma está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes más activas y responsables de su grupo, promueve un trabajo solidario con cada uno de sus compañeros, y además recomienda a otras personas que trabajan de esta manera, formando nuevos  bancos comunales. Vilma requiere esta cantidad para la compra de los materiales e insumos necesarios para la fabricación de las prótesis dentales, aprovechará la buena demanda que tiene donde está actualmente, en los asientos mineros, y necesita de abastecerse de articuladores, impresores dentales, los metales como oro y plata, etc.
texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old and lives in her mother´s house with her son. She has had a dental prosthesis service for more than 18 years. She studied this career, which fascinates her and which is her main source of income. Several years ago she decided to work independently. During January and February she travels to all the mining sites to take care of the miners, later from April to August she works in Lima, and finally from September to December she works in her own city, where she has her office at her home. What she mainly does are dentures and with her experience the prostheses she produces have excellent quality, which is why her patients are satisfied and recommend her to other people and this is how she gets new patients. This is the third time that Vilma has requested a loan from MFP. She is one of the most active and responsible members of her group, she encourages each of her fellow members and recommends others to work and form new communal banks. Vilma needs a loan to buy materials and supplies necessary to produce dental prostheses and will make the most of the high demand that currently exist at the mining sites. She needs to build up her inventory of pieces, trays for dental impressions, metals like gold and silver, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making dental prostheses

loans.name: Daines

texts.en:
Daines has owned a small food-vendor store and a small garden, and has been a clothes seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for 23 years. She belongs to the Kondoa group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works for eight hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes (vitenge) and food items in order to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Daines is 48 years old and married, with one child who is 32.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (vitenge) and food items in order to expand her business

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida O., 37, is the mother of three children, one in senior high school, another in junior high and another in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the fishing community of Elmina, one of the tourist attraction centres near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 

To support her husband financially, Vida works as a trader, selling a variety of footwear including shoes, slippers, sandals, and prim soles in the community market, procuring her products from wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast. As well, she sometimes hawks her wares and treks to other markets to sell on the market days. She has been in business for eight years and is requesting a loan to procure more footwear.

loans.use: To buy footwear.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena has been married to Johnas for three years already and their marriage is gifted with a baby boy named John Ashrow Miles who is now two years old. The couple is full of hopes since they are just beginning with their own family. Rowena and her husband started up their little sari-sari store business (community based store) which is of great help to their family needs.

Rowena aims to expand her business to have a better chance to succeed. For the first time, they request for a loan from the lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 for the improvement of their enterprise. The couple believes that they must start saving right now for their child’s education while the child is still young.

Rowena and her family are contented with their life at the moment. She hopes and prays that they will remain happy despite the problems that they may encounter. She believes that she can reach her dreams with the support of her husband. She also believes that God will always guide them to whatever decisions they will make, for God is the center of life.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
My name is Kosar and my husband's name is K. A.. We have resided in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the last 12 years. K. has 5 years experience in the livestock business. I help him by taking care of his buffalos. He buys buffalos from the animal market and sells to his customers to earn a good profit. 

I successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I'm applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo for my husband's livestock business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for livestock business.

loans.name: Rusembe 2 West Kabiibi Dorothy Group

texts.en: K. Dorothy is 46 years old and married with ten kids who are going to school. She has owned a retail shop for 15 years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as maize flour, rice, sugar, soap, salt, wheat flour, cooking oil etc. She is active and hardworking. Her dream is to work hand-in-hand with her husband to build their house and form another business.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as maize flour, rice, sugar, soap, salt, wheat flour, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is already 45 years old. She is engaged in a buying and selling business of different junk materials, subject for recycling, in their village. She buys empty bottles and empty cans in their village. Teresita would like to ask for financial assistance from lenders, in order to improve her buy and sell business, the amount of PHP 4,000 so that she can buy more recycling materials. She is hoping and praying that her requested loan will be granted. Teresita is married to Leonardo B. Sr. He is a construction worker at the moment. They are blessed with four children: Benigno - 23 years old, college graduate, Bernardo - 21 years old, high school graduate, Leonardo B. Jr. - 18 years old and Joana Marie - 14 years old, a high school student. Teresita really is doing her best to earn higher income in order to support the education of her children with the support of her husband.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Kari Marina

texts.es: Kari Marina S. Hernández tiene la edad de 39 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios surgen por que a Kari le gustaba trabajar, y tenía que ayudar en los gastos de su familia y proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes y los productos de consumo diario. Los sueños de Kari son de ofrecer todo tipo de productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kari Marina S. H. is 39 years old. She is a married woman and she has 2 children in her care. She has a grocery store business. She has been running this business for the past 10 years. She saw early success because Kari loves to work and she wanted to help out with the family's expenses and wanted to provide her children with an education.

The loan she seeks is to be used as working capital used towards the purchase of basic grains, snacks, detergents and common daily-use products. Kari's dream is to be able to offer every kind of product to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Atsu

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite dans le quartier de novissi à Lomé, il est célibataire et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu pour subvenir à ses besoins le commerce  de boissons locales alcoolisées appelées « DEHA ». Faisant présentement face à une rupture de stock, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 bidons de boissons locales alcoolisées.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Novissi district in Lomé. He is unmarried. And to support himself, he earns revenues from commerce in a local alcoholic beverage called “DEHA”. Presently facing an inventory shortage, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 drums of local alcoholic drinks.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Rosalea

texts.en:
51-year-old Rosalea J. is a rice-grower in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. She doesn't have a child. She owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm and now she doesn't have enough money to buy fertilizer because she already spend it in paying the laborers during land preparation. The rice-farm that she manages is her only treasure so that she wants to preserve it and make it flourish.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 to support her business. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of urea fertilizer and insecticide.

She chose CEVI because of its low interest rate. CEVI also gives training and insurance coverage, aside from the loans that it offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of urea fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Jesus De Nazareth Group

texts.es:
Alberto M. M., (quien apreciamos en la fotografía ubicado al lado izquierdo), es Presidente del ALCOM “Jesús D. Nazareth” desD. hace un año, pero integra el grupo hace tres años. Junto a sus 10 compañeros han solicitado diferentes créditos en forma grupal para poder ayudarse en sus negocios.

El Sr. M. D. 35 años D. edad, convive con su pareja mas D. 8 años y tiene 4 pequeños hijos, el  mayor D. 8 años, el segundo D. 6, el tercero D. 2 y el último D. apenas unos cuantos meses. Ellos son la razón D. su esfuerzo, el aliciente para poder salir adelante y progresar en su negocio D. pastelería.

Hace 6 años, en un local alquilado y con dinero que estuvo ahorrando poco a poco, llegó a juntar  un pequeño capital, inició su negocio preparando queques  a mano, en moldes. Luego D. mucho esfuerzo y sacrificios D. casi dos años, pudo comprar las máquinas necesarias para la preparación D. sus productos.
Los préstamos solicitados a EDAPROSPO, fueron para la compra D. materia prima.
Ahora ha implementado su panadería en una parte D. su casa, y produce mayor cantidad que al inicio, pero su meta es comprar un horno rotativo con lo cual podría cuadruplicar su producción. Así podría brindarles a sus hijos lo que todo padre  desea, que es darles una buena educación y lograr que sean unos buenos profesionales.
El préstamo solicitado lo destinará para comprar insumos para la elaboración D. sus productos.
texts.en:
Alberto M. M. (shown on the left-hand siD. of the picture) has been President of ALCOM “Jesus of Nazareth” for a year but has been a member of the group for three. He and his colleagues have applied for different joint loans to be able to support their businesses. Mr. M. is 35 years old, lives with his partner of over 8 years, and has 4 small children. The oldest is 8 years old, the second is 4, the third is 2, and the youngest is just a few months old. His kids are the motivation behind his work, the inspiration to have a better life and make progress with his bakery business. Six years ago, Alberto started his business in a rented space with money that he had been saving little by little. He managed to accumulate some capital and started his business making cakes by hand, in pans. After much effort and sacrifice maD. for almost two years, Alberto was able to purchase the necessary machines to make his products. The loans requested to EDAPROSPO were for the purchase of raw materials. Now he has built a bakery in part of his house and makes more product than when he started. However, his goal is to purchase a rotating oven so that he can quadruple production. By doing so, he could proviD. his children with what every father wishes-to give them with a good education and help them achieve a successful professional life. Mr. M. will use the loan to purchase materials for the making of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVERTIR

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both daughters and in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Vivian is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community and has been in business for five years. She procures her goods from Kumasi and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 44 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su esposa Diana, de 34 años, y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. La tienda de repuestos, reparaciones y mantenimiento de Víctor es una de las más conocidas de la ciudad de Juliaca, tiene muchos clientes, ya que el trabajo que realiza es muy bueno y de mucha calidad, lo cual le ha hecho muy buena fama y que sus clientes lo recomienden a otras personas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es reparar y dejar todo como nuevo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que conseguir los repuestos que necesita para hacer un buen arreglo. Para el futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio e implementar un taller de mecánica.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Víctor con MFP y es muy consciente de que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más repuestos para implementar mejor su negocio.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Las Gramas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Gramas” están representadas por la señora Ruth Rosaylain y conformada por 17 miembros  dentro del cual las señora Aleida y Yessenia tienen negocios propios por lo que no existe dependencia económica. Los socios se dedican a la venta D. comida, como majadito ,logro ,pollo frito al horno, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. abarrote en el mercado, lácteos, ropa para ambos sexos. El destino del financiamiento es para compra D. materiales y principalmente insumos y herramientas que ayuden realizar un trabajo más eficiente y eficaz. Este es su primer crédito comunal que adquieren como grupo se ve en las reuniones que son gente responsable y con ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group “Las Gramas” is represented by Mrs. Ruth Rosaylain and it is comprised of 17 members. There are kinships within the group like Mrs. Aleida and her daughter Yessenia. Both have their own business and there is no economic dependency between them. The members sell food like majadito (a mixture of beef jerky and rice served with a fried egg and a banana), locro (a dense, rice-based soup of chicken and vegetables), fried and baked chicken, selling makeup and groceries in the market, dairy and clothing for men and women. The loan will be used to buy materials and primarily invest in tools to help them do their job more efficiently. This is their first group loan and from the meetings they have, it seems that they are very responsible and enterprising people.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Francisca Eugenia

texts.es: Francisca Eugenia M. E. reside en  el municipio de Colon del departamento de La Libertad, vive con su familia que la compone su esposo y sus tres hijos de 21, 19 y 11 años de edad. Francisca tiene tan solo un año de haber iniciado su negocio tras la necesidad de asumir gastos en su hogar para ayudar  a su esposo, ella ha montado una pupuseria en la puerta de su casa, posee la ventaja de no tener competencia en la zona, es por ello que ha tenido una gran demanda y una clientela ya estable, razón por la cual Francisca tiene la fuerza para seguir creciendo en su negocio con la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Francisca Eugenia M. E. lives in the town of Colon in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and three children (ages 21, 19, and 11). A year ago, Francisca started her business because she needed to help her husband with the household expenses. She established a pupuseria on her front doorstep. Having no other competitors in her area, Francisca’s products are in high demand and attract a stable clientele. She has the strength to continue growing her business, so she needs to buy ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 31 years old, and is married with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade.

Susana works to support her husband in providing for their family. She has a palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil, and supplies it to retailers in her community as well as selling it at the local market.

Susana has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business. She believes that the loan will enable her to inject more capital into her trade, thus raising more income to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan C. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old and married. To make a living, Susan sell vegetables and other cooking ingredients. Susan has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used as additional capital for the business. Susan is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan that Susan has  taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and serves low-income households in Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
la sra. Macaria I. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen de ella, los otros ya tienen hogares establecidos y en ocasiones le ayudan economicamente.
Macaria se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo para hacer: chicharrones, tocino, patas, costilla de cerdo, tajo tambien vende aguacates, tiene vario tiempo de realizar esta actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Langue, dicho negocio le a ayudado para sustentar a su familia.
en estos momentos Macaria necesita comprar mas carne de cerdo ya que en esta epoca de navidad las carnes se venden mucho y desea obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Macaria I. is 59 years old. She lives in a common law marriage, and has 8 children. 2 of her children depend upon her and the other ones already have their own houses and sometimes help her financially.

Macaria is dedicated to the selling of pork products such as pork rinds, bacon, paws, pig feet, and pork ribs. She also sells avocado. It has been a long time that she does this activity. Her business is located in the Langue market. She says that her business has helped her support her family. Currently, Macaria needs to buy more pork meet, since during Christmas time this product sells a lot and she wants to earn more profit.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy pork meet

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza A. is a 51-year-old woman who has a poultry business. She has 10 years of experience in this field. She is married and has 3 sons who are the apple of her eye. Once each week, Elza sells poultry in the central livestock bazaar . Every week, one of her dear sons helps her to take the birds to the bazaar. 

She has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to build a good shelter for her birds and to purchase more hens, turkeys and ducks.

loans.use: To build a poultry shed

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Ke S., 31, is married and lives with her five children in Dangkao, Cambodia. S. is involved in the business of preparing fabrics at home and also providing laundry services to people in her village. She is able to earn an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been engaged in this business since 2001. Her husband is a pipe worker. He is able to earn an income of USD 3 per day. S. and her family members work hard to help each other maintain a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the anticipated loan to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: House repair.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Choeurn N. is forty-six years old and lives in Daeum Pou Village, Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ly Ngoun are farmers who own a three-hectare field to cultivate rice. As they try to farm their land, they find themselves facing a problem: the soil in their field is not fertile. Mrs. Choeurn N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her family's income and improve the family's living situation with this loan. Mrs. Choeurn N. is the mother of three children; two of her children are farmers, and the other is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and piglets for breeding

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by Señora Eladia A., a resident of the Primero de Marzo neighborhood in the city of Coronel O.. She had approached Fundación Paraguaya to learn more about its Committee of Enterprising Women program, and then invited her friends and neighbors to form a group in order to get ahead and improve their quality of life. They are 15 very hard-working, humble women who work every day to earn a living. 

They each work independently in clothing sales, food sales, grocery stores, and in orchards; other members sell their own products. 

They received the loan and each person used the money to invest in their respective business. Like the rest of the group members, Señora Ada D. works very hard at her job preparing and selling meals. She wakes up very early each morning to start cooking and display the food she sells from her homes. She used her loan to buy cooking ingredients like beef and chicken, vegetables and spices. 

The group members’ activities are listed below:

1. Bernarda O.: Grocery store 
2. Norma M.: Crafts 
3. Ada D.: Food sales
4. Hilda C.: Avon Cosmetics sales
5. Catalina A.:  Chipa (traditional Paraguayan baked goods) sales
6. Silvia M.: Lingerie sales
7. Maria Liza M.: Street vendor
8. Limpia T.: Fruit and Vegetable sales
9. Rosa C.: Garlic sales
10. Maria Agustina F.: Vegetable sales
11. Marizza S.: Street vendor
12. Eladia A.: Street vendor
13. Juana B.: Garlic sales
14. Gloria B.: Street vendor
15. Victoriana G.: Food sales

loans.use: Buy beef, chicken, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia V. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy 2, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by buying and selling dried fish.

Concordia’s 54-year-old husband, Mario, is also a dried fish vendor.  They have 7 children between the ages of 17 – 33 years old with 2 of them having their own family. Three are currently employed while the other 2 are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Concordia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in buying and selling dried fish. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Concordia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,500 was used to fund the operations of her dried fish business which has had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking out her 8th loan in the amount of Php 19,500, which she intends to use on her dried fish venture. Concordia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Seng M., a 34 year old married man, is the leader of a small four-member group loan. All the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province.

Since 1995, Seng M. has been a fisherman along the river. The river is full of fish in this great season. He also receives help from his wife to fish. The couple has three children who are students and also help their parent’s business when they are not studying.

Seng M. lacks some materials for fishing. So he decided to seek a loan of $300 to buy nets and traps for his fishing operation.

Mr. T., age 40, is requesting a loan to purchase more tools for his fishing business.

Mrs. C., age 31, is requesting a loan to decorate her house.

Mrs. C., 50 years old, is asking for a loan to repair her old house. (Mrs. C. was not available that day so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy nets and traps.

loans.name: Reymond

texts.en:
Reymond D. R. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 21 years old and is single. To make a living, Reymond owns and operates a fish-selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from peddling and selling fish with the use of his motorcycle in the local community. Reymond has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Reymond joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Reymond is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase more fish to sell. This will be the fourth loan he has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Munkhgerel

texts.en: Munkhgerel is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a rental apartment. Her daughter, Odmaa is 18 years old and attends a university. Her husband works for a tour company. During the day, Munkhgerel sells tights at a local department called Bileg and Khuree Goyol. She operates a retail business, purchases a variety of Italian products from Russia and resells them for a profit. She started her business in 2005 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~365 USD). After years of successful operations, she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 3,000,000 tugrugs (~2,188 USD) today. Munkhgerel has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. She says, “I would like to open a new sales point in the countryside.” She is requesting a loan to purchase a large number of tights to sell to her many customers.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito B. is from the village of San Jose. He is 49 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jovito plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $1430 during harvest season. Jovito said that it is because of his children that he is working really hard.

In 2006, Jovito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jovito is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be his 8th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es: Marcia tiene 50 años, por lo que su actividad económica la compra y venta de ganado. Es así que todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano a trabajar en su negocio en alimentar a las vacas ya que sabe que tiene que brindarles un buen cuidado, para que sus productos sean comprados más rápidamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pues poco a poco ha ido aumentando su producción. Con el tiempo, desea preparar a sus hijos y tener otros ingresos. Por lo que el dinero que solicita es para la compra de vacas, terneros y toros.
texts.en:
Marcia is 50 years old and is in the business of buying and selling cattle. She gets up very early every morning to feed her cows because she knows that she has to care for them well in order to sell her products quickly. Her favorite thing about her job is that little by little she has been increasing her production. With time, she hopes to educate her children and to create other sources of income. The loan she is requesting will go towards the purchase of cows, calves, and bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows, calves, and bulls

loans.name: Mibame

texts.en: Mademoiselle Mibame B. was born in Tsevie, Togo, about an hour north of where she currently lives and works in Lome. She is only 21 years old but has a successful store where she sells groceries and infant health and care products. She's had this business for two years. Now she is requesting her first loan from WAGES for 300,000 West African CFA francs, in order to restock her store with more groceries and baby products.

loans.use: To purchase baby clothes for her general store

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie R. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Marjorie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marjorie owns & operates a business selling magnetic and therapeutic accessories like bracelets and earrings in the local community. Marjorie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjorie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marjorie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marjorie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nhoi Duoi1-3 Group

texts.en:
To T. H. is 46 years old and lives in Nhoi Duoi village with her husband and her son. She has a store and sells everything for everybody in her village. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND).

She has participated in SEDA since 2009. For her last loan, she borrowed 2,375,000 VND and has completely and punctually repaid this amount. For this loan, she would like to borrow 5,450,000 VND to expand her store.

About the other borrowers in her group:
Thuy T. D. is 36 years old. She would like to borrow 5,450,000 VND in order to breed poultry.

Hong T. D. is 31 years old. She would like to borrow 5,450,000 VND in order to invest in her store.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa K. sells cooked rice at Takoradi. Adwoa has received senior high education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband in providing for the general welfare of the home. Her loan, she says, will enable her to buy and cook food in larger quantities to sell. She hopes to reinvest her profit into her business.

loans.use: buy and cook food in larger quantities for resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan Monday is currently in the business of selling rice, soda, sugar and soap at her shop and is requesting a loan to stock cartons of salt, bags of sugar and bags of beans to sell.  Susan is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy supplies of cartons of salt, bags of sugar and bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Rodelita

texts.en:
Rodelita A. is from the village of District II. She is 32 years old. Rodelita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rodelita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rodelita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

Rodelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Rodelita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rodelita. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and supplies

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité La Alegría se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Calle Naviadad- Guayaibi. 
El comité se denomina La Alegria están en el sexto Ciclo con 11 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
Cada señora de los comités se dedica a deferentes actividades para contar con ingresos extras para el bienestar de sus  familias.
Así la señora Prisila se dedica  a la venta de productos de uso domésticos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para algunos gastos personales que tiene con su familia, además desea comprar calzados a sus hijos para la escuela y algunos útiles que les falta.
texts.en: The committee, La Alegría, began with the joining of various neighbors from the community of Calle Naviadad-Guayaibi.  This committee is in its sixth cycle with eleven members.  It is a group that is known in its neighborhood for being very close, supportive, and responsible.  The members possess a great entrepreneurial spirit as they dedicate every day to payments and intend to finish this stage fulfilling the institution's responsibilities.  Every woman in the committee is dedicated to different economic activities in order to generate extra income for the well-being of their families.  For example, the señora Prisila sells domestic, household products.  She is seeking a loan for some personal costs related to her family.  She would like to buy shoes for her children for school and other items that they need.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and cover other educational expenses.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa B., age 26, owns and operates a specialized retail store, where she primarily sells seafood products like fish and shrimp in the local community. Luisa is just starting this business.  She and her husband have four young children and live in the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. 

Earlier this year, Luisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted  to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and utilized as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Luisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of onrthern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to obtain working capital for her business

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. The other one is four months old. She also takes care of additional family members. Harriet has a business of selling local gin. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Harriet sells her products from home, by means of both wholesale and retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of waragi, the local gin. The main business challenge for Rose is transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married 61-year-old woman who has been running a green grocery for 20 years. She sells most of the fruits which are in season like paw-paws, pineapples, oranges, mangoes, tomatoes and may more. Her monthly income from this business has been around Kshs 10,000. 

This is Mary's first loan with KADET, with which she intends to purchase cereals and a local cooking oven (called a "jiko" which utilizes charcoal) to make and sell githeri(a mixture of maize and beans fried with onions and tomatoes) as a secondary business. She also plans to be making other foods which include mashed potatoes and greens which she can also sell with the fruits on her fruits stand which serves as her grocery business.

In the future, she hopes to run a stable cereal store and one day open a hostel. She thanks the Kiva lenders who helped make her loan possible.

loans.use: To buy cereal stock and cooking oven for her secondary business of cooking foods.

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en:
Altanzul S. is a 26-year-old young man who lives with his sister and her two children in an apartment in Selenge province, Mongolia. His sister works as a chairman of the transportation section in Suhbaatar's train station. Altanzul operates a photo studio in his town. He began his business in 2004 when he was student at Mongolian National University, by operating a photo studio in a rented space on Student's Street, Ulaanbaatar. After graduating from the university in 2005, he started to work in his town's train station as an agent. In 2006, he decided to operate a photo studio, which he opened in a rented space. 

Since then, he has expanded his business by obtaining a loan in dollars equal to 10,000,000 MNT from Xacbank and purchasing high quality equipment and tools that are used in the professional studio. Over the years, he has built a stable operation and has been providing a professional photo service to his community. He hired one more worker and they run their business at a sustainable level. Altanzul is a very hardworking man and hopes to get permission the establish a legal entity and expand his business in the future. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary supplies, material and equipment for his photo studio.

loans.use: To purchase necessary supplies, material and equipment

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es:
Maximino I., tiene 48 años es de la compañía de Costa Baez de Acahay de Ybycui, en la misma compañía tiene un negocio “Kiosco” es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable opera con la institución Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2007.
El crédito solicitado recientemente es para ir ampliando su negocio con bebidas, golosinas, enlatados, panificados y otros, ya que se acerca la temporada veraniega y en esta época tiene mucha venta.
El Sr. Máximino se encuentra cerca de un arroyo natural donde en la época consigue mucha venta ya que  mucha gente se acerca  hasta ese lugar.
texts.en:
Maximino I. Ramírez, 48, is from Compañía de Costa Baez de Acahay in Paraguarí department.  He has a kiosk there.  He’s a very hard working person.  He has been collaborating responsibly with Fundación Paraguaya since 2007.

The loan he requested recently is to expand his business with beverages, snacks, canned goods, baked goods and others because the summer season is approaching and sales increase during this time.

Maximino is near a natural stream that attracts a lot of people during this season so sales are good.

loans.use: To buy beverages, snacks, baked goods and others.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, blusas, casacas y polos, ella vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al público en general, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina, 40, is a member of the “COMUZONE I” communal bank located in Cusco district.  It’s part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is single and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with clothing sales.  She sells pants, blouses, jackets and polo-type shirts taking them to sell at various institutions and to the general public.  She’d like to expand the business and is asking for the loan to buy clothes at wholesale.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do necessary maintenance for his pickup

loans.name: Yajayda

texts.es:
Yajayda vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su trabajo, ella es profesora y trabaja en el instituto educativo “Hijos de Rey” en el distrito de San Jerónimo. Yajayda requiere el préstamo para uso personal y no quiso especificar para qué exactamente es el uso del dinero. 

Yajayda pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Yajayda lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After doing the household tasks, she works and is a professor at the Hijos de Rey educational institute in the San Jerónimo District. Yajayda needs the loan for personal use and didn’t wish to specify for what exactly she will use the money.

Yajayda belongs to the Renovación Communal Bank of the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is comprised of enterprising and hardworking people who always look for opportunities to get their children ahead. Cusco is a charming city that dates back to the times of the Incas and served as the base for the ancient Incan empire.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven members. They are located in Pouthi Mitt village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Thuy K. was born in 1961 and she has been selected by the other members to be the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. La Lonh, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use for growing corn and potato. As well as farming, Mrs. Thuy K. also earns a living by breeding pigs. She would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding. 

This couple has two children: one is a laborer and one is a pig breeder.

loans.use: To buy pig food for pig breeding.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Monsieur  Komlan  est marié  avec  4 enfants  en charge.  Il a 34 ans et  habite  quartier  Adamavo. Il fait le commerce des pièces détachées. Il   achète en gros  et revend   en détail  à côté de  la  station d’essence  Shell à Akodessewa.  IL  a employé  une  personne qui l’aide dans ces activités. Il demande un prêt  pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en:
Mr. Komlan is married with four children to support. He is 34 years old and lives in the Adamavo neighborhood.
