He earns a living selling spare parts. He buys them wholesale and sells them at retail next to the Shell gas station in Akodessewa. He has one employee to help him in his activities. 

He is seeking a loan to replenish his stock.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R. is from the village of Salinas Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. She operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 32000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a pig fattening business and a fishing business. Her husband Leonardo, who is 36 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  They have two children who are 9 and 11 years old. Olivia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Olivia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy feed, medicines and fishing gear so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Olivia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines (for her pigs) and fishing gear

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en:
Baasankhuu is 51 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in small wooden house on their land. Her 3 older daughters have graduated secondary school and are unemployed at the moment. They help their mother with her business and the youngest son attends a local secondary school.

Baasankhuu has rented a stall at the crowded market and operated a vegetables and fruits retail business for the last 10 years. In 2008, she began to grow vegetables on her own land. She sold her wooden house and purchased livestock from the money she got. She has hired help to herd her livestock and in future, she is planning on running a meat business. Spring is the time to grow stable food vegetables, therefore she requests a loan to buy some vegetable seeds and to prepare her land for farming.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and prepare her land for farming

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An H., 38, and her husband, 42, earn a daily income by growing rice, the most important and widespread occupation in Cambodia. The parents of two school-aged children, they also raise some piglets behind their house for extra income and now earn a daily profit of around $3.75 to support the entire family’s daily needs.

Because pig-raising is An H.’s major means to earn money for her family, she is requesting a loan from Kiva project partner HKL to buy some pig food and piglets as well as some products for her grocery business.

loans.use: to buy some pig food and piglets and to support her grocery business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres y en compañía de ellos. Junto a sus padres decidió abrir una panadería y pastelería, negocio que lo tiene desde hace 3 años, por tanto tiene que comprar continuamente insumos e ingrediente para elaborar pan y pasteles. Una vez ya preparados lo vende en su tienda, en donde también expende confites y dulces. Este negocio lo realiza de manera diaria y solo descansa los domingos, con el tiempo ha logrado ganar clientes, quienes gustan de los postres que prepara. Le agrada realizar este negocio porque considera que le ha permitido conocer a mas personas, por lo que decidido incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejorar la infraestructura de su local. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, tiene muchas expectativas de como será esta nueva experiencia de trabajo grupal en su banco comunal ya que tiene referencias positivas al respecto y se compromete a ser un integrante responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos e ingredientes al por mayor.
texts.en: Ricardo is 24 years old. He lives in a house with his parents. Together with his parents, he decided to open a bakery and cake shop. He has had this business for three years now. Therefore he has to continuously buy consumables and ingredients to make bread and cakes. Once they are baked, he sells them in his store where he also sells candy and sweets. He works at his business every day and he only rests on Sundays. With time, he has had success gaining customers who like the sweets he prepares. This business makes Ricardo happy because it allows him to meet more people. He has decided to increases his working capital and to improve the infrastructure of his business. With his first loan with MFP, he has many expectations of how this new experience with the communal bank will be. He has positive references and he promises to be a responsible member with his payments. With the loan he is requesting, he will invest the money in consumables and ingredients for his business.

loans.use: to purchase consumables and products to prepare more bread and cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a door and window, as well as iron and welding materials so that she can close off her house

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina tien 57 años de edad , tiene dos hijos independientes y vive en casa propia  en  una zona urbano marginal, del distrito de salas a una hora y media  

Angelina se dedica ala venta de comida, el cual es el sustento de su hogar. Ella cuenta con 25 años de experiencia en el negocio, tiempo que le ha permitido adquirir experiencia  y clientela fija para su negocio.

 Angelina está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en gaseosa y cerveza para implementar su negocio, ella piensa que esta ampliación será favorable y su negocio será mas rentable.

Angelina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Angelina, age 57, has two independent children.  She lives in her own house in a marginalized urban area, which is an hour and a half from the Salas district.

Angelina sells food, and this is what supports her household.  She has 25 years of experience in the business.  This time has allowed her to acquire experience and a customer base for her business. 
 
Angelina is requesting a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in soft drinks and beer for her business.  She thinks that this expansion will be favorable to her business and that her business will be more profitable.

Angelina is a very hard-working woman.  She puts forth effort every day in order to get ahead and to have a better quality of life.  

The people that know her consider her to be a kind woman who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from different cloth markets and then sells them to her community clients for a profit. 

With the loan, she will purchase clothes in bulk quantity that will allow her to fulfill the demand of her customers and increase her income. She is hopeful that her business will improve after the investment and she will easily be able to repay the loan with increased profits. She has been doing her business for the past six years. She is the mother of a son who is a blacksmith by trade and a daughter who is studying in class 9. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Irshaad.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas, cosmeticos y ropa, el cual durante siete años ha venido trabajando en sus ventas. negocio que inicio con ahorros propios y el apoyo economico de su mama.
Miriam hoy cuenta con mucha clientela y vende productos Avon, vendiendo este productos por catalogos siendo el cincuenta por ciento en encargos y al credito de quincena. En donde ofrece, cremas de cuerpo, perfumes, desoarante, ropa, zapatos, toallas entre otros.
Sus ventas incrementaron al inducir mas mercaderia, el cual lo logro con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado en doce ciclos. y que ha sido de gran sastifaccion ya que tiene que dar estudios  a sus tres hijos.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: cosmeticos de la Avon y de la Zermat, ropa, zapatos de hombre y mujer.
texts.en:
Miriam has a small business where she sells tortillas, cosmetics and clothing. She has worked in sales at the business for seven years. The business was started with her own savings and economic support from her mother. 

Now Miriam has a large clientele and she sells Avon products. She sells the products through catalogs fifty percent of which are ordered on credit and are paid on a biweekly basis. She offers body lotions, perfumes, deodorants, clothing, shoes and towels among other things.

Her sales increased after she brought on more merchandise. She was able to do this through loans that Afodenic has granted including this twelfth one. This has been of great satisfaction for her as now she has to put her three children through school.

With this new loan she will purchase Avon and Zermat cosmetics, clothing and men’s and women’s shoes.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes and cosmetics to increase sales and fulfill her orders.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly has sold porridge to her nearby villagers for breakfast, Reussey Keo community, and she earns a daily income of around $3 each day to use in the family’s needs. Mrs. Ly’s husband works as a motor repairer and sells fresh fish to generate more profits. He is able to make $6 a day. She is married with three kids, all of whom attend school and need her care. She says she wants to buy a used motorbike for her children to drive to school as their house is so far from the school. Her kids always spend money for the motor taxi every day when they need to go out for studying. Because she doesn’t have enough savings on hand right now, Mrs. Ly is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to their school location.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to their school location.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer has started a small retail business buying clothing at wholesale prices and selling it by the piece, and because of the good quality of fabric that she sells people  trust her when they order a training suit outfit or a T-shirt or even a dress.

From her experience, Abeer has noticed that having a mobile clothing shop is more profitable than having a store in some area, so she has applied for this loan to buy a small bus. She will sell and distribute her products out of the bus. This way she can easily reach most of her clients and even go to new areas to sell.

loans.use: To buy a small  bus to use for distribution of clothing.

loans.name: Porn

texts.en: Mrs. Porn has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has one school-aged kid. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Porn doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm, so she is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Porn is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Enonie

texts.en:
Enonie is 55 years old and lives with her husband and five children. She a is dedicated woman in her retail shop business. She has a small store in front of her home where she has different items for sale like: shampoo, beans, sugar, candy, detergent, etc. Her business is located along the highway wherein she can encourage more customers to buy her products.

Enonie's dream is to see her business grow, that's why she is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP10,000. She plans to buy a variety of products for her store like: canned goods, assorted biscuits, shampoo, soft drinks and sugar. This will help her improve her sales and have greater earnings that will allow her to keep helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, shampoo, soft drinks and sugar for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Otto

texts.es: Otto  de 54 años de edad es un hombre casado que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 20 a 32 años. Él en la ciudad de Barranquilla se dedica al comercio de productos lácteos, negocio que nació de la recomendación de un amigo que el acogiera, para convertirlo en su fuente de ingresos. Pues después de trabajar en la policía no había encontrado un trabajo; inicialmente empezó comprando masa y vendiendo arepas hasta que empezó a vender productos lácteos y a reempacarlos, hoy tiene muchos clientes fijos entre vecinos, amigos, referidos, trabajadores y clientes ocasionales. Su meta mas adelante es vender en un mayor volumen especialmente a pequeños mercados y además traer el directamente, el queso desde el municipio del Magdalena. Su principal desafío es el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta, pues ante la creciente clientela resulta insuficiente y esto es justamente lo que estaría solucionando con su credikiva, con el cual invertirá en queso crema, suero, masa de maíz, desechables para lograr un empaque de excelencia.
texts.en:
Otto, 54, is a married man who has three children ranging in age from 20 to 32 years.  He sells dairy products in the city of Barranquilla, a business that arose from a suggestion from a friend who recommended it to him to become his source of income because after having worked for the police he’d been unable to find employment.  

Initially he started out buying dough and selling arepas (fried, stuffed turnovers) until he started to repackage and sell dairy products.  At present, he has many regular customers among his neighbors, friends, referred customers, workers and occasional customers.  His goal for later on is to sell larger volumes especially to small markets and also to bring the cheese directly from the town of Magdalena.

His main challenge is working capital because with growing clientele it’s insufficient and this is precisely what he’d be solving with his Kiva loan which he’ll use to buy cream cheese, whey, corn dough and disposable packaging to attain excellent packaging.

loans.use: to buy cream cheese, corn dough and disposable containers.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a businessman who runs a salon and a barber shop. He has been in this business for six years and has employed three people including himself. Even though he runs his business in a competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good reputation.

Through Faulu Kenya, Arnold has been trained on business management skills. This has helped him to improve his business. He needs a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to open another barber shop.

loans.use: To open another barber shop.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the treasurer of this group. She is 44.  She and her husband, who works in the glass factory, are raising two daughters and a son. The son graduated from school this year, the older daughter is studying, and the younger daughter is preschool age (under seven).

In order to earn additional money for the family budget, Gulmira breeds livestock and resells it at a higher price after fattening. She started this business two years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS). She plans to use the money received from the loan to purchase sheep to increase her number of livestock. In the future, she wants to save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Elsie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Gabriela Maria

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene 23 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace unos meses que Gabriela necesita un equipo de computo, ya que es la secretaria de la Empresa y se le dificulta realizar su trabajo sin esta herramienta tecnológica. 

Es por eso que ella está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), esto para la compra de una computadora para la Empresa y asi poder hacer los informes y llevar la contabilidad de dicha organización.

Gabriela es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 23 years old and lives with her family in a community by the name of San Carlos, located in Alajuela, the second province of Costa Rica. It is the country’s number 1 area in coffee and sugar cane production. There, they also produce basic grains (rice, beans, and corn), fruit, legumes, tubers and vegetables. Juan Santamaría International Airport, the country’s most important airport, is located in this province.

For the past several months Gabriela has needed a computer, as she is a company secretary and it is difficult to do her work without this technological device.

As a result, she is requesting a loan for 400,000 CRC (Costa Rican Colones). She will use the loan to buy a computer for the company so that she can complete the reports and accounting for the organization.

Gabriela is a member of El Encanto de Pital Communal Bank, one of EDESA’s 150 partner organizations in Costa Rica, and this is her first loan.

loans.use: buy a computer.

loans.name: Juana Bertha

texts.es: Juana Bertha es una mujer emprendedora quien desde hace 5 años. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como  ropa, accesorios y artículos para el hogar.  Su negocio lo inicio como una fuente de trabajo para ayudar en los gastos de su vivienda, sin embargo no cuenta con el monto de dinero necesario para hacer estas compras. El crédito es para la compra de pantalones, faldas, ropa interior, reloj, calzado, cosméticos.
texts.en:
Juana Bertha is an enterprising woman.   For five years she has been selling merchandise such as clothing, accessories, and articles for the home.

She started her business as a source of work to help with her household expenses. However, she doesn't have the money needed to purchase these goods. The loan is to buy pants, skirts, underwear, watches, footwear and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy pants, skirts, underwear, watches, footwear, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Tamba P.'s Group

texts.en:
Meet this group of teachers from a Technical Vocation school in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to seek a loan of 7,300,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their institution’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayments on their behalf.

Tamba is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 42 years of age. Born in Mansudu in Eastern Sierra Leone, Tamba is married and has five children – one in primary school, three in secondary and one grown-up. Tamba has served in the teaching profession for ten years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy food to feed his family and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy food to feed his family and to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Castulo

texts.es:
Cástulo es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 68 años. El tiene una Zapatería en el barrio de esa ciudad, está casado con la Sra. Guillermina de 70 años quien es modista. Tiene 3 hijas, la mayor es Hilda de 36 años, Rosalba y Cinthia, todas ya casadas y con una profesión.
Don Cástulo desde que terminó la secundaria empezó con el negocio de la zapatería de lo que ya han pasado aproximadamente 50 años desde sus comienzos. Comenta que le va muy bien, puesto que ya tiene mucha experiencia y una clientela bien formada.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de cueros, cuerinas, clavitos y demás insumos para la zapatería, pues cuenta con mucha demanda de calzados para la temporada.
texts.en:
Cástulo is from the city of Paraguarí; he’s 68 years old.  He has a shoe shop in one of the city’s neighborhoods.  He’s married to Guillermina, 70, who is a dressmaker.  He has three daughters.  The oldest is Hilda, 36, and there is also Rosalba and Cinthia; they are all married and have professions.

Cástulo started in the shoe shop business when he finished secondary school about 50 years ago.  He comments that he does very well because he already had much experience and a well-formed clientele.  He’s asking for a loan to buy leather, faux leather, little nails and other supplies needed for the shoe shop because he has a lot of demand for seasonal footwear.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra de 43 años es una mujer felizmente casada con Hamilton, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 26, 21 y 11 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la ciudad de La Merced. Sandra y su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de muebles de madera, para ello tienen mucho cuidado y delicadeza en el tratamiento de la madera y acabados, ya que sus productos son muy solicitados gracias a la garantía y su buena hechura.
“Lo que casi siempre nos piden son: cómodas, camas, camarotes, escritorios. El trabajo sale bien con dedicación y calma”, comenta, además añade, que un producto bien elaborado le toma alrededor de 1 mes, para ello invierte un promedio de 2000 soles, y lo vende a 3500 a 4000. Le va muy bien.
Uno de los problemas que considera importante, es la falta de personal para laborar con ella. Los meses de noviembre y diciembre son los más tediosos, por eso solicitaban la presencia de maestros carpinteros, pero no llegan los indicados. Es así como muchas veces tienen que rechazar trabajos por falta de manos.
Sandra es una experta en el barnizado y laqueado. La paciencia y creatividad son valores que la han ayudado bastante. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP. Se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de recibirlo y promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. A su vez comenta que el trabajo con su banco comunal será satisfactorio, ya que las integrantes son amigas suyas. 
De recibir el dinero, Sandra invertirá en la compra de cajas de panteones, leche, chocolate, juguetes, adornos, para ofrecerlos a sus amistades en una venta directa de casa en casa.
texts.en:
Sandra is 43 years old and happily married to Hamilton.  They have three children, ages 26, 21, and 11.  They live in a home of their own in the city of La Merced.  Sandra and her husband make wooden furniture.  They take great care and attention to detail in their handling of the wood and their products, which are well sought after, thanks to the guarantee of being well made.

“People usually request dressers, beds, bunk beds, and desks.  The workmanship is good, made with dedication and care,” she says.  She also ads that a well-made product takes about a month to complete, she invests about 2,000 PEN and sells it for 3,500 to 4,000 PEN.  Things are going well for her.

One of the problems that she considers to be important is the lack of people to work with her.  The months of November and December are the busiest for her, so she is looking for craftsmen carpenters, but none have applied, so many times they have to turn down work due to lack of help.

Sandra is an expert in varnishing and lacquering.   Her patience and creativity have been very helpful.  This will be her first loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity to receive it, and she promises to make her monthly payments on time.  She also says that her work with the communal bank will be satisfactory because the members are friends of hers. 

Sandra will use the money from this loan to buy crates of milk, chocolate, toys, and decorations to offer for sale door to door to friends.

loans.use: to buy milk, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 33, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edilberto, a welder, and mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Alma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 pesos in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 15,000-peso loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alma dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Las  Abuelas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las abuelas , sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así por que la mayoría de las señoras del grupo ya son abuelas y también  se consideran abuelas del grupo madres de sus compañeras.
El grupo esta conformado por  nueve   señoras trabajadoras humildes ,creativas ,artesanas y con grandes virtudes.
Ellas nos cuentan que están muy contentas por que  con su trabajo  se siente orgullosas de sus raíces de ser indígenas de usar naguas y de ser mexicanas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Mónica  una señora trabajadora , que se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas manteles desde hace  doce años.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio  cocer y elaborarle  figuras a sus servilletas y manteles.
Doña Moni  como mejor la conocen sus compañeras del grupo esta ,felizmente 
casada con el señor Margarito con quien tiene tres hijos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas hilos de colores,ajugas  y listones para  la elaboración de servilletas y manteles.
Doña Moni nos cuenta que desde pequeña empezó a tejer ya que su madre se dedicaba a hacer servilletas para venderlas en los pueblos vecinos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son :
María – quien se dedica a la elaboración de  servilletas.
Modesta- quien se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas.
Cecilia- quien se dedica a la venta de elaboración de servilletas y manteles.
Ciria- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Luciana- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Rocío – quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas y manteles.
Josefa – quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas y manteles.
Inocencia- quien se dedica a la elaboración  de servilletas.
Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les  ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida   y seguir haciendo lo que les gusta que es hacer servilletas y manteles.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Abuelas.  The members decided to name it that because the majority of the women in the group are already grandmothers, and they also consider themselves grandmothers of the group, mothers of their companions.  The group is made up of 9 hardworking, modest, creative women, artisans with good virtues.  They tell us they are very contented because with their work they feel proud of their indigenous roots, of wearing  
"naguas" [traditional skirts], and of being Mexican.

One of the members of the group is Mónica, a hardworking woman who has worked making napkins and tablecloths for 12 years.  She tells us that what she likes most about her business is sewing and making the figures on her napkins and tablecloths.  Moni, as her companions of the group know her, is happily married to Margarito, with whom she has three children.

She requested the loan to buy more colored thread, needles, and ribbon to make napkins and tablecloths.  Moni tells us that she began to weave at a young age because her mother worked making napkins to sell in the neighboring towns.

The other members of the group are María, who makes napkins; Modesta, who makes napkins; Cecilia, who sells napkins and tablecloths; Ciria, who sells napkins; Luciana, who sells napkins; Rocío, who sells napkins and tablecloths; Josefa, who sells napkins and tablecloths; and Inocencia, who makes napkins.

They are grateful to the foundation for the support it has given them to get ahead, to triumph in life, and to continue doing what they like, which is to make napkins and tablecloths.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, and ribbons for embroidery.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi, 49, is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years, Umazi has been selling clothes from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of lack of enough markets to sell her products. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future. With this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan, Umazi wants to purchase bales of clothes and khangas (traditional garments) to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and khangas (traditional garments) for sale.

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en: The Putri Mandiri group needs a new loan to increase their businesses. Each member will receive 1.5M IDR and will use it to purchase piglets. Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase four superior piglets. The superior piglets are very expensive now. One piglet is Rp.500,000, so for four piglets she will spend 2M IDR. The rest of the money for the piglets will come from her last profits. The group hopes that next time they can receive a higher loan of 2M IDR.

loans.use: To purchase four superior piglets

loans.name: Yordan

texts.en:
Yordan is a 35-year-old Roma living in Sliven, Bulgaria. For the last 10 years, Yordan has supported his wife and two children (aged 14 and 17) by his work with walnuts. Yordan drives around Bulgaria buying walnuts in their shells by the sack. Upon his return to Sliven, he weighs the sacks and gives each to one of his independent contractors. The contractor removes the walnuts from their shells and returns the shelled walnuts to Yordan. Weighing the sacks before their distribution lets Yordan know approximately how many kilos of shelled nuts should be returned, to prevent his contractors from siphoning off his nuts. Yordan provides work for approx 50 people for 5 days when he brings in a load of nuts to be shelled. Yordan then sells his walnuts at the major nut markets in Sofia and Burgas.

Currently, Yordan can afford to buy 2,000BGN (1,300USD) worth of walnuts at a time, which he sells 10 days later for 2,500BGN (1,625USD). After salaries and expenses (gas for his van to drive around Bulgaria buying and selling the nuts), Yordan nets approximately 200BGN (130USD), which he can do every two weeks or so. This loan will give him the capital to increase the amount of nuts he can buy at a time (nearly double), employing more people in the Roma ghetto of Sliven.

The Roma, commonly referred to as gypsies, is a severely marginalized social group in the Balkans.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a resident of Sumgayit city. Ali is 29 years old and has been in the business of selling clothes and other apparel items for the past year and a half. Ali supports his family with this business. He needs a loan to purchase more inventory in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business by increasing his inventory

loans.name: Datura

texts.en: Datura is a florist. She loves to work on her own beautiful garden by growing more different flowers to make beautiful bouquets, and also to make more potted plants for sale to the public. She earns ST$200 (approximately USD80) per day from the sale of flowers and potted plants. There is always a high demand from her clients, especially when there are special occasions which require flower decorations. Datura is applying for another loan to buy more pots and flower seeds for her business.

loans.use: Buy more pots and new oasis, and more flower seeds to grow in the garden

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.en:
Maria de Jesús is a hardworking and responsible woman. She is divorced and has three small children. The alimony she receives from her ex-husband is very low and is insufficient to pay for all the costs of her children. Because of this and to be able to take care of her children, Maria decided to open her own business selling groceries. She started with very few products but now she has increased a variety and made the business grow.

Luckily, she got the opportunity to buy a house, and in order to pay the mortgage she wants to grow her business even further. This is what she works for sale hard every day. She only needs a $325 loan, which she will use to buy merchandise and offer better service. She will repay this amount in three months. You can help to make the life of this family better. They sincerely thank you for your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Jesús es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella es divorciada y tiene tres pequeños hijos, la pensión alimenticia que recibe de su exesposo es muy baja e insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de sus hijos, ante esta necesidad y para no descuidar a sus pequeños, Maria decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, inició con muy pocos productos pero ahora ha incrementado su variedad y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Afortunadamente se le ha presentado la oportunidad de adquirir una vivienda y para poder cubrir la hipoteca desea que su negocio pueda creer aun más, para lo que trabaja arduamente todos los días, solo necesita un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y ofrecer un mejor servicio, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Don Juan A. is 61 years old and happily married to Señora Paulina Bazan, who is 68 years old. They are the parents of a daughter who is 13 years old and a student of the 8th grade.

Señor Juan began this activity eleven years ago. Since then he had been working abroad so he could save up capital, and upon his return he invested it to begin his own carpentry shop. His carpentry shop has been growing more and more each day giving him a collection of top-level machinery and an expansion on his work garage, all thanks to the quality of his products and his good service.

Don Juan is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise like different types of wood, because with more raw materials he will be able to make a greater variety of furniture models, increase his stock of merchandise, and in this way offer top-quality furniture to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Don Juan A. de 61 años de edad, está felizmente casado con la Sra. Paulina Bazan de 68 años de edad. Son padres de una nena de 13 años de edad que es estudiante del 8º grado de la escuela primaria. El Señor Juan se inicio en esta actividad hace 11años, ya que hasta entonces él se encontraba trabajando en el extranjero, gracias a ello pudo ahorrar para su capital operativo, a su regreso lo invirtio para emprender su propia carpinteria. Cabe mencionar que su carpinteria va creciendo cada día más con su stock de maquinarias de primer nivel y la ampliación de su galpón, gracias a la calidad de sus productos y su buen servicio. Don Juan solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderias como maderas aserradas y en rollos; ya que con mas materia prima, podrá fabricar muebles de variados modelos, para aumentar su stock de mercaderias y asi ofrecer a sus clientes muebles de primera calidad .

loans.use: To buy different types of wood for making his furniture

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru:
Sadriddin G., 40, married and has 4 children. Sadriddin makes a living by farming cattle. He has been in business for 3 years. Sadriddin plans to use this loan to purchase a milking cow and 2 calves. Sadriddin will sell milk to Yavana villagers as well as city residents, who live there. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гуломов Садриддин, возраст – 40 лет, образование средне-техническое, женат, имеет 4 детей. Основной вид деятельности, которым занимается и который приносит доход Садриддину это разведение домашнего скота. Животноводством он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит клиент хочет приобрести одну дойную корову и 2 бычков. Удой, который будет получать Садриддин от купленный коровы будет продовать жителям кишлака, которые живут в его кишлаке и не имеют собственных животных, а также тем, кто приобретает молоко у сельских жителей и продает его городским жителям, живущим в городе Яване. Жителя кишлака и города получат возможность приобретать свежее молоко, а релизаторы молока будут иметь возможносьть получить доход от продажи молока, помогающий им содержать свои семьи. Оставшихся двух остальных бычков клиент планирует после откормки перепродать их. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow and 2 calves

loans.name: Elida Cornelia

texts.es:
Elida D., a small business owner, is 35 years old and has 3 children.  Elida is a widow, and has run a business selling groceries for 8 years.   She works on credit to purchase wholesale, but the terms  are very short and the interest is high, so the gains she makes are not enough to develop the business.   For this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to grow her business.  With the loan she will buy popular items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and ham, as well as canned sardines and sodas.   She can buy rice in bulk for $40, sugar for $27, ham for $22 and the sodas for $10.  


La microempresaria Elida D. tiene 35 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, tiene 3 hijos es viuda y se dedica a la venta de granos basicos desde hace 8 años. La señora D. obtiene creditos de negocios que venden al por mayor, sin embargo el plazo que le dan es muy poco y los intereses son elevados, por lo que la ganancia que le queda no le permite desarrollarse. Por este motiva es que solicita un prestamo para poder crecer en su negocio. Segun la microempresaria D. ella prioriza comprar productos que son bastantes consumidos por sus vecinos que son parte de sus clientes, entre estos los granos basicos principalmente el arroz, azucar, el aceite y jabon. Pero tambien manifiesta que en su sector vende bastante sardina enlatada y gasesosas (Pepsi y cocacola).
Ella compra el quintal de arroz a US$ 40 dolares cada quintal, a US$ 27 dolares el quintal de azucar, el bidon de aceite a US$ 23 dolares, cada caja de sardina la compra a US$ 15 dolares, la caja de jabon a US$ 22 dolares y la cajilla de gaseosa a US$ 10 dolares.

loans.use: TO STOCK HER STORE WITH RICE, SUGAR, COOKING OIL, HAM, CANNED SARDINES, ETC.  GROWING HER SMALL BUSINESS AND INCREASING HER PROFITS.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is 38 years old and is married to Gustavo Alvarenga who is 39 years old. She has three children: two students and a one and a half year old baby.

For approximately three years, Lidia and her husband have dedicated themselves to the construction of rustic furniture, such as desks, long tables, and chairs. They not only make these items but also have their own store in front of their carpentry shop. Currently, they are making their products and exporting them to Germany. The credits that they previously withdrew from the Fundación were used to buy wood.

Today, they are soliciting a credit in order to buy more wood since they have received an order from a client for various tables and chairs.
 Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer. 




La Sra. Lidia tiene 38 años y está casada con el Sr. Gustavo Alvarenga que tiene 39 años con quien tienen 3 hijos, dos estudiantes y una beba de 1 año y medio.

Los mismos, desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, se dedican a la fabricación de muebles rústicos, como mesas, mesas largas, sillas, barcitos para sala y no solamente fabrican si no que también ya tienen su local de venta frente a su carpintería. 

En la actualidad están fabricando y exportando a Alemania  sus productos. Los créditos que retiró de la fundación lo utilizaron para la compra de madera.

Hoy solicita un crédito para comprar mas madera ya que ha recibido un pedido de varias mesas y sillas de un cliente.

loans.use: Purchase of wood at wholesale.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
For eight years, Uktam A. has been raising cattle, as well as growing potatoes and carrots. He has 15 hectares of land. His wife and oldest son help him during the planting season. He also manufactures wooden plows. In his village, this wooden plow is very popular, because it is affordable for the residents of this rural area. Uktam is planning to spend the income he generates from these activities to pay the fees for the education of his children, as he has three of them. 

Uktam is planning to purchase two cows for breeding. He also wants to improve the winter conditions for his cattle, because  this year it is unusually cold in Tajikistan. For this purpose, Uktam requests $900 for the term of 12 months. This is his second loan, and the previous one was managed accurately.

loans.use: To purchase two cows and to improve the winter conditions for his cattle

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Fatuma K.. She is married with two children, aged 9 and 13.

In 2007 Fatuma established a clothing business. Fatuma has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida has been a part of the Bank Comunal “Sonrisa”, which means smile, for the past 5 years.

Frida is a 57 year-old, separated mother of 8 children, two still live with her. She lives in the community of Viñaca in the district of San José de Ticllas. Frida buys Tara (dye derived from a plant)) and also harvests her crops which she sells to intermediaries. In addition, Frida grows vegetables and raises cattle.

Frida needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = 1 dollar), which she will invest in buying Tara, cochineal (dye derived from an insect) and fertilizers.

Frida’s dream is to have a house in the city of Ayacucho, a business that grows and prospers, and that her 2 youngest children become professionals.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste.

Frida pertenece al Banco Comunal Sonrisa hace 5 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, ser puntual y responsable.

Frida es separada, tiene 57 años y 8 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella, Frida vive en la comunidad de Viñaca, Distrito de San José de Ticllas. Frida compra tara y también cosecha de sus tierras, estos productos son vendidos a intermediarios. Además Frida se dedica a la agricultura de verduras y a la crianza de ganado vacuno.

Frida necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla, fertilizantes para la agricultura.

Los sueños de Frida son tener una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, que su negocio sea más grande y que sus dos últimos hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To invest in buying Tara (dye derived from a plant), cochineal (dye derived from an insect) and fertilizers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret fries fish and chicken thighs and retail them in the market. She has been in this operation for the past twenty-five years. She travels twice a week to Tema Harbour to buy her frozen products. Her working capital has gone down due to price hikes both in the products and transportation costs. She therefore wants to use her new loan to buy more cartons of fish and chicken thighs so that she can increase sales and income to support her family of seven children, with four currently in school.

She is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning "It is God"). Members agree in principal to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

Margaret’s photo was taken at the group’s meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen fish and chicken thighs.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A., 50, divorced mother of one daughter, is really dedicated to her work and supportive of her child. By her own effort and hard work, Comfort has supported her daughter to finish senior high school. She owns and operates a clothing and cosmetics shop in the local market. She also repairs torn and old clothes as a part-time job.

Comfort believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing and assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade (Wait upon the Lord) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and assorted cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar lives in the county of Jayaque in the department of La Libertad. For 15 years he has been working as a builder and this is how he has supported his wife and 2 kids. His dream is to give his family a good quality of life, but for him he will not be happy until his mother has a better quality of life, and in some way he would like to repay all the love and care that she gave to him.

Currently his mother lives in a room made of bricks and metal sheets. Her room is very small and very insecure as it is not all made of brick so lots of water gets in in winter which creates puddles in the room which attracts mosquitos and flies which carry diseases. Due to this Oscar would like a loan to make his mother's last days very happy.

Transalted from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Don Oscar, vive en el Municipio de Jayaque, del Departamento de La Libertad. Desde hace 15 años trabaja en la albañilería, con dicho oficio y con el ayuda de su esposa a sacado adelante a sus dos hijos. Su mayor ilusión es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, pero el dice que su felicidad no estará completa hasta que logre mejorar las condiciones de vida de su mamá y de alguna manera poderle retribuir todo el amor y cuidados que le brindo cuando estaba con ella. Actualmente la mamá vive en un cuarto construido de ladrillo y de lamina metálica, este cuarto es bastante pequeño y muy inseguro, ya que por no estar construido totalmente de ladrillo filtra mucha agua en el invierno que provoca charcos dentro del cuarto que contribuyen a la ploriferación de mosquitos y zancudos, exponiéndola a enfermedades. Debido a ello Don Oscar esta solicitando un préstamo para lograr hacer ese sueño realidad y ver a su mamá viviendo felices los últimos días de su vida.

loans.use: To build a room for his mum/Para Construir el cuarto de la mamá

loans.name: Silvia Argentina

texts.es:
Ms. Silvia Argentina L. Zavalai is 56 years of age, unmarried, and has no younger children. All her children are married, but she provides them support with what she can. Ms. Silvia has owned a general store for more than 15 years, with which she has sustained household expenses and helped her children.

Silvia is requesting funding to invest more in her small general store to offer a variety of products and retain customers. Her business is located at her home, and it began as an alternative mode of employment and way of life. She had no other income than her husband, and upon their separation, she had to move forward to support her children. Her business offers a variety of household products, such as rice, sugar, oil, gas, jewelry, chicken, and other products.

Her desire is to gradually improve her residence and the conditions of her business, as they do not currently have enough space for their general market.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Silvia Argentina L. Z., tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos menores de edad, todos sus hijos ya estan casados, pero le apoyan en lo que puede. Doña silvia tiene mas de 15 años de tener una pequeña pulpería con la cual ha sustentado los gastos del hogar y ayudar a sus hijos.

Doña Silvia, Solicita financiamiento para poder invertirle mas a su pequeña pulpería de esta manera ofertar una diversidad de productos y mantener la clientela, dicho negocio lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio, su negocio da inicio como una alternativa de empleo y modo de subsistencia ya que no tenia otros ingresos que los de su esposo, pero al separarse tuvo que buscar como salir adelante y apoyar a sus hijos, en su negocio ofrece una variedad de productos del hogar como arroz, azucar , aceite , gaseos, bisuteria en general, pollo entre otros productos.

Su deseo es poder mejorar su casa de habitación poco a poco y tener un poco mas de condicones en su negocio ya que no tiene suficiente espacio para tener su pulperia.

loans.use: For investment in a general market

loans.name: Hassan M.'s Group

texts.en:
This is a cross section of the teachers of the Magburaka Boys School. Magburaka Boys School is the oldest secondary school in the Northern Province of Sierra Leone. Several of the country's dignitaries passed through this school. When the Revolutionary United Front Rebels seized the town in 1997, they made the school as one of their camps. Before they left, the previous boarding school was totally mutilated and vandalized. Teachers, pupils, matrons and all fled the campus, leaving it a ghost town. However, with a peace treaty between the government and rebels in 2002 and with subsequent remobilization and reintegration of ex-combatants, life began again in the township of Magburaka. Schools reopened, but the Boys School reopened only to find a well-mutilated and vandalized school, with most of its former teachers not willing to come back. Only some of the few teachers were willing to come back and face the challenge of lifting Magburaka Boys School to its former height once again. It's a difficult task, in a country where most qualified teachers are fleeing to seek greener pastures overseas, where teachers' salaries are low, and in a country where textbooks are difficult to come by. But they are determined to bring the Boys School back to its former glory.

To keep themselves from having to flee like other Sierra Leoneans, most of these teachers, especially the younger ones, also engage in some other trades to supplement the meager salaries they receive from government. Thus, they need a loan to enable them to promote their businesses. Others will give their loans to their wives to invest in businesses. Some will use the loan to purchase building materials, others will use it to purchase pieces of furniture, and a few of them will want to pay school fees and other related charges for their children and dependants. 

Here is an introduction to these teachers:  Hassan M. C., for this purpose the group leader, is 32, and was born in Kambia Northern Sierra Leone. He is single with no children. He will invest his loan in his business as he did with his previous loan. This time, Hassan expects to buy 10 bartars (5 gallons makes a bartar) of palm oil. Although during his first loan, he experienced several hiccups such as bad roads to market places, and business colleagues not adhering to deadlines, Hassan said he will be able to overcome these challenges with this loan. He also said that the previous loan helped him a lot, as he was able to pay for his junior brother's school fees and at the same time feed his perents.

Other members of the group include:   Edward C. S., Musa Ben M., Francis A.K. T., Musa M. K., Dominic S. K., Namisa S., Daniel S. K., Adama P. F., Andrew B. F., Samuel K., Hassan O.M. B., Peter S. K., John M. C. and Teddy P. K..

loans.use: Invest in Businesses

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 37 years old and she is a widow with 4 children aged 12, 8, 6 and 4 years old. She has been a bites (maandazi: bread-like rolls) and juice seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 6am to 10:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Maryam is now requesting a loan to improve her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.use: To improve her business by adding items to her current stock

loans.name: Mwashamba's Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba has been selling dresses at her small shop in Zanzibar for 3 years. She also sells charcoal. She is 22 years old, single, and has no children. She is currently able to earn approximately $125 per month but is hoping that taking out her first loan through BRAC will allow her to increase her profit.

Mwashamba will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Safia, Megeni, Maembe, Hamida, and Salma.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her dress shop

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: La Sra. Maria de Jesus junto a su marido se dedican a la actividad agricola de la siembra de arroz, generalmente establecen 5 Mzs de arroz de secano anualmente, lo que les permite economicamente asistir a su familia compuesta por 1 hijo menor de edad y su marido Arnulfo Estrada, quien se dedica al manejo  de cultivo diariamente; a traves de su cooperativa esta accesando al proyecto de construccion de 1 trillo arrocero, donde los socios aportaran el 30% del costo del mismo.  En la comunidad de La Peña, zona donde habitan los socios se estra construyendo estas instalaciones.  La Sra. R. mantiene su posibilidad de accesar al proyecto y ser socia de este trillo, para lo cual espera que se le financie el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesús, together with her husband, dedicates herself to the agricultural activity of planting rice. Generally, they establish 5 months of rice annually. This allows her to help out the family which is comprised of one minor child and her husband Arnulfo Estrada who manages the crop on a daily basis. Through their partnership, she is accessing a project to build a rice thresher where the members will contribute 30% of the cost for the endeavor. In the La Peña community, where the members live, there is one of these intallations being built. Mrs. R. maintains the possibility of participating in this project and becoming a member of the thresher, for which she hopes that the requested loan is financed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% of the cost to build a rice thresher in La Peña.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 30, lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ali has been working as a car mechanic for almost ten years. He is requesting a loan of $1000US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase machines for his business. This is his sixth loan and he has always paid on schedule.

Ali decided to start his business because he has been repairing cars since he was young. He is in demand because he has competitive prices and performs quality work. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing more sophisticated machines.

loans.use: To purchase auto mechanical machines for his business.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey D., 42, and her husband, Mr. Vy Son, 38 who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 2000 and have two daughters. One of them attends school and another one is still young. Besides her children, she also has one sister living with her.

Srey has been raising pigs for two years. Her husband has been producing rice wine for one year and milling rice for other villagers to get extra income. The couple is also growing rice. Srey is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to purchase feed for pigs and to purchase fertilizer, diesel, and pay plowing fees for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs, diesel, fertilizer, and to pay plowing fees for growing rice

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana es una señora de cincuenta y ocho años que empezó a trabajar por la necesidad de poder mantenerse sola en su casa. Hace veinte años que su esposo falleció. A lo largo de todos los años que paso luego de ello fueron sus hijos quienes la ayudaron a cubrir sus gastos básicos. Pero desde hace tres años ella decidió empezar su negocio propio en vista de que sus hijos tenían otras responsabilidades con sus propias familias.

Es así que empieza a vender verduras y frutas a domicilio cerca de su casa. En los últimos meses ella lamenta que los ingresos por su negocio no es el mismo ya que los precios de los alimentos en general han subido en el país. Por lo que también ofrece el servicio de limpieza en una institución del estado.

Por ahora ella quisiera mantener estable su negocio. Tal vez más adelante se anime a abrir una tienda en su casa y volver a criar animales para crecer en las ventas.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a woman 58 years of age who began working because she needed to make a living on her own. Her husband died twenty years ago. In the years after his death, her children were the ones who helped her cover her basic expenses. But three years ago she decided to start her own business, since her children had other responsibilities with their own families. That's how she began selling fruits and vegetables door-to-door near her house. In the past few months her income from her business has fallen because the price of food has gone up throughout the country. Because of this, she also offers her services cleaning a government building. For now she would like to keep her business stable. Perhaps further down the road she will open a shop in her house and go back to raising animals to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food to sell

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married. She and her husband live in Zaporozhye. Nadezhda sells women’s clothing in Yubileynyi market. She has been in the trade for 10 years. Presently, Nadezhda has about 25,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 5,000 Grivnas.

Nadezhda sees an opportunity for business growth this spring season. Her expertise in quality clothing merchandise is greatly appreciated by her customers. Her desire to assist clients and her entrepreneurial spirit are part of what makes her business successful. Nadezhda has requested a loan for 2,500 Grivnas to broaden the assortment of clothing items she offers at her kiosk so she will be ready for the busy season. She has proven to be a strong and reliable client with “Nadiya Ukraine”. We believe that this loan will be a big help to Nadezhda as she looks for ways to increase her business activity.

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase assortment of clothing items.

loans.name: Suzanne Anyango

texts.en:
Suzanne Anyango O. is a 25-year-old mother of two children aged 6 and 2. Her older child is in school and she uses the profits from her small kiosk, where she sells soda and other small items, to pay for their fees. Her husband also provides additional income for the family.

Suzanne recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase food stock

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, comprometida con el desarrollo y bienestar D. sus hijos, a quienes pudo educar y hacer profesionales. Más ahora vive solo con su esposo y su última hija, con quienes comparte sus mejores momentos dentro D. su casa, la cual está llena D. recuerdos. Estar pendiente del bienestar D. sus hijos la motivaron en trabajar desD. muy joven, pues los gastos para la educación D. sus hijos fueron muy costosos, pero satisfactorios. Gracias a su esfuerzo hoy sus hijos son profesionales, e instalaron una tienda en su domicilio para que Maria pudiera dejar D. trabajar fuera D. casa y dedicarse a su hogar. Es así que desD. hace 10 años viene atendiendo su tienda D. abarrotes y dulces, que gracias a la ubicación tiene grandes ingresos todos los días, sobre todo en las mañanas hasta el medio día, pues las madres D. familia y los escolares son los que mayormente la visitan. A pesar D. tener gran acogida, requiere D. más productos para incrementar sus ingresos, los que le ayudarán a ahorrar y tener un soporte económico en su vejez y la D. su pareja, quien también es muy trabajador, pues tiene una cerrajería y juntos proveen lo necesario para su futuro. Con su grupo D. trabajo ha conseguido tener muchas amistades y le agrada realizar actividades con sus compañeras, pero lo incomodo es tener que ser drástica cuando algunas no cumplen su responsabilidad con los pagos asignados, es por ello que inició su primer crédito individual dentro D. MFP y así tener mayor posibilidad D. crecer como negociante. La prioridad para María y en lo que invertirá el dinero que solicita es para surtirse D. productos y adquirir mayor cantidad D. mercadería para que sus clientes se sientan contentos al encontrar lo necesario para su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working woman, dedicated to the development and wellbeing of her children, whom she has educated to be professionals. Now she lives alone with her husband and her youngest daughter, with whom she shares her best moments in a home that is full of memories. The wellbeing of her children motivated her to start work very young. The costs of her children’s education were high but worth it. Thanks to her efforts today her children are professionals and have established a store in her home so that Maria could stop working away from home and dedicate herself to her household. For 10 years she has attended her store selling groceries and candies. Thanks to the location, she has good profits everyday, above all in the mornings until noon when most of the mothers and students visit her. Despite her good standing, she requires more products to increase her profits and help her to save and have an economic support for her old age and her husband’s, who is also a hard-worker. He has a locksmith’s shop, and together they proviD. for their future. With her work group she has founded many friendships and she likes doing things with her friends. The uncomfortable part is when it’s necessary to be severe with those that don’t fulfill their responsibilities with assigned payments. For this reason, she solicited her first individual loan from MFP, and in this way has more possibilities to grow as a businesswoman. Maria’s priority for this money is to stock up her store so that her customers can find what they need for their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man M., age 57, is a widowed and a villager in Phnom Penh City. She earns a living by selling groceries out of her home. She is a good mother of three children; two of them are employed as motorbike taxi drivers. This is the second cycle of the loan provided through Kiva. She used the first cycle of the loan to build a washroom to improve the family's sanitation. Man needs to borrow the second cycle of the loan of $ 400, to add to her saving in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her son, to replace an existing one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Bushra Asif Group

texts.en: Bushra baji is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Both of her children are getting an education from a school located near to the house. Bushra baji is a very hardworking lady. She sews clothes to pay the school fees of her children. Her husband’s name is A. and he sells goats which he buys from the animal market. His customers belong to the butcher profession and they buy his goats to increase the profit of their meat businesses. Bushra baji is applying for a loan to buy goats to expand her husband’s goat-selling business. Bushra baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality: Rahmat baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business; Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business; Sugran baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business; Naziran baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en: Nieva M. is from the town of Santa Maria, Tangub city. She is 50 years old, married, and has five school-aged and adult children. Nieva operates a vulcanizing or repair shop, repairing vehicles. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nieva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nieva is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for her repair shop. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her children's education. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools for repairing vehicles

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions and cream. She is married with five children and she is 29 years old. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream

loans.name: Estela Ofelia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Estela Ofelia M. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de papayas siendo este su negocio al que se ha dedicado con mucho empeño ya que ha sido el sustento de su hogar.

Actualmente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con un objetivo como lo es el de adquirir un crédito para la compra de las papayas para ofertarlas en su localidad y así seguir aumentando sus ventas y por ende mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela Ofelia M. is dedicated to the business of selling papayas at the Wholesale Market in the city of Managua. She has worked hard and this has been the main source of income on her household. She is asking for a loan to Ceprodel, which will be used in the purchase of papayas in order to continue increasing her sales and improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
Stephen B., 45 years old, is married and the father of four children. One is in elementary school, two are in the junior high school, and the eldest works as a trader. Stephen is an auto mechanic. He learned his skills and received his training in Kumasi, and he has been servicing vehicles for 18 years. Thanks to his hard work and sense of commitment, many people service their cars at his garage. His primary problem has to do with maintaining adequate funds, as he pre-finances most of the work. He is requesting a loan to buy auto parts so he can meet his customers' expectations.

Stephen is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Trust in God.’ He is the one standing at the back in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell their wares at the local market square. Some of them journey to other towns to sell their goods on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for loans to help them procure more goods so to be able to expand their businesses.

In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy auto parts for his vehicle repair business

loans.name: Iyau

texts.en:
Iyau E. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to expand her stock. Iyau is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her stock

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es: La Señora Salvadora L. Antón  tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Ella  inicio hace más de 14 años, y pesar de la edad en una excelente cliente de Fundación León 2000 ya que cada uno de sus financiamientos los ha aplicado a su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Salvadora son de mantener este negocio activo para proporcionarle a su familia una fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo ya que con esto comprara frutas naturales, jugos gaseosas y además algo de pan. Sus deseos de son de aumentar la producción de ya que al mismo tiempo obtendría muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Salvadora L. Antón is 59 years old, a single mother, and has 3 children that work independently. She sells drinks. She began this business over 14 years ago, and despite her age she is an excellent client of the Fundación León 2000 given that she has invested each one of her loans in her business. Salvadora’s goal is to keep this business active so that she can provide her family a source of income. The loan will be used as work capital, which she will use to purchase natural fruits, juices, soft drinks, and some bread. Her hope is to increase production given that by doing so she would obtain many clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (which she will use to purchase natural fruits, juices, soft drinks, and some bread).

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda F. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Elle tient une boutique de divers articles et fait en même temps de l’élevage. Son activité lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïda F. is a 33-year-old woman, married, and the mother of nine children. She has a store with a variety of goods and, at the same time, she raises livestock. Her business enables her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail business of various goods

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is a 36 years old married man with one daughter. He runs a retail shop and also has cows for dairy farming. He has been running the shop for about 10 years now and he approximates his monthly profit to Kshs 25000. 

He has not borrowed elsewhere but KADET where he has been introduced by a friend. He has applied for a loan which he wants to use to restock the shop.

Samuel beleives that he is hardworking and he hopes to own a wholesale store and have more cows for dairy farming.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Adding stock for his  retail shop

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria L. who lives in the village of  Hda. San Jose Baling, Libacao, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, is 48 years old and married to Panfilo L., Jr. who presently manages their sugarcane farm. They are blessed with three children who are 12 to 15 years of age, and are all in high school. They strive hard to earn enough this year because their oldest daughter is about to start college next year, with the two younger ones following fast behind.

The family has a small sugarcane farm, which is a seasonal type of business. It is harvested only once a year. As the demand for a better cash flow increased as their daughters were growing, Victoria knew she had to find an alternate means of income. This is why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 to access capital to start a general store.

Because of her skills in predicting which products would be popular with her customers, Victoria was able to build her business with the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She was even able to help her husband fund some of the operations in their sugarcane farm. Now her General Store earns her an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used as additional working capital for her general store and for her sugarcane plantation. Her loan was fully paid on time within the loan term. Now for her 22nd cycle, she is borrowing the same amount, Php 29,500, for her general store. The income will be used for house renovation, savings for education and for future investments.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Bilda Marisol
