texts.es: Bilda Marisol M. D. G. resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango del departamento D. San Salvador. Bilda D. 46 años D. edad posee una extensa familia que esta compuesta por sus cuatro hijos todos menores D. edad y su esposo quien es empleado. Para Bilda manejar su propio negocio el cual es muy gratificante ya que manifiesta sentirse orgullosa y útil D. apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, hace doce años Bilda instalo una librería en su casa, la cual ahora quiere surtir con mayor variedad D. productos a través D. su ayuda otorgándole este crédito.
texts.en:
Bilda Marisol M. D. G. lives in the town of Ilopango, department of San Salvador. She is 46 years old and has a large family consisting of her four children, all minors, and her husband, who is employed. Managing her own business is what is most gratifying for Bilda because it makes her feel proud and helps her support her husband with household expenses. Twelve years ago Bilda set up a bookshop in her home, and she now wants to stock it with a wider variety of products through your help in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her bookshop

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 34-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Most of the town's inhabitants work in farming, palm oil production, and other trading activities.

Mercy has a fish-selling business. She buys smoked fish from nearby fishing communities and hawks to sell in her community. She also sells at the local market. Mercy has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fish in bulk

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a young, single, Palestinian man. He is 28 years old and lives with his family which consists of eight members. He works as a secretary in the Ministry of Higher Education in the Palestinian National Authority.

Omar requested 3,000 USD from FATEN to start up a new business selling computers and computer accessories in order to increase his income. He has some experience to start such a business, and he will share this business with another person who has more technical experience in this regards. 
He appears in the picture at his newly established business

loans.use: To start up a new business selling computers and computer accessories

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La sra. Emma se dedica a la confección de deportivos para niños y adultos, llega con sus productos al público en general, vive en la casa de su suegra junto a sus esposo y sus hijos, el esposo trabaja como entrenador de futbol de niños, y ambos se contribuyen para los gastos de la familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de tela para confeccionar deportivos para niños para las fiestas navideñas. 						
						
Por lo general la práctica del deporte es un icono en las familias, el Presidente Evo construye varias canchas de futbol con cesped sintético, logrando así la práctica de futbol en su mayoria por los niños.
texts.en:
Emma makes sportswear for children and adults which she sells to the general public. She lives in the home of her mother-in-law with her husband and children. Her husband works coaching children's soccer and together they contribute to the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy material for making children's athletic clothing for the holidays.

Generally sports are an important part of family life. President Evo (Morales) constructed various soccer fields with artificial turf, allowing the majority of children to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying primary material

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina L. is 30 and married with 3 children (ages 10 - 14).  She owns a business venture, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Lesina has 3 years of experience in this business.  Lesina needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Lesina joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lesina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Lesina L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victory Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Joy K. is 45 years old and the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is married with five children between the ages of 14 and 24. Her first-born is at the University. She also takes care of one orphan. 

Joy has had a beauty salon in Butebe Village for eight years. Her biggest challenge is having debtors that do not pay on time for the services rendered. From her salon, Joy is able to make about 42,000 Ugandan shillings in weekly profits. These help her in taking care of her family and helping to pay her children’s school fees. She says that her good customer-care skills help her in winning and retaining her customers, hence more expansion. 

She hopes to expand her salon further and also wishes for prosperity for her family. Joy needs a loan to be able to buy more salon equipment for expansion.

loans.use: Joy needs a loan to be able to buy more salon equipment for expansion.

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Mrs. Neng M. is 65 years old and she lives  in Prey Kabbas Kha village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mav Teang (pictured at left), are farmers.  They own a 1.36-hectare field where they cultivate rice.  They now face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their crop.  Mrs. Neng M. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farm. Mrs. Neng M. has a child who is also a farmer.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor, de 63 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Alicia (52) y su hija Catherine (33), pues su hijo menor Christopher (22) no vive con ellos.
Hace 6 años instaló en su vivienda una pequeña tienda de comestibles donde vende toda clase de golosinas, snack, gaseosas y otros comestibles de primera necesidad. Se animó con este negocio porque no había competencia por la zona donde vive y como no encontraba trabajo debido a un problema que tiene en el oído decidió tener un negocio propio. Ésta es una actividad tranquila, además la realiza con la ayuda de su esposa y de su hija. Y a pesar de su edad tiene muchos proyectos en mente para mejorar la calida de vida de su familia.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por  lo que se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir sacando préstamos con esta entidad. Héctor tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mercadería para surtir mejor su negocio y de esta manera poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Héctor is 63 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Alicia (age 52) and their daughter Catherine (age 33). His younger son Christopher (age 22) does not live with them.

Six years ago, he opened a small grocery store in his home where he sells different kinds of candy, snacks, sodas, and other basic necessities. He was encouraged by the fact that his business would not face any other competition in the area. Héctor decided to start his own business since he had trouble finding work because of problems with his hearing. He finds managing his business to be quite peaceful and also has the help of his wife and daughter. Despite his age, Héctor has many projects planned to improve the quality of life for his family.

This is his first loan with MFP. Héctor promises to complete each of his payments on time because he wants to receive subsequent loans for as long as he can. He plans to use the money he requested to buy merchandise so that he can increase his inventory and offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase his inventory

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia P. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and rice to sell.  Lucia is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is an agriculturalist. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be better able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en: Edna A.'s main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is a 54-year-old single woman from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. Edna has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to save as a reserve for future emergencies. Edna is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma F. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years-old and married with one one adult child.  Thelma owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Thelma joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Thelma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mário

texts.pt:
Mário J. nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 49 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 5 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 1 aos 18 anos os 4 mais velhos vão a escola. Faz a 6ª classe e não continuou devido a morte dos seus pais, vive na casa própria  com sua familia e suatenta sua cunhada e irmã que vive em Inhambane enviando lhes 1.000.00mt em cada três meses.
 
Sai da Provincia de Inhambane para Namaacha na Fronteira de Swazilândia com o seu irmão mais velho após ter perdido os seus pais, continua com os seus estudos e faz a 6ªclasse. anos depois é empregado nas TDM como operador de serviço de atendimento de telecomunicações, é funcionario permanente a mais de 16 anos e aufere um salário no valor de 5.500.00mt trabalhando das 7h as 14h no periodo da manhã e das 14h as 22h no periodo da noite. Quando  junta se com sua esposa  a convivência com o irmão já não era agradavel, assim sente se obrigado a sair de casa e passa a viver numa casa de aluguer enquanto construia a sua própria casa, mas como não tinha fundo suficiente para concluir a sua obra, aproxima se a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA e solicita um empréstimo para dar continuidade da sua obra.

Este é terceiro empréstimo de Mário na Hluvuku e segundo com kiva.O primeiro de 8.000.00mt e o segundo de 20.000,00mt foram usados para comprar material de construção para obra, mas devido ao custo elevado na aquisição do mesmo n ão concluiu. Este terceiro emprestimo no valor de  15.000.00mt seráusado para mesmo fim. Mario e sua familia vivem em casa propria e esta confiante que vai reembolsar o empréstimo antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo empréstimo para mobilar a casa e dar conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Mário J. was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. He is 49 years old, married, and the father of five children between the ages of 1 and 18. The four eldest go to school. Mário finished sixth grade but did not continue because of the death of his parents. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his sister and sister-in-law, who live in Inhambane, by sending them 1,000 meticais every three months. He left Inhambane Province to go with his elder brother to Namaacha, on the border with Swaziland, after losing his parents. He continued with his studies and finished sixth grade. Later he was employed by TDM as a telecommunications service operator. He has been a permanent employee there for more than 16 years and earns a salary of 5,500 meticais, working from 7:00 am until 2:00 pm on the morning shift and 2:00 pm until 10:00 pm on the evening shift. When he married his wife, living with his brother was no longer agreeable, so he felt he should leave the house and live in a rented house while he built his own; but since he did not have enough money to complete the project, he approached Hluvuku-Adsema and asked for a loan to continue the work. This is Mário's third loan with Hluvuku and his second with Kiva. The first loan of 8,000 meticais and the second of 20,000 meticais were used to buy construction materials, but owing to rising costs of materials, he was not able to finish the house. This third loan for 15,000 meticais will be used for the same purpose. Mário and his family live in their own house, and he is confident that he will repay the loan on time and ask for another to furnish the house and make his family comfortable.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy C. (pictured here), 28 and his wife, Mrs. Soknea Ou, 29, have been married since 2005 and have two children: one son and one daughter. They live in a small village off National Road Number Two about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Thy has been driving a Tuk Tuk taxi for five years.  His wife stays at home and does housework. In the past, she used to sell Soya-bean juice.

Thy is asking for his first loan of 500 USD to build a fence around his house and to build a kitchen for his family to use.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house and to build a kitchen for use by his family.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana P. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. At the age of 56 she already has four adult children. To make a living Juana indulged herself in a general store business. She retails different commodities in the local community such as biscuits (cookies), candies, canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, condiments and other merchandise which are very much in demand in her village. Juana has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Juana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Juana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, de 34 años de edad, convive con su pareja y sus dos hijos. Juntos residen en la comunidad Manitea Alta, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa propia. A Mario siempre le gusto competir, es por eso que cada día quiere ser mejor, ya que su propósito es ser el líder en el campo agrícola. Procura darle el cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones de café, para que luego puedan ser vendidos a un buen precio, por tal motivo sus ingresos económicos son buenos. Por lo general sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de comunidad. Hoy tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con medio año de funcionamiento, en donde su pareja está encargada del negocio, para lo cual ofrece  productos de primera necesidad y desde luego están obteniendo ingresos extras que lo ayudan a cubrir la alimentación y gastos de escolaridad de sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su tienda de abarrotes con la necesidad de poder satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el se compromete a pagar de manera oportuna, además está satisfecho por el buen clima cordial de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra mercadería para acondicionar su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mario is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own home. They reside in the community of Manitea Alta, which is on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. Mario has always enjoyed competition, which is why he tries to get better every day and aspires to become a leader in the field of agriculture. He provides the necessary care for his coffee crops so that they can be sold later at a good price, which explains why he generates good income. His products are usually sold at the collection centers in the community. Today he has a small grocery store that has been operation for six months and is managed by his wife. They offer basic household products to earn extra income to help feed and educate their children. His plan for the future is to expand his grocery store so that he can satisfy the needs and preferences of his customers.

This is his third loan with MFP. Mario promises to complete his payments in a prompt manner. In addition, he is happy with the friendly atmosphere maintained by his Communal Bank. The loan he requested will be used to buy merchandise to restock his grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his store

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Adama Kouyaté  est âgée  de 31 ans et habite dans la localité  de Guediawaye. Elle est membre de la caisse de  CSP depuis 2006 mais n’a jamais contracte de crédit. Elle exerce l’activité  de vente de denrées  alimentaires et d’accessoires de téléphones  depuis plus de 3 ans. Grace au soutien de sa sœur elle s’est lancée  dans le commerce pour l’acquisition de revenus qui lui permettent de faire face à ses besoins d’étudiante. Elle dispose d’une alimentation générale  et sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs dans le but de la renforcer en produits  et aussi procéder  a l’achat de quelques accessoires de téléphones  portables. Ce financement pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices   afin de pouvoir mieux gérer  ses études  supérieures.
texts.en:
Ms. Adama Kouyaté is 31 years old and lives in the Guediawaye locality. She has been a member of the CSP group fund since 2006, but has never drawn any loans. She has run a business selling food staples and telephone accessories for more than 3 years. Thanks to her sister's support, she started this business to generate an income that allows her to meet her needs as a student. She sells general foodstuffs and is seeking a loan of 250,000 frs with the goal of increasing her product stocks and also buying several mobile phone accessories. This loan will allow her to increase her profits in order to better manage her higher education.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Irene Akinyi

texts.en: “Being  a housewife and assisting other people with petty tasks for income makes one a slave,” Irene confesses, and this is why she opted in 2009 to start a business selling vegetables in Nambale since it had a relatively high income. Her dream of expanding her business was absolutely bleak despite the business being lucrative. When this proud 23-year-old mother living in Olepito heard of the KIVA loan fund through K-MET,  her dream of developing her business came true. She applied for a loan of KES 10,000 to expand her business in her own premises to help her eradicate poverty in her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock to boost business

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is married with one child who is at school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a beauty salon in Kawempe working on all types of hair and providing services including relaxing, plaiting and weaving. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of cosmetics, creams and weaves. She buys boxes of cosmetics from Kampala city shops and uses public transportation to and from shopping. Madina goes shopping once a week. Her customers are mainly women.   

She has done this business for many years now and works seven days a week.  Her main business challenge is transportation from her home to the Kampala city shops.  She aspires to buy a plot of land and build a house for herself. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans.

Madina resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water.  Her greatest expense in a month is rent for her house.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics, creams and weaves

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren G. lives in the village of Sta. Isabel Norte, Ilagan. He is 48 years old, married and has one school-aged child. For the last 27 years, he has made a living as a rice farmer, and earns about 40,000 PHP per crop for his work.

Earlier this year, Efren joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for his first loan, for 9,000 PHP, to buy fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his farm. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a farm

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta E. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 53 years old and is married with seven children. Her younger children still go to school and she works hard to sustain their education. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Restituta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Restituta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle T. is from the village of Usocan. She is 52 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Anabelle owns & operates a service business, offering repair services to local community members. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Anabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nidia Liz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nidia Liz; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia tiene una tienda de artesanía que atiende desde las 8:30 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,ella vende chompas, collares y trabajos hechos en arcilla, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de artesanía. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the "Kukuli" group loan. The group is based in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco province, department of Cusco. 

Nidia Liz is 35 years old and lives with her partner. Alongside her daily activities she sells crafts. She owns a craft shop that's open from 8:30am to 8pm. She sells sweaters, necklaces and simple clay pieces. She would like to expand her business and requests a loan to buy merchandise for her craft shop. 

The borrower would like to thank those helping her dream through this means, and is committed to repaying the loan on time as agreed.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for craft shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 53, is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. She has been farming for ten years and employs one farmhand. Her farm produces milk, eggs, vegetables, and maize, all of which are sold locally. Her biggest challenge has been a lack of sufficient animal feed.

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will help her provide for the basic needs of her family. She plans to buy five dairy cows over the next five years and become the primary milk supplier to the local market.

Mary is the mother of four grown children.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional drinks in bulk

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es estudiante, y recibe la ayuda de su abuela para que pueda estudiar en la Universidad Católica de Bolivia.
Es soltera y no tiene hijos.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de  estudios superiores en la Universidad Católica de Bolivia y así poder al siguiente año trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives in the Obrajes area of the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She is a student and is getting help from her grandmother so that she can study at the Universidad Católica de Bolivia [Catholic University of Bolivia].

Alejandra is single and has no children. She is asking for a loan to pay for her college expenses, so that the next year she can work and generate her own income. 

This is the sixth loan that Alejandra has gotten through Impro, and her second loan to be financed through Kiva. Her loan history qualifies her as a top borrower, because she has been so good about repaying her loans on time.

loans.use: To pay for tuition and other college expenses at the Universidad Catolica Boliviana, in order to finish her studies.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet G. is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 44 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet has a retail store selling calamansi (citrus fruit). She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Juliet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, de 65 años, es una madre de familia muy conversadora y carismática, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo, su hija y su nieta. Amelia, después de haber trabajado por muchos años, en diversos negocios, tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir un puesto de venta dentro del mercado de su distrito.  En la que vende gaseosas, caramelos y galletas, siendo su negocio el más concurrido por sus vecinos y demás transeúntes, a quienes los atiende con mucha calidez. Cuando va de compras, para proveerse de más mercadería, su hija es quien la apoya en su negocio. Es así que lleva  5 años en esta labor que le resulta rentable, a pesar que no es muy surtida. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que se mantiene entretenida. En adelante, piensa actualizar la documentación de permiso de su puesto; por lo que se encuentran en trámites con el municipio de su distrito. Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde es muy respetada por el resto de las socias. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará más golosinas para su puesto y así continuar con su negocio.
texts.en: Amelia, 65-years-old, is a conservative and charismatic mother. She lives in her own home with her husband, her daughter, and her granddaughter. Amelia, after having worked form many years in diverse fields, had the opportunity to acquire a permanent selling station in her district's market. She sells sodas, candy, and cookies, her business being most frequented by her neighbors and passers-by, to whom she attends with much warmth. When she goes shopping to stock up her merchandise her daughter takes care of the business. She's had this business for 5 years and it's profitable even though it's not well-stocked. What she likes most about her business is that it keeps her entertained. She hoping to update her selling permit; she's currently dealing with this with the district's municipality. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she knows she'll make the payments on time. She'll be able to acquire another one with no problems and without bringing complications to her communal group, where she's very respected by the other members. With this loan she will increase her candy supply and continue her business.

loans.use: Purchase of more candy to stock up her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Betty; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de ropa deportiva como casacas, buzos y short, la socia tiene una tienda que atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa deportiva. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para confeccionar la ropa deportiva.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Betty belongs to the "COMUZONE I" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Betty is 34 years old, single and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making sports clothing such as jackets, track suits and shorts.  She has a store where she serves from 9.00am to 6.00pm.  Through her business, Betty gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her business selling sports clothing.

Betty is requesting this loan to buy materials for making her sports clothing.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for making sports clothing

loans.name: Try's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is being requested by four members who are located in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province. The group selected Mrs. Try M.,  who is 43 years old, as the group leader. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. 
 
Mrs. Try M. and her husband, Mr. Choek Chi, are farmers who own 3 hectares of land where they cultivate corn and rice.  They are in need of some money to grow crops. So Mrs. Try M. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her farming crops. The couple works hard on the farm to support three children: Two attend the local school and the youngest one is 5 years old and not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Martha María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Jorge de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Jorge.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, ella tiene  24 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de seis y un año de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela, vive en la casa de sus padres. Hace varios años estudio corte y confección en  la Academia María Auxiliadora de la ciudad de Portoviejo.
 
Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa de todo tipo, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora uniformes de  escuelas y colegios de la localidad en épocas de entrada de clases. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace ya tres años y le gusta por los beneficios y la ayuda que brinda la institución a personas como ella. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde también pueda vender sus obras.
texts.en:
In the community of San Jorge within the beautiful city of Portoviejo there are green mountains and enchanting landscapes. The members of the San Jorge Communal Bank meet in this place every fifteen days.

It is here one can find Sra. Martha. She is 24 years old and a single mother of two children (ages 6 and 1). Her older child is in school. Martha lives at her parents’ house. Several years ago she studied sewing and dressmaking at the María Auxiliadora Academy in the city of Portoviejo.

Martha has a small sewing workshop where she has spent many years making clothes of all types. She works according to orders from individuals and also makes uniforms for the local elementary and high schools at the beginning of the school year. Martha works every day from 6am to 10pm and sometimes later whenever she has orders to deliver.

This new loan will be used to buy fabrics and other materials for sewing. She has been already been with her Communal Bank for three years and has enjoyed the benefits and the assistance provided by the Institution to people like her. Her dreams include having a larger workshop and a store in the middle of the city where she can sell her creations.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & materials for sewing

loans.name: Soum's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight members located in Khsom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Soum B. was selected as village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Soum B. is a grocery seller who earns a small income to support her family. In order to increase her income and improve the family’s living conditions, she is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Sam Thol, is a pig breeder who earns a small income to add to his wife's savings to support his family. This couple has four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other three are students who also help out with their parents' businesses.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to expand her business

loans.name: María Ermitania

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su  hijo en el distrito la Matanza ubicado en la Provincia de Morrropon que pertenece a la región Piura, que se ubica a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo capital de la Región de la Lambayeque.

María trabaja como empleada en la Municipalidad de su distrito desde hace tres años, donde posee buenas referencias personales y laborales. Gracias a esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia. 

María desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda de modo que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old and lives with her husband and son in the district of Matanza located in the province of Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region.  This is about four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

María has worked as an employee of the city for three years and has good personal and work references.  Thanks to this activity she is able to help her husband take care of family household expenses.

María wants to make some home improvements so her family can enjoy better living conditions.  For the first time she has requested a loan in the amount of 1500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For home improvement

loans.name: Reychard

texts.en:
Reychard E. is from the village of Calaocan, located in Angadanan Town, Isabela Province. He is 21 years old, is married, and has an infant. He has just started a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily-use products in the local community.

In 2011, Reychard joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be Reychard's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI) is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to have access to working capital

loans.name: Aisalkyn's Group

texts.en:
Aisalkyn K. is 62 years old and a leader of this group. She is one of those early birds, who catch the worm before others do. In spite her age Aisalkyn still devotes much time and energy to her farming. Aisalkyn and her husband, a pensioner, live on their own while the youngest of their three children helps in the household. They live in Tup, a rural area that does not have any industry or trade potential. Instead, the major occupations for local residents are agriculture and cattle breeding. The farmers cultivate not only traditional vegetables, fruits, and grain crop, but also try to innovate new exotic types of agricultural products. Aisalkyn, along with other group members, is getting ready to begin spring fieldwork. She grows mainly vegetables in large amounts, because she was fortunate to acquire a large plot of land in 1996. Large profits are gained in fall, when the harvest is gathered. Her monthly income is 3,000 soms. Aisalkyn led this group in applying for this loan because she needs funds to purchase potato seeds for the upcoming season. 

        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.en: I Ketut T. W., 51 years old, has been married almost 30 years. His wife, Ni Nyoman Maria Coa, is a housewife who has a stall business. I Ketut T. W. has four children. The first child is married and the other three children are still living with him. I Ketut T. W. gets a loan from MUK for Rp. 5,000,000 one female cow with a price of Rp. 5,000,000. He plans to breed cattle with an injectable mating system. A cow is pregnant for nine months and gives birth to only one calf. After four months, the calf can be sold for Rp. 2,000,000. In addition to income from gardening, I Ketut T. W. hopes to raise cattle to help alleviate the expenses needed to cover their children's education.

loans.use: to buy one female cow

loans.name: Sanabar's Group

texts.en:
Sanabar M. is the leader of this group. She is 50 and married, her husband is a pensioner. Together they bring up a daughter, who studies at school. In order to earn money Sanabar takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets, cloth and dressmaking supplies.  A year ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms Sanabar began to sell groceries.  In this way she earns additional 1000 soms per month. The family also breeds livestock animals.  With money received from the loan Sanabar wants to purchase more sheep in order to increase the number of livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep in order to increase the number of livestock.

loans.name: Norma  Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Norma es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora ella esta casada con el Sr. Santiago y juntos  atienden   la tienda de abarrotes  que  tienen,  en esta  ocasión solicitan el préstamo ya que les gustaría comprar mercancía para así poder proporcionarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes  y  una  gran variedad  de  productos, al  mismo tiempo  obtendran  mayores  ingresos  y  podrán ofrecer  mejores  condiciones  de  vida  a  sus  pequeños  hijos  los  cuales  son lo mas  importante  en su   vida.
texts.en: Norma is a very responsible and hard-working person.  She is married to Santiago and together they work in the grocery store that they own.  On this occasion, they are requesting a loan as they would like to buy merchandise so that they can provide their customers with a better service and a wide variety of products.  This will enable them to make more income and provide their young children, who are the most important things in their life, with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Celmit

texts.es:
La Sra. Celmith pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Paz II” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia  y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y tiene  04 hijos;  tres ya cuentan con familia propia solo el menor D. 14 años está en el nivel secundario.

Ante la necesidad D. generar sus propios ingresos iniciò su negocio D. venta D. jugos,  actividad  que no le generaba muchas ganancias  y  contando tan solo con  un capital D. S/.300.00 deciD. vender mercería, pasamanería, (productos D. uso personal) haciéndose muy rápidamente D. muy buena clientela por su carisma y buena atención.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/.  1500.00, comprará: espejos, peines,  linternas, gel para cabello, jaboneras, hebillas, todo ellos en docenas para así surtir su mercadería y dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Celmit  es una mujer emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con una tienda mayorista y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Celmith belongs to the communal bank "Maria Paz II" of the district of Tarapoto, in the province and department of San Martin. She is single, 42 years old, and she has 4 children. Three of them have a family of their own and the youngest is 14 years old and he is in high school.

When she saw the need to generate her own income she started up a business selling juices. This business activity did not generate much income and while she had a capital fund of only S/.300 she decided to open a sewing notions store and personal accessories (personal use products). She quickly earned a very good clientele for her charisma and her good client service.

This loan is in the amount of S/. 1500 and she will purchase: mirrors, combs, flash lights, hair gel, soap dispensers, and belt buckles. She will acquire everything by the dozens to supply herself of merchandise and to proviD. her clients with good service.

Celmith is an enterprising woman. Her dream is to become a wholesaler. She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for helping women like herself to realize their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase mirrors, combs, flash lights, hair gel, soap dispensers, and belt buckles, by the dozens.

loans.name: Rasmiah

texts.en:
Rasmiah is a 59-year-old widow. All of her sons have married except her youngest, 19-year-old Odai, who is still living with her. After her husband passed away, Rasmiah opened a small market at her house to have another income for her family beside her husband’s retirement salary. She takes on shifts with her youngest son to work there. 

Now Rasmiah has applied for a loan to buy more products and goods for her market to improve her business and to serve as many people in the area as she can. 

Since Rasmiah is a conservative person, she has agreed that her son appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more products and goods for her food market

loans.name: Valid

texts.en:
Valid is 28 and a married man. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family.  Valid owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of seasonal fruits and vegetables, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand.  

His monthly income is 250 USD which is very low to cover family needs.  This business is the only source of income in his family. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizer. The loan will greatly improve Valid’s income and his family's living standard.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en: Emelinda is 54 years old and a widow with five children. She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Emelinda requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Emelinda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 29-year-old single lady who has a high school diploma. Because she wanted to have an income source, Lisa started a year ago a small home-business selling home products as shown in the picture.

Now Lisa wants to expand the business to include other types of home products based on her customers needs, and to do so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add more home products to her inventory.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 30 year old married lady with three children living in her own house in Fort Portal ,Uganda. She takes care of the family with the help of her husband who is a veterinary doctor. Jane has been selling agricultural products such as pestcides for six years, but her major constraint has been lack of capital to supply the vast market. Jane needs the loan to buy farm supplies like pestcides for resale.

loans.use: To buy  farm supplies like pesticides for resale.

loans.name: Turdububu's Group

texts.en:
Turdububu is the leader of this group. She is 74 years old and unfortunately she is a widow. With an initial investment of 5,000 soms three years ago, Turdububu started to breed livestock with the help of her son. She resells livestock at a higher price after fattening them, and in this way she earns about 1,500 soms per month. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase hay to feed her livestock. In the future she wants to give a good education to her grandchildren. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for feeding livestock

loans.name: Ikhtilat

texts.en:
Ikhtilat is a 51-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and three children. 

He has one milk cow and several cattle and calves. Ikhtilat sells meat and dairy products to local traders. Ikhtilat has 10 years of experience in raising cattle. His milk products are in very high demand in his village.  

His monthly income from dairy and meat production is 200 USD. His wife earns a 150 USD salary as a cleaner in one of the local firms. 

Ikhtilat’s orders for his products are very high, but the milk his cow gives and the meat from cattle are not enough for traders, so he has decided to apply for a loan of 700 AZN to purchase an additional cow. He has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn is 36 years old and is married to a construction worker. She is a weaver and she also sells baskets to earn 5 USD a day. Her husband earns 4 USD daily. Chanthorn has four children, two of whom are studying and two who are too young for school. Each month, she has to spend 63 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 15 USD on schools fees, 5 USD on transportation and 10 USD on other expenses.

Chanthorn is requesting a 600 USD loan to buy baskets from her villagers to sell in Phnom Penh where she can make good profit. Chanthorn's goal is to send all of her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy baskets to sell

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Né à Sikasso il y’a 32 ans, Monsieur Ibrahima est un célibataire vivant chez ses parents dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, il s’est très vite initié à cette activité de coiffure des hommes depuis plus de six ans. Nanti de ces années d’expériences dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes de matériels de salon de coiffure et divers, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces demandes fait défaut; ainsi il décida alors d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est actuellement à son quatrième prêt individuel, après des remboursements corrects des prêts précédents. 
Ainsi, ce quatrième prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  6 nouvelles tondeuses, 8 paires de peignes  et brosses, 6 bidons d’eau de Javel, 6 bouteilles d’alcool de 90°, 6 cartons de déodorants, 15 cartons de savons Pharmapure, deux douzaines de parfums de différentes qualités et 2 cartons d’insecticide Timor. Les articles sont achetés à Bamako (la capitale du Mali) essentiellement utilisés pour son salon de coiffure  situé au bord de la route R.N.7 avec une clientèle composée  essentiellement de jeunes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 240 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is 32 years old, and was born in Sikasso. He is single and lives with his parents in a large, traditional extended family in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

Because he didn't have the opportunity to continue his schooling, Ibrahima quickly started working as a barber over six years ago. Because of his long experience, he has an excellent reputation and orders plenty of salon and other supplies, but he doesn't have the resources necessary to meet demand. For this reason, he decided to join micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is currently on his fourth individual loan, the previous loans have all been fully repaid. 

This fourth loan will allow him to buy 6 new clippers, 8 sets of brushes and combs, 6 barrels of bleach, 6 bottles of 90° alcohol, 6 boxes of deodorants, 15 boxes of Pharmapure soap, 2 dozen assorted perfumes and 2 boxes of Timor  insecticide. Ibrahima buys his supplies in Bamako (Mali's capital) for use in his salon located along the R.N. 7 main road. His customers are mostly young people.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 240,000 CFA francs. With the  profit he makes, he plans to be able to meet most of his own and his family's expenses, pay the interest on the loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his salon.

loans.name: Gladys Ann

texts.en:
Gladys Ann is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Gladys Ann has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fish to sell.

Gladys Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gladys Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Milton Camilo

texts.es:
Milton de 21 años, un joven adulto emprendedor que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de negocio.
Su actividad es la venta de mercadería como ropa de hombres y de mujeres, perfumes, entre otros.
Esta actividad la escogió ya que necesitaba ayudar a su familia.
Solo promociona su mercadería a conocidos y amigos.
Su horario es lunes a domingos, desde las 10:00am hasta las 16:00pm.
No está casado y no tiene hijo.
Solicita el préstamo para la  compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, varillas, ladrillos para poder mejorar su casa y tener un lugar donde vender la mercaderia. 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive con sus padres y que pueda terminar sus estudios universitarios para ser un profesional.
texts.en:
21 year old Milton is a young adult entrepreneur who aspires to grow his business.
His business is buying and selling goods such as men's and women's clothing, perfumes, and other things.
He chose this work because he needed to help his family.
He only promotes his goods to acquaintances and friends.
He works Monday through Sunday from 10:00am until 4:00pm.
He isn't married and he doesn't have any children.
He is requesting the loan to buy construction materials such as: cement, rebar, and bricks so that he can improve his house and have a place to sell his goods. 
His dream is to have his own home as he lives with his parents and to finish his university studies so that he can be a professional.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, and bricks.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Pilar

texts.es: Xiomara Del Pilar es madre de 2 hijos, una mujer emprendedora que trabaja día a día con la ilusión de sacar a su familia adelante, por lo que decidió comenzar su propio negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, tiene mercancía a la venta en su casa para las noches y los fines de semana. Con el propósito de sacar su negocio adelante quiere comprar calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, tratamientos entre otros productos que sus clientes requieren, pero no cuenta con el capital para invertirle a su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual hará dichas compras.
texts.en: Xiomara Del Pilar is the mother of two children.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who works every day with the hope of getting her family ahead in life.  She decided to start her own business so that she could help her husband with their household expenses.  Xiomara sells general merchandise.  She sells merchandise from her home in the evenings and at weekends.  With the aim of making progress in her business, she would like to buy footwear, clothes, cosmetics, treatments and other products that her customers need.  However, she does not have the capital she needs to invest in her business and so she is requesting a loan with which to make these purchases.

loans.use: to buy footwear, clothes, cosmetics and treatments

loans.name: Miyekwe Care Group

texts.en:
Joseph is the facilitator of Miyekwe Care group. Joseph and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With the income from maize sales, Joseph will invest in buying a cow and then build a house. 

In 2012, the members of Miyekwe Care group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: Raymundo, de 18 años es un joven responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Juliana, su papá Fortunato y su hermano Gabriel en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Los Libertadores de Huari. Como buen hijo, él trabaja para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y también para ahorrar en su futuro. De lunes a viernes durante todo el día, trabaja en una mina de cobre por su localidad. Ahí percibe un salario mensual que le permite mantener la estabilidad de su hogar. Además cría carneros, vacas, llamas y alpacas, la actividad económica de su familia. Cuenta que en temporadas de escases, cuando no tiene trabajo, es la venta de sus animales lo que le brinda el soporte económico que necesita. Su principal meta es aumentar la cantidad de sus animales, pues ahí tiene ahorrado el capital que requiere para abrir un negocio propio. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “galpón al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Raymundo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 10 ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Raymundo, age 18, is a responsible young man. He lives with his mother, Juliana; his father, Fortunato; and his brother, Gabriel, in their own home in Los Libertadores de Huari. Like a good son, he works in order to help out with the household costs and also to save up for his future. He works all day, Monday to Friday, in a local copper mine. He receives a stable monthly salary for his household. He and his family also raise rams, cows, llamas, and alpacas. He says that in times of shortages, when he doesn't have work, the sales of their animals provides the economic income that his family needs. His main goal is to increase the number of animals that they have. He has some money saved up to open his own business.
He belongs to the “Galpón al éxito” communal bank, and this is his first loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support that he is receiving; this will allow him to move forward with his business. He promises to be punctual with the payment of his quotas. The members of his bank are responsible and united.
Upon receiving your support, Raymundo will invest in the purchase of 10 sheep to increase their flock.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep.

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr:
Monsieur El Hadji est chauffeur depuis 25 ans .Il est marié et père de 6 enfants. Il est âgé de 50 ans et ne connait  pratiquement  que le transport
Avec le crédit il veut réfectionner son véhicule taxi : changer  les portes, les ailes, les feux, les amortisseurs.
Monsieur El Hadji a une grande famille mais avec le revenu de ses  taxis il arrive à subvenir à leur besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
El Hadji is 50 years old, married and the father of 6 children. He has been a driver for 25 years and cannot imagine earning a living any other way. He will use this loan to repair his taxi and get the doors, wings, lights and shocks absorbers replaced.

El Hadji has a large family but the income from his taxi service allows him to take care of their daily needs.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Tolohoun Lache Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TOLOHOUN LACHE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sidikatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sidikatou est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Sidikatou a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Sidikatou est mariée à un certain Imourou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidikatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les charges de la maison. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la maison, Sidikatou vend depuis sept ans, des oignons et des piments dans un marché du Bénin. Sidikatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sidikatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TOLOHOUN LACHE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Tolohoun Lache group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, in order to elevate the level of their business.

The representative of the group, by the name of Sidikatou, is the one who has her hand raised in the photo. Sidikatou is 42 years old and lives in Bénin. Sidikatou stopped school at the primary level. Sidikatou is married to a certain Imourou. The couple has three dependent children who are all in school. Sidikatou lives together with her husband and her children. The couple shares the household responsibilities.

In order to take care of the diverse household responsibilities, Sidikatou has been selling onions and hot peppers in a market of Bénin for seven years. Sidikatou gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. 

In seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her turnover and her income, Sidikatou is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Tolohoun Lache group. The first three loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions and hot peppers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is married and has two children. He describes himself as an honest and ambitious man. He runs a butcher shop and sells meat. He has been in this business for the last four years. His business challenge is the high cost of meat when buying it. He will be using the loan of  KES 20,000 to buy more meat. In the next five years, Paul plans and dreams to venture into a new business in the vehicle industry.

loans.use: To buy more meat.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea, aged 34, is married and lives with her husband and three school-aged children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running a pub, which sells all kinds of drink and food, for over six years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a construction foreman. In order to improve her family's economy, Sophea is requesting a loan of USD1200 to run a new business by purchasing groceries to sell to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell to generate more income

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en: Pha, originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 43 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She deals with the basic needs in her household via pineapple growing and her paid-working job, which earns her about 36,000 KHR per day. This is not a first loan for Pha and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pineapple seedlings. She hopes that she can make a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pineapple seedlings

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man, aged 32 years and  living in Kagadi, Uganda, where he has operated a bakery business since 2005, alongside farming, to generate funds to meet his family and personal demands. 

He is challenged by inadequate capital and a poor transport network hindering transportation of his products to the market, but through determination, he hopes to stablise his business and expand his business into new markets. Stephen is asking for a loan  to buy baking ingredients like salt, sugar, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients like salt, sugar, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan Q. was born in Vinces, Ecuador. He is a forty-year-old married man who also owns a small restaurant. His cooks up specialties like encebollado and lunch dishes like seco de pollo (chicken stew with rice) and lomo salteado (thinly cut beef with onions and tomatoes). Encebollado is a favorite in Ecuador because of the incredible mix of ingredients, including albacore tuna, onions, yucca, and lime, but also because of its hangover-curing powers. Juan works every day from 6am until 3pm, serving local clients who stop in for a hearty lunch. He is asking for this $800 microloan, so that he can purchase cooking items like spices and utensils. Also, Mr. Q. wants to be free of the “chulqueros” or loan sharks who generally charge 20% monthly. Juan wants potential lenders to know that he is very hard-working and entrepreneurial. He recognizes the opportunity in front of him and has agreed to pay back his loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: He is asking for this $800 microloan, so that he can purchase cooking items like spices and utensils.

loans.name: Sovkat

texts.en: Sovkat is originally from the Lerik district, in the Southern region of Azerbaijan. She is a low-income person, who is married, and has children. She opened her business in 1999 with her own money. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times from Normicro in the total amount of $1,400 and expanded her business. Now she wants to borrow an additional $1,000 to increase the variety of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase business goods variety

loans.name: Aomalu

texts.en: Aomalu operates a flea market stall in the local town market.  The market is located two hours from where she lives, and the journey back and forth is both taxing and expensive.  Aomalu has fallen on hard times because in addition to the expense of hiring transport for her and her crop, her yield has been low due to a series of disasters that have befallen her orange grove.  She is confident that one thing that will help protect her crop from stray animals and theft is building a barrier fence.  She has requested a loan to help her achieve this goal, thereby protecting a valuable income stream for Aomalu’s family.

loans.use: Fencing material

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi married during the Pol Pot regime and has 4 sons and 3 daughters. She has never been to school. Her husband passed away over 10 years ago. She is currently growing vegetables. Two of her sons have been transporting passengers for 8 years and her daughter is working in a garment factory. They are polite and well loved by their neighbors.

Yi would like to borrow $150 from MAXIMA to buy a new bicycle-carriage for her son. She hopes her son can carry more people and provide safer transportation for the passengers. This family has no problem paying back their loans because they have a regular income.

loans.use: Growing rice and purchasing a motorbike-carriage.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en: Ofelya A., her husband and daughter live in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. She has been operating a small clothes store in the middle of Beylagan for 15 years.  She mostly sells women's clothes. Her husband helps her to sell. Ofelya needs $600 to purchase more kind of goods and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 27-year-old, single woman who lives in the area of Chyah in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. She is a beautician and offers her services to neighboring clients. Amal benefited from technical training in beauty techniques and is able to offer a large variety of services to her clients -- manicures, make up, tattoos, etc. She doesn't limit herself to light esthetic's, because she has the skills to undertake more complicated tasks requested by women. Amal, a very smart and ambitious woman, is striving to become financially independent from her parents who live with limited revenues. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory of beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase of a large inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a small entrepreneur owning a shop in the central market. She is not married and has two children ages 7 and 9 years. Anna is thirsty for development for the benefit of her family and society. This is Anna's second loan request with SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a refrigerator. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr:
Born in 1982 in Djakotomé, Benin, Mr Paul N. currently lives in Amégnran, Togo where he is a motocycle mechanic. He is married and the father of two (2) children. To build his business, he requests a loan of $200 to buy himself tools and replacement parts in order to have sufficient stock to satisfy his clientele.
