Mr N. is recognized in the area for his fine service and fair business ethics.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1982 à Djakotomé (RB), Monsieur N. Paul vit actuellement à Amégnran où il est mécanicien à 2 roues. Il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un financement de $200 pour s’acheter des matériels de travail et des pièces de rechanges afin de pouvoir disposer d’un stock acceptable et satisfaire sa clientèle. Monsieur N. est reconnu dans le milieu de par ses prestations de service et jouit d’une bonne moralité.

loans.use: To buy tools and replacement parts

loans.name: Katogo B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old and married with six children. The husband is a builder. Jane offers tailoring services. She wants to use the extra business profits to pay back the loan and expand the tailoring business. Sarah is a poultry farmer while Solome sells raw foods in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Mr Z. Kodzo is 48 years old, married and father of six (06) children. He has a tapestry workshop located in the centre of Adéta for the last 12 years. He wants with this current loan to acquire a second sewing machine that will allow him to better serve his clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Z. Kodzo est âgé de 48 ans , marié et père de 6 enfants. Il a un atelier de tapisserie installé au centre ville d’Adéta depuis 12 ans. Il veut acquérir avec le présent crédit une deuxième machine à coudre qui va lui permettre de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine to build his business

loans.name: Anita Elizabeth

texts.es:
Anita belongs to the Community Bang 'Las Margaritas', located at 898 Pachitea St. in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and the mother of 3 children: her husband is a moto-taxi driver. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, of 300 Soles, Anita decided to invest in a clothes-selling business.

Currently, she has established this business, and gets up at 7am in order to prepare breakfast for her children and husband: she then carries out her household chores and in the afternoons she goes out to sell her merchandise.

With this loan of 1500 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy: a dozen pairs of trousers, a dozen blouses, a dozen polo-shirts, a dozen T-shirts, underwear for men, women and children etc.

Anita is very happy, her business is expanding and already she more customers every day and this is increasing her income, much to the satisfaction of her and her family who are very proud of her and thank Manuela Ramos for the help given in starting-up the business.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Anita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Jr Pachitea No 898, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Anita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de ventas ropas.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropas, se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a los que haceres domésticos y en las tardes sale a ofrecer su mercadería.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: 1 docena de pantalones, 1 docena de blusas, 1 docena de polos, 1 docena de camisas, ropas interiores de damas, caballeros y niños, etc.

Anita esta muy contenta, su negocio esta mejorando, ya que sus clientes son cada día mas y esto aumenta sus ingresos, para satisfacción de ella y de su familia que esta muy orgullosa de ella y le agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo dado para su negocio.

loans.use: Use loan to purchase more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Q., 28 years old, lives with her husband, 31, and two small children in Lương Bằng, Hưng Yên. Her family business is selling construction materials. Two years ago, when the demand for construction in the area starts higher, she made a loan and together with her own saving she started this business. The business is booming, the family’s economy improves significantly. Her average monthly income is about 220-250USD. She would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Vũ Thị Q. sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Hưng Yên. Chị Q. năm nay 28 tuổi còn chồng chị 31 tuổi. Ngành nghề kinh doanh chính của gia đình là buôn bán nguyên vật liệu xây dựng. Cách đây 2 năm khi thấy nhu cầu xây dựng trong vùng tăng cao, chị Q. đã xin vay mức vốn lớn từ Quỹ kết hợp với nguồn vốn tự có buôn xi măng, sắt thép ... Hiện nay thu nhập hàng tháng của cửa hàng từ 220-250USD. Kinh tế phát triển giúp chị Q. có điều kiện chăm sóc 2 con được cẩn thận hơn. Chị cũng sắm sửa được thêm nhiều vật dụng có giá trị trong nhà. Hiện tại, khi đã quen với các mối làm ăn, điều cần thiết nhất với chị Q. lúc này là có thêm nhiều vốn đầu tư mua hàng. Với mục tiêu đó, vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 950USD mở rộng sản xuất.

loans.use: Buy cement, iron, steel to resell

loans.name: Rano's Group

texts.en:
Rano K. H., wife of K. H., lives in the city of Vehari, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son makes plastic shoes and she would like to apply for a loan to invest in the opening of her son's shoe business. She hopes that if she get a good profit from her investiment, she will be able to admit her last son into a good school.

Her group members include: Khalida B., who wants to start a grocery shop; Saba Bibi, who wants to repair her rickshaw; Kaneez B., who wants to buy cotton for her business; and Kalsoom B., who wants to expand her grocery business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in a shoe business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena is 25 years old. She lives in the neighborhood Hills of the Memorial Sandino in Managua. She is married and has a 5-year-old girl. Her husband works as a welder and together they fight to maintain their family.

Maria Magdalena sells cosmetics and clothing on foot. She has two years of experience. She started only selling clothes with her own funds. With the money that she is requesting she plans to increase inventory and to offer her possible products to a greater variety of clients. Her future plans are to enter in the sale of another line of products, as well as also to be able to build a house with her husband for their family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Magdalena tiene 25 años de edad, habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino en Managua, es casada y tiene una niña de 5 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja desempeñándose como soldador y juntos luchan por mantener a su familia.

Maria Magdalena vende de forma ambulante cosméticos y ropa tiene dos años de experiencia, ella inició sólo vendiendo ropa con fondos propios. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para incrementar inventario y ofertar a sus clientes la mayor varieda de productos posibles. Sus planes futuros son incursionar en la venta de otra líena de productos, así como también poder construir una casa junto a su esposo para su familia.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Angela Presciliana

texts.es:
Angela Presciliana is married, 48 years old and studied through the 2nd year of high school. She has 4 children. Two are independent, working in Lima. The other two are students, one in primary school, the other in secondary. She lives in the disctrict of Moche in Trujillo, La Libertad. She runs a small restaurant out of her home where she sells smoked fish and roasted goat. Her cousin invited her to join the Grupo Mientras Tanto LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ. With her first loan for 300 Sols she purchased kitchen equipment, ladles and sauce pans used to prepare her various dishes. Her business employs a few workers from Moche who run the kitchens. She also fills special orders for parties. With a loan for 500 Soles she plans to purchase rice, sauces and cooking oil to support her business. Her goals are to improve her home, educate her children and to someday open another restaurant in Moche.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Ángela Presciliana etá casada, tiene 48 años y estudió hasta 2do año de secundaria, tiene 04 hijos, 02 son independientes, trabajan en Lima y 02 son estudiantes del nivel primario y secundario respectivamente. En su casa, en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene un pequeño restaurant, en el cual empezó a vender sudado de pescado y cabrito. Su sobrina la invitó a participar en el Grupo Mientras Tando “LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ”, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió, compró cucharones, un par de ollas, etc. lo cual usa para preparar comidas variadas. A su negocio acuden algunos trabajadores del Municipio de Moche y los que laboran en la chacra. También atiende pedidos para celebraciones. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, tiene pensado comprar arroz, menestras, aceite para el negocio. Tiene como meta, mejorar su casa, educar a sus hijos y llegar a tener otro restaurant en Moche.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale supplies

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón is 53 years old. For the past 17 years he has been together with Norma, who is 39 years old. They have two grown up children. Ramón began working at a very young age in the Abasto municipal market in the capital city selling fruits. He dedicated himself to this work for 13 years, until later with much effort and sacrifice he was able to begin his own business selling drinks and food. Along with this activity, he entertains his clients with video games, with which he also earns money.

He tells us his business is going very well, and at the moment he has an excellent clientele, who are very satisfied with the service that Ramón offers them.

Ramón is a sacrificing person, and he wants to improve his family's life with his effort and dedication. On this occasion, he is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of ingredients with which he would be able to make all sorts of food like empanadas, asaditos (cubed BBQ meat), milanesas (a breaded steak dish), and also to buy various drinks like soda pops, beers, and juices among others.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramón tiene 53 años, está en pareja hace 17 años con Norma de 39 años de edad, tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad.

Ramón comenzó desde muy joven a trabajar en el mercado municipal de Abasto de la ciudad capital como vendedor de frutas. Durante 13 años se dedicó a tal actividad, hasta que luego de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logró montar su propio negocio de venta de bebidas y comestibles. A la par de dicha actividad también entretiene a sus clientes con video-juegos, también cobrando por dichos juegos.

Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio y que actualmente tiene una muy buena clientela, quienes se encuentran muy satisfechos con el servicio que Ramón les ofrece.

Ramón es una persona muy sacrificada y ha logrado sacar adelante a toda su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

En esta ocasión desea un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes con los cuales podrá elaborar todo tipo de comestibles como: empanadas, asaditos, milanesas y además comprar bebidas varias como gaseosas, cervezas, jugos entre otros.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables like tomatoes, onions, chilies, lettuce, carrots, and various drinks.

loans.name: Resty Kayondo's Group

texts.en:
Resty is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 45 year divorced with one daughter aged 30 years. She resides and owns a three roomed house where she is staying with four people. Resty takes care of her mother There is electricity and piped water at her home.
The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Resty sells News Papers and operates public pay phone in Bwaise one of the city suburbs She sells to an average of 50 people a day, and works six days a week. Resty's major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and medication. Resty uses bicycles to and from home to work. She has been in this business for ten years.
Resty's main challenges include rainy season which disturbs her a lot and overcomes it by using umbrellas .Resty  has been with MCDT for over five years and servicing her eighth loan working all this long with the same group mates She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business and acquire more  telephone booth. 
.

loans.use: To deal in various newspapaers and airtime

loans.name: Chit

texts.en:
Mrs. Chit C., age 31, is married and has two children, ages 6 and 14, who are enrolled in school. She started a business in 2002 selling a variety of vegetables in the market. She earns at least $3.50/day in revenue from her business. 

Her husband is motor-taxi driver who transports passengers to different locations in the town, earning around $5/day for his household. 

To make her business more profitable, Mrs. Chit C. would like to request a loan from KIVA via CREDIT MFI to expand her inventory. With the rest of the money, she will use to buy a new motorbike for her husband, because his current motorbike is frequently broken and costs her family a lot of money.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Silvio J., casado, habita junto a su familia en la Cmca. Mazapia-Tecolostote, San Lorenzo, y junto a su esposa y por esfuerzo propio se dedican a la produccion de 4 Mzs de arroz como  parte de este sector es socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza y atraves de esta tiene la oportunidad de accesar como socio del proyecto de trillo arocero que le permitira reducir sus costos de produccion y la obtencion de in ingreso adicional, lo que le permitira mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar, su sueño es ser parte de la sociedad de este trillo, que seguro le permitira garantizar mejor futuro a su familia y la comunidad.
texts.en:
Señor Silvio J. is married and lives with his family in Mazapia-Tecolostote in San Lorenzo. Together with his wife and through his own effort, they produce rice on 4 manzanas (6.92 acres) of land. He is a member of the cooperative "La Esperanza," and through it, he has the opportunity to become a member of a project that will build a rice thresher. This will allow him to reduce his production costs and obtain additional income, which will let him improve his family's living conditions. His dream is to be part of this project, which will surely guarantee a better future for his family and his community.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support 30% of the construction of a rice thresher in La Peña

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza C. is just 20 years old; but despite her youthful age, she aspires to have better life for her parents and siblings. She is a typical daughter from Polomolok South Cotabato who found herself joining other entrepreneur hopefuls in the CEVI credit program.

She sells second-hand shoes, earning for her enough for her family needs. She works hard like a head of the family to make sure that they will have enough food to share in their table.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI to purchase more second-hand shoes to sell. “ Being young doesn’t stop me to hope and dream for my family, I joined CEVI because I see that they really lift up poor people like us who want to change their lives’, she said. “ My participation in the program entitled me easy access to credit assistance, training and insurance coverage of CEVI. This really is something that I was so happy about considering that I really need assistance to grow my business, she added.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand shoes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ray

texts.en: Ray C., 46, is married with no children.  He has many years experience in the vegetable garden business. He sells to the general public and villagers six days per week.  He is also a good florist and makes money from this talent as well. Ray has had five previous loans with SPBD, which are his only access to capital because he has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. He plans to purchase Gromoxone and sting for his vegetable garden business.  The remainder of his loan will be used for purchasing iron roofing and sacks of cement for his house.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone and sting for vegetable garden business

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is engaged in planting and selling vegetables, which are mostly eggplants harvested from their own back yard. To improve her business, Rogelia would like to ask for financial support amounting to PHP10,000. She will use the loan to buy different kinds of vegetables in the public market which she will sell in their village. She only goes to the market twice or thrice a week, since they have a limited access to transportation. Part of the loan will also be used to buy a variety of vegetable seeds which she will plant in their back yard. Through her business, she can help her husband in meeting the needs of their family and somehow uplift their lives.

She is aware that she is getting old and while she has the strength, she will do her best for their family. Her husband Valeriano is a farmer and they both work as laborers when they are not busy with their own businesses for additional income. They have poor living conditions and keep struggling to live a better way. Their five children are: Rocky – 25 years old, a vocational course graduate; Conrado – 22 years old, grade four; Lorvy – 19 years old, high school graduate; Marlito – 17 years old, who never had the chance to study and Rubelyn – 9 years old, currently in grade two.

They live in a mountainous village of Cabisera in Isabela province. Despite poverty, they manage to have a good relationship in the family and are all hoping to have a progressive life.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Jane

texts.es: La señora Jane tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia con sus 2 hijos quienes la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su casa donde constituyó una pequeña bodega, la misma que lo tiene desde hace un año. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a muchas personas, y le es rentable porque es la única bodega en la cuadra donde vive. Posteriormente quiere poner un lavadero de motos y autos en las afueras de su domicilio, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada. Ya son 3 veces que está recibiendo un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta el trabajo que hace con su banco comunal, con el que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, leche, etc.) y sobre todo ampliará su el espacio de su bodega, ya que está aumentando la demanda de sus productos.
texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 2 children, who support her a lot. She sells grocery products and items of necessity in her house, where she built a small grocery store, which she has had for a year. What Jane likes about her work is that she meets many people, and it is profitable because it's the only grocery store on the block where she lives. Later, she wants to instal a carwash outside her house, as she lives in a very busy zone. This is the third time that Jane has received a loan from MFP, and she likes the work that she does with her communal bank, where she is punctual with her payments. With the money that she is seeking this time, Jane will buy more items of necessity (sugar, rice, milk etc) and above all will increase the space in her grocery store, now that demand for her products is growing.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand grocery store and buy groceries

loans.name: Grime Pastora

texts.es:
la Sra. Grime F. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion y opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia GEMELAS, esto le permite no descuidar su hogar y asi trabaja todo el dia, ya que su pulperia la abre desde las 6:00am y la cierra a las 10:00pm, ella tiene 12 años de tener su negocio, el cual esta muy agracedida con todas las personas que le ayudaron a salir adelante durante todos estos duros y largos años. se nota que ella a sabido administrar muy bien su negocio, sus clientes la prefieren ya que ella es muy especial con ellos, su trato y lo que mas les gusta a los clientes es el precio que vende los productos que es muy apto para la economia de su comunidad, ahi la mayoria de la gente es de escasos recursos.
ella es madre de dos hijas y su compañero de hogar es propietario de una fabrica de bloques para construccion que esta ubicada en la aldea de Ojo de Agua.
juntos los dos salen adelante y logran cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar, pero ahorita necesita surtir mas su negocio, hacerlo mas grande para poder dar una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Grime F. is a businesswoman and sells popular consumer products. She runs a pulpería (small store) from her home called Pulpería GEMELAS. Because of the store’s location, she is able to work and also care for her home. Grime works all day – her store opens at 6 am and closes at 10 pm. She has owned her business for 12 years. She is thankful to all the people who have helped her be successful during these hard and long years.

Grime knows how to administer her business very well. Her clients prefer her store now that she has developed a relationship with them and treats them well. What her clients most like about her store is that the prices of her products are affordable for the members of her community, most of whom have few economic resources.

She has two children and her partner owns a cinder block factory, located in the town of Ojo de Agua. Together, they are creating a better life and are able to cover all of the household costs. However, they now need to increase their stock and expand their business, so they can provide a better service for their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lard, soap, sugar, toilet paper, sodas, canned juices, chicken, eggs, beans, butter, corn flour, cheeses, oil, churros, pastas, pills, salsas, soups, etc

loans.name: El Mamey 2 Group

texts.en:
The El Mamey Bank of Hope is a new group of micro-entrepreneurs joining Esperanza International for a loan. They live near Villa Mella, which is a large district on the northern outskirts of Santo Domingo. There, employment opportunities are scarce and life conditions are difficult. Most people have turned to self-employment to support their families. All the members of this group are Haitian immigrants.

Roselene F. is the group coordinator. She is married and has 3 children. She has a small stand where she sells fruits and vegetables, and she will use her loan to buy more items to sell. Her biggest challenge at the time is communicating. She hardly speaks any Spanish and has a hard time speaking and trying to understand her Dominican customers. She was not able to go to school either, so cannot read or write. This is a powerful reason for Roselene to work very hard to provide her children with an education that will help them embrace a future with more opportunities.

On behalf of the El Mamey Bank of Hope members and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: purchase friuts and vegetables in season for re-sale

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky  A. is a 38 year old man from Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City , Philippines. Ricky is married and lives with his 4 children. He is involved into simple traditional gold mining. Ricky wakes up early and starts his daily activity which is called " pamiling". This is the traditional way of gold mining. It uses only simple tools to look for gold along the river. At the end of the day they deliver their gold to their buyer and receive a maximum payment of PHP 200.00 per day. 

Eventually, Ricky decided to buy and sell his own gold. He required capital to start up this business and asked for support from HSPFI ( Kiva Partner) and immediately went into business. Ricky is now engaged in the buying and selling of gold. He is buying gold from the traditional miners and sells it in the city. Ricky is one of the active members of HSPFI. According to him, HSPFI greatly assisted him. This time, Ricky is soliciting his 3rd cycle loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00. This is intended for  improving his business.  He wants to buy all the gold from the traditional miners at their mine fields. In addition, he wants to purchase more equipment that will be used in the gold buying activity.He aims to earn a bigger income and someday wants to invest in a jewelry shop or a pawnshop on the mine fields.

loans.use: To purchase addtional apparatus to use for gold buying

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vu Thi
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase a grinding machine to enable her grind pepper, tomatoes and beans for her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
This is 31 year old Halima M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages of 12 and 14. Halima has run a clothes business since 2007 that sells to women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days a week. Halima earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more clothes to resell to customers. In the future she plans to open the same business in a different place. Halima thanks you for your support!

--------------------------- ABOUT SELFINA SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ana Marina

texts.es: Ana Marina O. D. P.  D. 40 años D. edad resiD. en Santa Tecla junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella posee un negocio en el mercado D. Santa Tecla en el cual comercializa carteras para dama, accesorios para el cabello, zapatos entre otras cosas más. Ana Marina es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza a diario por contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y poder obtener mayor demanda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Marina O. D. P., 40, lives in Santa Tecla with her husband and two children. She has a business in the market in Santa Tecla. She sells women’s purses, hair accessories, and shoes among other things. Ana Marina is a hard working woman. Every day she puts forth effort to contribute, along with her husband, to the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to be able to stock her store and be able to get more demand for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products for her business of selling various products

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 41, married and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Martha is a trader who sells cereals such as maize. She sells in the market square and also supplies food vendors in her community. Martha has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 North Muwanika Aisha Group

texts.en: Aisha M. is a married business lady who is 29 years old. She is blessed with four children, three of whom are going to school. She is a hardworking business lady who buys and sells cattle. She is using the loan for adding capital to her business by purchasing cattle and transporting them from villages to market place for sale. She is an active lady whose future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and transport them from villages to market place for sale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta C. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Jacinta is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Jacinta owns and operates a business buying and selling fish in the local community. Jacinta has been in business for over 34 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Jacinta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacinta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Jacinta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jacinta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda tiene su casa propia en la zona de Ciudad Satelite de la  Ciudad de El Alto; es comerciante y tiene su tienda de abarrotes, el esposo es artesano en masitas elabora salteñas, empanadas y rollos de queso que los comercializa en la tienda que tiene su esposa; es de estas actividades de donde provienen sus ingresos económicos que le permite cubrir la manutención de su familia (cuatro hijos).

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima para elaborar sus productos y también para la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
 
Es el segundo crédito vía Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Fernanda has her own home in the Ciudad Satelite district of the city of El Alto. She is a businesswoman who manages her own grocery store. Her husband is a pastry chef who makes salteñas, empanadas, and cheese rolls that are sold in Fernanda’s store. Her business provides the income that enables her to support her family of four children.

This loan will be used to purchase ingredients for her husband to make his products. She will also buy merchandise for her grocery store.

This is Fernanda’s second loan through Kiva. Her good payment history allows her to be approved for another loan.

Click HERE to view Fernanda’s previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the grocery store & ingredients for making pastries

loans.name: Aquiles Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es originario del Centro de Masaya, del barrio pancasan ubicado a orillas del mercado central. Aracelly de 19 años de edad, ubicada a la izquierda de la foto, es una joven universitaria, trabajadora y muy independiente.

Es estudiante de medicina, y como medio para costear sus gastos universitarios, vende zapatos fabricados en Masaya para enfermeras. Los distribuye en la Universidad a las estudiantes de enfermería y en algunos colegios. Su hermana le ayuda a vender puesto que tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes.

Su meta es lograr acrecentar su negocio a través de los créditos que se le faciliten. “Lo que hago es invertir más para ver más ganancias y lograr terminar mi carrera con éxito” dice Aracelly.

Tania L. hace y distribuye helados o sorbetes artesanales, de mucha demanda en la ciudad y muy famosos. Nidia
texts.en:
This group is originally from the neighborhood of Pancasan, which is located near the main market in central Masaya. Aracelly (the woman pictured on the left) is 19 years old. She is a hardworking and independent young woman.

Aracelly is a medical student. In order to pay for her education expenses, she sells nurses’ shoes that are manufactured in Masaya. She sells them to nursing students at the university and at other schools. Her sister helps with selling her products since they are in great demand by her customers.

She hopes to grow her business through the loans that have been provided. “I hope to invest more into my business so that I can earn more money and end my career (as a saleswoman) successfully,” says Aracelly.

Tania L. makes and distributes her famous ice cream and sorbets, which are in high demand throughout the city. Nidia

loans.use: Purchase additional products

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 1 And 2 Group

texts.en:
Dima is the group coordinator for Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope).  Her story is representative of the other members of her group and more generally of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients.  Dima lives in Hato Mayor, a rural part of the Dominican Republic.  She has unreliable access to running water (not potable) and electricity. Dima lives with her husband and has three grown sons.

Dima has proved to be an excellent client and has successfully repaid nine loans.  This will be her tenth loan.  She plans to use it to buy more household items to sell in her store. She sells items like pots and pans, sheets, and clothing. 

Dima's dream is to be able to construct her own house. Her house is maD. out of wood and she would like to work hard so that she can afford to build a new house out of cement. She hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she will be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Household items to sell including: pots and pans, sheets, clothing

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: A. Adèle est née en 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Adèle réside au quartier Agbato à Cotonou depuis près de quarante huit ans. Adèle est mariée à un pêcheur et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple prend ensemble en charge des dépenses de la famille. Adèle n’a jamais été à l’école. C’est pourquoi depuis une vingtaine d’année, Adèle s’est livrée à la vente de crevettes et de poissons fumés. Adèle s’approvisionne sur le lac et vend ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Adèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui est à son quatrième crédit. Adèle veut pouvoir répondre efficacement à la forte demande qu’elle enregistre de la part de sa clientèle actuellement, raison pour laquelle Adèle sollicite ce crédit pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Adèle A. was born in 1960 in Cotonou, economical capital of Benin. Adèle has lived in the Agbato neighborhood of Cotonou for nearly forty eight years. Adèle is married to a fisherman and is the mother of four children who all attend school. The couple share together the family expenses. Adèle never attended school. This is the reason why for about twenty years, Adèle has devoted herself to the sale of shrimp and smoked fish. Adèle buys her supplies at the lake and sells her products in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Adèle is a former customer of ALIDé that is on her fourth loan. Adèle wants to be able to respond effectively to the strong demand for her products from her clients, which is the reason Adèle requests this loan.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh shrimp and hot drinks for resale.

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion 2, 3, & 5 Group

texts.en:
Esperanza, 26, is a borrower who lives near L. Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Cristo L. Solucion (Christ the Solution), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Esperanza runs a successful small business selling women’s clothing to her friends and neighbors. She also specializes in shoes and slippers, which she will purchase with this, her fourth loan, from Kiva partner Esperanza International. Esperanza came to Esperanza International because she wanted more comfortable payments with lower interest than she could find elsewhere.

Life in L. Romana can be harsh – electricity is scarce (if available at all), running water is never potable, and the hurricanes that rip through the Caribbean typically hit this siD. of the island first. Despite these difficulties, Esperanza keeps a positive attituD. toward her business. After all, the extra profits from her business have allowed her to improve her home and proviD. comfort for her children. She hopes to continue reaching for the future by improving her family’s living conditions and expanding her business. Thank you for lending to Esperanza and the Cristo L. Solucion group!

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes, and slippers

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. He is 45 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gilbert owns and operates a boarding house, and provides these services to local community members. Gilbert has been engaged in his business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gilbert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. Gilbert is requesting his first loan from HSPFI.  This loan, for 5000 PHP, will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  Gilbert plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and serves low-income households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí, el señor Carlos L. con mucha dedicación se esfuerza para continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar por lo que tiene el deber de brindarle buenas condiciones de vida a sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar.

Es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha buscado la manera de cómo llevar el sustento a su hogar y para ello es importante destacar que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ganado ya que tiene experiencia en la crianza de animales y por estas razones cree que por medio de la actividad del ganado se beneficiará grandemente y mejorará las condiciones de vida de  su familia.
texts.en:
In the Estelí district, Mr. Carlos L., with a lot of dedication, is working hard to continue providing for his nuclear family. He feels he has the duty to offer a good quality of life to his two young, elementary-school-aged sons. He is a very hardworking person, who has always sought the means to provide sustenance to his household. For him it is very important to emphasize that he is seeking this loan to purchase cattle, since he has experience raising animals. Because of this experience, he believes that through the activity of raising cattle he will successfully earn a great profit and will be able to improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Francys Danelia

texts.es: Francys Danelia vive en Nueva Guinea, es madre soltera de  una bebita de 4 añitos de edad, su mama la apoya con el cuido de la niña puesto que Francys tiene que viajar a una comarca a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de esa comunidad, a pesar que no tiene la ayuda del papa de su hijo ella es una mujer muy responsable con su obligacion de madre, está solicitando su primer credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda,  se caracteriza por ser honesta, trabajadora, de buenas costumbres, sociable y  muy responsable en su centro de trabajo y en sus compromisos adquiridos, su sueño es ir invirtiendo poco a poco en la casa y así gozar de mejores condiciones, que su tenga salud y    no le falte nada y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Francys Danelia, lives in Nueva Guinea. She is a single mother of a four-year-old little girl. Her mother helps her care for her daughter because Francys travels to another district to teach the children of agricultural workers in the area. Despite not getting any support from her child's father, she is a very responsible parent. She is seeking her first loan to invest in home improvements. She is honest, hard-working, of good habits, sociable, and very responsible within her working environment and with her acquired obligations. Her dream is to invest in her home, bit by bit, so as to enjoy better living conditions, to have good health, to lack nothing, and to have work stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en: L. Dolgor is 46 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a wooden house in the Arkhangai province of central Mongolia. Her two oldest children, 21 and 19, both attend college. The rest of the children attend a local high school. Dolgor and her husband run a dairy retail business in a rented stand in the local market. They began this business in 1998 and through the years, they have learned how to be successful in their field. When the business first started, their working capital was 40,000 tugrugs. However, after 12 years of hard work, their working capital has grown to 3,600,000 tugrugs. Because of the success of the business, Dolgor has been able to renovate her home and purchase an automobile to add to the comfort of her family. She says, "I couldn't find a job during the country's market transition, so we started this business. As a result, my family is living well and I'm satisfied." Dolgor is requesting a 3,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase different wholesale dairy products that she can sell for a profit at her stand.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale dairy products

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 44-year-old and married with 3 young children. He has owned a car repair shop in his town for the past 20 years. He is specialized in repairing all type of cars and is well known in the whole region. Thanks to his business, he was able over the years to take care of his family and better his life situation. With the help of the loan he requested for $1,200, Hussein plans to enlarge his business by buying badly needed spare parts.

loans.use: To buy badly needed spare parts.

loans.name: Jefferson Stalyn

texts.es:
Jefferson Camposano de 26 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene un hijo de 4 años.

Jefferson empezó trabajando en el carro de su papa como taxista ambulante, cuando reunió dinero se compro su propio carro.

Ahora el trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00 trabajando como taxista ambulantes en Guayaquil. También realiza la actividad de mecánico para tener otro ingreso extra para su familia. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, arena y piedras para poder construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere tener su propia cooperativa de taxis.
texts.en:
Jefferson Camposano, 26, lives on the outskirts of the Ecuadorean city of Guayaquil. He owns his own house with access to all the basic services. His wife runs the family home and cares for their 4-year old son. Jefferson has been working as a cab driver, driving a car owned by his father. When he has enough money, he will buy his own car. For now, he works the streets and avenues of Guayaquil from 7:00 in the morning to 10:00 at night. He also works as a mechanic in order to make extra income to support his family. The biggest problem he faces is crime. Jefferson will use the loan to buy cement, sand and stone so that he can make improvements to his house. In the future, he wants to own his own taxi business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Tarcisia

texts.en:
Tarcisia O., 60, is making sure that she works not just for herself but to help others as well. She has been selling vegetables, fish, and meat in the market for three years. 

Tarcisia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow seven times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows as added working capital for her business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 8,600 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business, allowing her to buy more vegetables, fish, and meat.

She prays for good health and that her business will grow so that she can continue to help other relatives who are depending on her for assistance. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more vegetables, fish, and meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finance his farming business

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky O., from the village of Luyong Bonbon, Opol Misamis Oriental. is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky owns and operates a business venture selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vicky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, Vicky is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amirsho

texts.en: Amirsho is 43 years old. He is married and the father of eight children. He owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue it generates. He is also a farmer. Amirsho is requesting a loan of 2,300 US dollars to increase his stock and to buy necessary substances for his farming business. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of Amirsho’s dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, which he is doing his best to provide for. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell and supplies for his farm

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivorn E. (pictured here), age 58, is a widow with two children. One of her sons is a construction worker. She lives with her sister and elderly mother in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. 

Sivorn has been operating a business cutting grass to sell for cow feed since she was young. Also she is a rice and vegetable farmer. She hopes to continue increasing her productivity, so she is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito E. is from the village of San Jose. He is 56 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Carlito owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty-eight years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP during harvest season. In 2006, Carlito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Carlito is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his eighth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Susy Mercedes

texts.es:
Susy es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Las Brisas y sus prestamos obtenidos hasta el momento le ayudaron mucho en su negocio. 
Susy es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, estudio Administración Hotelera y su mayor sueño es tener su empresa de juegos infantiles. Susy tiene juegos infantiles que alquila, su negocio se ubica los fines de semana en un parque de la ciudad en donde alquila sus juegos. Susy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pelotas. Susy tiene proyectado abrir una tienda u otro negocio mas estable.
texts.en:
Susy is the president of the Las Brisas communal Bank, and the loans she has received so far have helped her immensely in her business. She is married and she has three children, and she is studying hotel administration. Her biggest dream is to have a children's sports equipment company. She has children's toys that she rents. Her business is setup in a park in the city on weekends, where she rents her equipment. Susy needs a loan of 2,000 Soles which she will invest in the purchase of more balls. Her plan is to open a store, or some other business which is more stable

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of balls

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 41 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y jovial, comparte su vida Con su hijo de 19 años y del cual viven juntos en una casa que le fue heredada por su madre. El trabajo al que se dedica Teresa, es la venta de joyas en fantasía fina.  Conoce bien su trabajo, puesto que sabe sobre el mantenimiento y el cuidado que debe darles, es así que toda mercancía como: aretes, anillos y collares los guarda en franelas, de esa manera evita el deterioro de estas joyas. Sus principales clientes son sus compañeras de trabajo y las adolescentes de los centros de estudios, donde suele ir a ofrecer. Anteriormente vendía estas joyas mediante catálogos, pero no le resultó, desde entonces los lleva consigo para que sus clientes no duden en seleccionar y comprar su mercancía.  Le gusta su labor y la modalidad de sus ventas, además es muy precavida para evitar que sea asaltada. Lleva 5 años en este trabajo y su mayor anhelo es aumentar la cantidad de joyas que posee actualmente, así como ampliar su negocio vendiendo cosméticos. Este es su dieciochoavo crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas como lo estuvo haciendo con los demás préstamo, puesto que sabe que es de mucha utilidad para el incremento de su capital. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará cosméticos de belleza, puesto que le es más rentable, además pueda aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que vende y poder cumplir con los diversos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Teresa is 41 and a hard-working and cheerful mother who lives with her 19 year-old son in a house inherited from her mother. She sells high-quality costume jewelry. She know her work well, especially how to care for the jewelry. She sells items such as earrings, rings, and necklaces that she wraps in flannel and thus avoids damage to the stones. Her main customers are people she works with and teens from the schools where she used to go to sell. In the past she sold the jewelry through catalogs but that wasn’t profitable. From that time on she has been selling by taking the items with her so that her customers always select and buy her merchandise. She likes to sell this way and it’s prudent since this is how she can avoid being robbed. She has worked like this for the past 5 years and her main goal is to increase the quantity of gems that she currently has and to grow her business by selling cosmetics. This is her eighteenth loan with MFP and she promises to make all the payments as she has done with the past loans. She knows the loans are very important to increase her capital. With this loan that she is requesting she will buy cosmetics, since they are the most profitable. She will also be able to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells and fill all the different orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Millicent Anyango

texts.en: Millicent Anyango O. is 27 year old, married and a proud mother of four children. She lives in Lwanyange. Owing to the diverse skills she acquired during her employment period in a beauty salon, she opted to start her own salon in the year 2010 in Malanga to enhance her self-dependency and sustainability. In her prior employment, she could not adequately satisfy her family needs. This venture requires her to buy stock from the supermarket and travel to Busia once a month for additional stock because it is cheaper there. Having been given insight by loan beneficiaries, she joined K-MET so that she could access a loan worth Ksh.10000 to enable her to achieve her life goal of owning a photocopier and a barbershop.

loans.use: To boost and expand business

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

Kevin owns a restaurant in Kawempe selling traditional food and has been in this business for many years. She buys her foodstuffs from Kalerwe market and uses public transport to and from shopping. She sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale, working seven days a week. Her business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She doesn’t have any side business.

Kevin wants to use this loan to buy a deep freezer. She is aspiring to educate her children up to university. She decided to work with MCDT because of its low interest rate.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer

loans.name: 060117-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Thao N. T. (83) is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Thao is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 060117 - Hoang Chau - Hoang Hoa (060117 - hoang chau - hoang hoa). Thao is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Thao operates a family member's fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Thao has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,079,800 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from it. Thao joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thao has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to raise. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thao plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Nha (81) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 2. T. T. Thiet (41) is a 58-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 3. C. T. Dan (110) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thao N. T. (83) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang hoa. Thao là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 060117 - hoang chau - hoang hoa (060117 - hoang chau - hoang hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá nuôi tại nông trại trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thao thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thao kiếm được khoảng 3,079,800 VND. Thao đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thao đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua cá bổ sung để nuôi. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Nha (81) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 2. T. T. Thiet (41) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 3. C. T. Dan (110) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
M. Mashhura is 33 years old. Mashhura is running a beauty salon. In the salon she is providing the various services of hair styling, hair cutting, manicure, and the services of cosmetologist. The salon is rather successful and generates stable income for the family. Now Mashhura is planning to remodel her salon and for this purpose she requests 1200 US Dollars. Mashhura thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Remodeling her beauty salon

loans.name: Gantuul

texts.en:
Gantuul G. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 9-year-old daughter in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her daughter, Hongorzul, attends a local kindergarten while her husband, Batzorig, is a driver and operates a transportation service using his mini-truck in their town. He transports a variety of groceries and construction products during summer months and coal and firewood in the winter months.

Gantuul sells a variety of clothing items in a rented stall at the local market. She started her clothing business in 2008 and has built a stable operation. Her business is located in a popular spot in the market and her customer base includes residents of her province.

Gantuul’s and her husband's earnings together have enabled them to build a new fence around their house and garage. Gantuul is a hardworking, honest and helpful woman who says: "I am proud of my business; it's nice to see the satisfaction of my customers after they purchase my clothes; therefore, my business provides positive energy to my customers."

Gantuul is requesting a 2,375,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes and uniforms for starting the new academic year.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and uniforms

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 35-year-old mother of two who lives with her partner and elder son in the province of Limón, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. 

The loan consultant who has been working with Rosa has described her as a hardworking entrepreneur who makes punctual repayments. Rosa has proven herself to be a responsible client over the course of her first loan. This will be her second loan with Fundación Mujer. 

Rosa has a sewing business. The money she generates from her productive activity complements the salary earned by her partner, who works for a multinational banana producing company in the region. Rosa´s clients are mainly neighbours, acquaintances, family and friends who live in her community. She produces underwear, bathing suits and performs custom alterations.

Rosa plans to use this loan to invest in a new sewing machine as well as sewing materials (thread, fabric, elastic etc.). With an increase in working capital, Rosa is confident she will be able to expand her business and gain the ability to better satisfy the needs of her clients. Her goal is to increase the revenue from her sewing business in order to make a more significant contribution to family income. 

Every day, Rosa wakes up early to start sewing before she prepares breakfast and cleans the house. She does the majority of her sewing in the afternoons, and when she is extremely busy, Rosa hires somebody to help her.

loans.use: For the purchase of a sewing machine and sewing materials (elastic, fabric, thread)

loans.name: Rutabo Twimukye, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
G. Didas, aged 42, is a gentle, hard working married father of 4 children. He has been operating a transport business for over two years where he rides a motorcycle as the most common and accessible means for transport for locals in the area. He reveals that he earns 50,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis and that has helped him in undertaking the family responsibilities like educating his children and making other provisions.

As he plans on buying another motorcycle to expand his business, he hopes this loan will be of great assistance in implementing the above mentioned plan. Didas belongs to the Rutabo Twimukye group of members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: Purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a boutique selling Khanga's (a cotton wrapper worn by East African women), trousers and blouses for resale. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of transportation. High cost is incurred when transporting clothes from the market to her boutique. Salama hopes to open another boutique in town in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase more Khanga's, trousers and blouses for resale. Salama decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase Khanga's, trousers and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 47-year-old dairy farmer. Her business is in Kiambu. She has been running this business since 1999. 

She has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a dairy cow. This loan has been guaranteed by Jirani Mwema SHG. Elizabeth is married and is a mother to two young adults who are in school. She also supplies timber to earn extra income. 

Elizabeth describes herself as hard-working and business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: No

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. No S., 55 years old, who lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Mrs. No S. is a housewife and most of her time is spent working in her house, fulfilling her duties of caring for the children, cooking, and other duties.

She has a life partner with her husband, who is on staff in the state sector, and has a proper salary every month. This couple has eight children, two of whom are single, and six of whom are married. Besides working in the house, Mrs. No S. also plants rice crops, which is her annual business. Mrs. No S. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
Banco D. emprendimiento antiguo  que se encuentra en su octavo ciclo, integrado por 11 integrantes los cuales todos viven en la Localidad D. la guardia  pero en distintas zonas. 

El Presidente el Sr. Luis  D.  22 años D. edad , vive en la localidad  D. la guardia hace 16 años. Su Actividad es la D. encargado D. almacén en un laboratorio muy conocido D. la ciudad desD. hace 2 años, su  Estado civil es soltero y no cuenta con ningún hijo por el momento pero desea en un futuro tener una familia, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra D. muebles para su casa, ya que en estas fiestas D. fin D. año desea renovar sus muebles. 

La Secretaria la Sra. Deisy D. edad 38 años, su negocio es la  venta D. comida y cosméticos  en la zona D. la guardia hace 5 años, alterna con estas dos actividades para poder tener un ingreso mas. Su Estado civil concubina  con el señor Miguel su actividad chofer moto taxista en la zona D. la guardia, la Sra. tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración D. sus ricos platos.

Los clientes se sienten muy agradecidos con la entidad financiera por depositarles la confianza a sus personas. Y haberles abierto las puertas cuando ellos más lo necesitaban.
texts.en:
This long-standing development bank is in its eighth cycle.  It is maD. up of 11 members who all live in different parts of the La Guardia area.

The President, Luis, is 22 years old, and has lived in the town of La Guardia for 16 years. He has been a warehouse manager at a well-known laboratory in the city for the last 2 years.  He is single and has no children at the moment, but he would like to have a family in the future.  He will use the money from the loan to buy furniture for his house, since he would like to have new furniture for New Year's festivities.

The Secretary, Deisy, is 38 years old and has lived in the area for 5 years.  For the past 5 years, her business has been selling food and cosmetics in the La Guardia area. She has both businesses in order to earn more income. She lives with her partner Miguel, who is a motorcycle taxi driver in the La Guardia area.  They have 3 school-age children.  With the money from the loan, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her delicious meals.

The members are very grateful to the financial institution for having confidence in them, and for having opened doors for them when they most needed it.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with one daughter. He and his family live in Melitopol. Alexander runs a small business selling warm, colorful blankets, pillows and bed sheets.  He has been in this trade for 7 years and his business has proven to be competitive in this commercial sector. 

Alexander has an enterprising spirit. The success he has achieved is a direct result of his hard work and commitment to his business. Alexander would like to receive a loan of 15,000 Grivnas to increase his assortment of merchandise so that he can provide more items and better service to his customers.

loans.use: To increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 36 year old man who has been manufacturing kitchen cabinets since 2004.  Eyad’s warehouse is well known in the region and most of his clients recommend him.  Eyad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to expand his business by buying extra wood for client projects.  

His clients can be contractors or any person who needs to renew his kitchen.  Eyad is a man with a good reputation.  He is well known in the region and most of his clients are loyal to him.  Eyad looks forward to expand his sawmill to a more advance and improved one.

loans.use: To buy extra wood for client kitchen cabinet projects.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia tiene 53 años es madre soltera con  3 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan de manera independiente. Ella se dedica a una abarrotería en su casa de habitación, Allí vende desde granos básicos hasta golosinas para llamar la atención de los clientes que habitan cerca. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos para su negocio. Ella ya tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó vendiendo solamente golosinas, y con el aporte de su esposo más la reinversión realizada al negocio ha podido ir prosperando para tener un negocio más grande. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de arroz, fríjol, azúcar y aceite principalmente. Su sueño es llegar a ver su negocio con más productos, más surtido con productos que demanda la población, para brindar más facilidades económicas.
texts.en: Mrs. Julia is 53 years old and the single mother of 3 adult children who work independently.  She has a grocery store in one of the rooms of her house.  There she sells staple food and even sweets to attract the attention of customers in her neighborhood.  This is the first time she is applying for a loan for her business.  She has been working for seven years and started out selling only sweets.  With what her husband gave her and by reinvesting the money from her business she has been able to expand her activity.  This loan will be used to buy rice, beans, sugar and oil.  Her dream is to have a much larger inventory and better prices to meet the public demand.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Chann S. is a 27-year-old married man who lives in the province of Siem Reap.  He has two young children who are pupils in the local primary school. 

Chann S. is a recycling seller. He buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electricity wires, cans and plastics. His wife assists him with his business activities. 

Chann S. is applying for a loan to use as capital to buy used goods for selling. This loan will assist him to increase his daily income.

loans.use: To buy used goods for selling

loans.name: Reinaldo De Jesús

texts.es:
Superación, innovación y compromiso son las palabras que describen a Reinaldo de Jesús P. M., quien después de quedarse desempleado, vio en la venta de comestibles una oportunidad para superar la dificultad económica por la que atravesaba. 

Con la ayuda de sus esposa y con la esperanza de salir adelante y superar las dificultades, Reinaldo inició su negocio que poco a poco ha ido mejorando gracias a su gran esfuerzo. 

En su carrito de comidas, Reinaldo vende papitas fritas, platanitos, papas criollas, entre otros productos apetecidos por sus clientes. Su trabajo se extiende hasta las 10:00 ó 12:00 de la noche puesto que tal y como lo afirma es a esas horas cuando se incrementan las ventas. 

Actualmente, Reinaldo necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones en su carrito de ventas con el fin de ofrecer sus productos frescos y calientes sin tener que volver a reprocesarlos.
texts.en:
