Self-improvement, innovation, and commitment are the words that describe Reinaldo de Jesús P. M. who, after becoming unemployed, saw the business of food sales as an opportunity to overcome the financial difficulty he had been going through.  

Hoping to get ahead and overcome financial difficulties, Reinaldo started this business with his wife’s help.  The business has been gradually improving thanks to his hard work.  

At his food cart, Reinaldo sells French fries, bananas, “papas criollas” (small yellow potatoes), and other products his customers crave.  He works until 10:00 or 12:00 at night because, as he says, this is when sales increase.

Currently, Reinaldo needs a loan to make some adaptations to his food cart so that he can offer his products fresh and hot without having to reprocess them.

loans.use: To up-grade food cart.

loans.name: Mr. Kang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kang, who was born in 1955, is a village bank president. He has been selected by the eleven members who make up a village bank loan. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families to a higher standard of living. 

Mr. Kang is a vegetable seller in local market where he can earn some income to support his family. Currently, he wants to expand because his business is doing well. S. to improve this purpose, Mr. Kang is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables for resale. His wife, Mrs. Nam, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow both rice and vegetables to sell to support her family. They support three children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, the youngest one is studying in local public school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S., 29, resides in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for high quality rice products. S. sells fruit, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3.25 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike to transport fruit to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fruit to sell.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 62 years old.  She is married and has 6 children.  

Benita works hard to provide for her family.   She has a general store in the Philippines and has been running it for 20 years.  She also earns additional income from retailing rice.

Benita has requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.  She has borrowed and successfully repaid 18 previous loans from NWTF.

Benita aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine Kasajja lives in the Kisaasi neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Christine has a business of selling in a pub.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Christine sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail.  Christine has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will be used to buy more jerycans of local Gin and beer.  The main business challenge(s) for Christine include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar.  Christine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more jerycans of local Gin and more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Claudia  Janeth

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia es una persona muy  emprendedora , requiere el préstamo porque desea comprar  mercancía  para su  negocio  ya  que  actualmente  se  dedica  a la  venta de  ropa  usada,  su mayor  preocupación es brindarles  un  excelente servicio  a  sus clientes, agradece  el  apoyo   brindado para   realizar  su  proyecto  ya  que   ve  en el  crédito la  posibilidad  de  ofrecerles a  sus  pequeños  hijos una  excelente  estabilidad  económica.
texts.en: Mrs. Claudia is a hardworking person. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her business. She sells used clothes. Her greatest concern is providing her customers with good service. She appreciates her customer’s support of her business. With this loan she has the opportunity to offer her small children stable economic support.

loans.use: to buy used clothes that she sells.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace cooks rice for sale at Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast. Grace has been selling rice for four years and wants to increase her sales, as sometimes the food gets finished too quickly. She needs a loan to buy more bags of rice and ingredients to cook food for sale. Her profit will be reinvested back into her business. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a timber contractor.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice and ingredients to cook food for sale.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El Sr Ronald esta casado con la  Sra. Jovana se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa usada desde hace tres años de feria en feria y son asociados con puesto propio,  Tienen una hija de ocho años que se encuentran en edad escolar, la pareja viven  en casa de los padres de Don Ronald.  Don Ronald tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su domicilio donde reacondiciona la ropa usada y las vende mas cara que su competencia con el dinero del crédito comprara una maquina de coser para realizar estos arreglos a las ropa y la Sra. Jovana vende también simultáneamente  a la venta de refresco de mocohinchi (durazno seco) y el somó(refresco de maíz)  y ambos salen a vender juntos en las ferias, el Sr. Ronald es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. En la foto el Sr. Ronald esta con su esposa la Sra.Jovana.
texts.en:
Ronald is married to Jovana. His business is selling used clothing. He has done it for the last three years, going from fair  to fair. They work as partners and have their own stall. They have an eight year old daughter who is of school age. The couple lives with Ronald's parents. Ronald has a small sewing workshop in his home, where he mends used clothing and sells them at a higher price than his competition. 

With the money from the loan he will buy a sewing machine to make these alterations. Jovana also sells mocohinchi (drink made with dried apricots) and somo (corn drink). They both sell together at fairs. Ronald is a very hard workign person, very grateful to the organisation for the support received. The picture shows Ronald with his wife Jovana.

loans.use: to buy a 5-thread industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 33 years old. He is married and a father of three children. He has been in farming for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, which he is planning to use to buy farm inputs. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his grandchildren.

His hope and dream is to educate his grandchildren. He is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like manure, seedlings and insecticides.

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: Gladys Maria es una Madre de familia que tiene 44 años y vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Se dedica desde hace más de 10 años a ofrecer el servicio de fotocopiadora,  la ubicación del negocio es enfrente de la policía, ya que en ese sector no había este servicio, fue así que decide incursionar en este negocio.  Desea ampliar su negocio para captar más clientes y así poder percibir más ingresos que le permitan salir adelante. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de hojas, tinta y poder comprar otra fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Gladys Maria is a 44-year-old mother who lives together with her husband and her three minor children under her care. 

She has made a living for more than 10 years offering photocopying services. The business is located in front of the police. As this area did not have this service before, she decided to start this business. 

She hopes to expand her business to acquire more customers and therefore be able to receive a better income that will allow her to get ahead. This is why she is requesting this loan to purchase paper and ink and to be able to buy another photocopier.

loans.use: to purchase paper and ink and be able to buy another photocopier.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Leonisa has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & bread.

Leonisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Leonisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & bread

loans.name: Binnat

texts.ru:
Binnat yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselencem iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Binnat 58 let. 
On uje 13 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnix produktov. Binnat prodayot molochniye produkti v magazini. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi.
texts.en:
Binnat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  He is married and has four children. Binnat is 58 years old.
 
He has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for thirteen years already.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase milk production. Binnat sells dairy products in stores. He started this business with his uncle.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en: Beatrice is a 32-year-old married woman with four children living in her own home in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to construct a commercial house and educate her children up to university. She a vendor of fresh foods and has been in this business for six years. Her constraint is lack of refrigerating facilities since most of her goods are perishables, and her dream is to buy a fridge and also to purchase at least 10 crates of tomatoes per month. Beatrice needs the loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita has been a widow for almost 20 years. It is a big responsibility to be the head of the family. She is engage in her sari-sari store where she sells snack foods, batteries, candies and biscuits. Warlita said that it is not easy to be the breadwinner of the family but is doing her best to feed her children. She is happy because her grown-up children now have their own families. Warlita is getting older and wants to maintain and develop her business for a continued source of income. She decided to request a loan of P15,000 to purchase soft drinks, beer, vinegar and soy sauce to sell. She will use the loan wisely for the growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, vinegar and soy sauce to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 50 años vive al suroccidente de la ciudad con su esposa y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 19 a 36 años. Allí en su barrio se dedica a la venta de mercancías por pedidos y al alquiler de apartamentos.  Desde el año 1980 compró el lote donde vive, mediante el trueque de muebles de sala, construyeron una habitación para vivir y  comenzó su negocio de vender cercanías para el hogar entre sus familiares y amigos. . Desde allí su negocio ha crecido y hoy está entusiasmando en lograr mejor desempeño de él, pues su meta es trabajar y ganar dinero para mas adelante construir un segundo piso, con el fin de que sus hijos tengan su propia vivienda y  estén  siempre cera de su familia. Su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo porque se torna insuficiente para responder a la demanda de su mercado, especialmente en épocas especiales como las que se avecinas, en la cual hay repunte de ventas por celebrarse en todo el mes el día del amor y de la amistad. Este es justamente el propósito de su credikiva con el cual comprará ropa para damas caballeros e infantil, que tiene encargada en su mismo sector de ventas. Mientras Juan trabaja para alcanzar sus propósitos, maneja un margen de utilidad no menor al 36% y no posee endeudamiento y desde estos indicadores financieros proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos éxitos en su inversión actual.
texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old and lives to the southwest of the city with his wife. They have four children between the ages of 19 and 36. In his neighborhood, Juan sells merchandise upon request and rents out apartments. In 1980, he bought the lot where he now lives. After bartering for living room furniture, he built a house where he could live and began his retail business selling to relatives and friends. His business has grown since that time and today Juan is excited to achieve better returns. Juan’s goal is to work and to earn money so that he can build a second floor in the future that will enable his family to always be near. His greatest challenge is not having enough operating capital to meet the demands of the market, especially during the upcoming special events. There is usually a spike in sales during the month when the Day of Love and Friendship (the Colombian version of Valentine’s Day) takes place. For this reason, Juan will use his Kiva loan to buy clothing for women, men, and infants to fulfill outstanding orders he has received in his neighborhood.

In the meantime, Juan works so that he can achieve his goals. He maintains a profit margin of no less than 36% and has no debt. These financial indicators signal his potential for growth and a successful result from his current investment.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for women, men, and infants so that he can fulfill his outstanding orders.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old, married to Nderitu, who is a businessman, and together they have one child. She runs a grocery that gives her a monthly income of 36,000 Kenyan shillings. She has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her first loan from KADET, which she plans to use to add stock to her business. She plans to establish a well stocked charcoal store with the anticipated profit from the business. Her dreams and hopes are to ensure her business is stable; thus, her family will have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Reviwew-Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been operating a salon and selling hair products in Kariombangi. She is 24 years old and the single mother of two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the amount borrowed to diversify more into hair products and beauty products.

In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business and increase her income to fully meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to diversify more into hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Allyssa

texts.en:
Allyssa is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Allyssa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Allyssa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Allyssa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Justina tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera y aun no tiene hijos, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de buzos para niños de 3, 4, 5 años de edad. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. En esta oportunidad Justina requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo tela. Justina es una persona trabajadora que también estudia en un instituto superior la carrera técnica de computación e informática. Su sueño de la Justina es estudiar la carrera profesional de educación inicial. 

Justina agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Justina belongs to the "San Isidro de Compone" communal bank. Every 30 days, meetings are held in the city of Izcuchaca in the Compone community. 

Justina is 21 years old, single, and has no children. She was born in the city of Cusco and still lives and does business there, producing jumpers for children ages 3 to 5. She's been in business for two years already and it's going very well for her thanks to the determined effort she puts into the work. 
At the moment, Justina needs this loan to buy more merchandise, such as cloth. Justina is a hard-working person who also attends the Instituto Superior studying computer and information science.  

Justina's dream is to earn a professional degree in early childhood education. She is thankful for and appreciates this loan and is committed to meeting her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as cloth.

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es: Norlan se dedica a se dedica a brindar los servicios carpintería, hace mas de 7 años que tiene de poseer este medio de vida.  Él aprendió este oficio por un amigo que juntos decidieron establecer un taller, fue así que juntos decidieron sacar adelante a sus familia, con mucho esfuerzo Norlan compro un triciclo que lo alquila y también le genera ganancias a su hogar. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar madera, clavos, maque, pega, martillo entre otros, de esa forma podrá crecer su negocio y tendrá más clientela para ofrecer la diversidad de productos.
texts.en: Norlan has been providing carpentry services; he’s had this means of support for over seven years.  He learned the business with a friend and they decided to open a shop together.  This is how they decided together to support their families.  With much effort Norlan bought a three-wheeled cart that he leases out and it also generates family income.  He needs the loan to buy lumber, nails, varnish, glue and a hammer, among others in order to make his business grow and have more customers because he can offer a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy lumber, nails, varnish, glue and a hammer, among others.

loans.name: Valentine Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Valentine Group in Western Kenya! Eunice takes care of nine children at home. In the recent 2011 season, Eunice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on one acre of land. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. With income from maize sales, Eunice will educate her children and invest in business.

Eunice is the facilitator of the Valentine Group. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. Like the majority of people in this part of Kenya, the members of Valentine Group are farmers who rely on maize production for annual food security and income. In 2012, the members of Valentine Group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 36 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Esther has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. He owns a retail shop which has been in operation for the last five years. He is married and has three children; one is still in school. 
Mohamed was introduced to Milango by his friends. He decided to join in order to access credit. He is currently applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase more retail stock for his shop, e.g. sugar, salt, flour etc. Mohamed also owns a taxi; car hire transport.
His main challenge is the overall inflation in the country which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. He is looking forward to owning a three wheeler vehicle commonly called a tuktuk. Mohamed will use the additional income obtained from this loan to meet his family’s daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase more retail stock for his shop e.g. sugar, salt, flour etc.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Mikolola Group

texts.en:
Malysiana is a 60-year-old married woman with three children. She has been doing well in growing maize, coffee and beans for over 11 years. She is working hard to overcome agricultural problems such as lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. 

Malysiana spends most of her time to find working capital that can help her to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. She has an opportunity to boost her scale of production from 5 to 13 acres in the next five years. Also, by improving her farming activities, she can generate income that can be used to buy clothes, cover medical expenses, and repair her family house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Iván, de 25 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y servicial. Convive con Diana quien es ama de casa. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de su padre, madre, pareja y su hijo de 2 años de edad. La actividad que realiza Iván es la agricultura para eso cuenta con un terreno de 9 hectáreas de extensión, pero solo con 2 y ½ de hectárea de papaya en producción. Tiene 12 años realizando esta actividad y actualmente cuenta con la ayuda de 5 peones a quien paga por día trabajado 20 nuevos soles. Él saca su producto a la venta a los mercados de la capital contando con una gran demanda del producto. Le gusta la vida de campo pues se siente cómodo, ya que aprendió de sus padres, y escogió éste oficio por la buena rentabilidad que tiene debido la demanda de este producto. Por lo contario, comenta que le incomoda el clima caluroso, pues lo fatiga bastante al realizar los trabajos de campo. Pero sabe que con esfuerzo y dedicación se sale adelante y se consigue lo que se desea, y viendo la buena rentabilidad que tiene desea ampliar la extensión de sus sembrios de papaya. Por otro lado espera terminar sus estudios de operador de maquinaria pesada. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, está contenta de contar con una línea de crediticia para avanzar con su actividad, por eso se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá comprando más semillas de papaya, asimismo contratará peones para que lo ayuden en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ivan, who is 25 years old, is a hard-working and obliging man. He lives with his partner Diana, who is a housewife. Together they live in their own house along with his father, his mother, and their son, who is two years old. Ivan's work is agriculture. He has a 9-hectare plot of land but with only 2 1/2 hectares of papaya in production. He has been doing this work for 12 years, and now he has the help of five workers, whom he pays 20 PEN for a day of work. He takes his products to sell at the markets in the capital, counting on the great demand for this product. He likes life in the country, since he feels comfortable there and since he learned this work from his parents and chose it for its good profitability, which it has thanks to the demand for this product. In contrast, he comments that the hot climate bothers him, since it makes him quite tired to do the work in the field. But he knows that with effort and dedication he will advance and achieve what he wants, and seeing the good profitability that it has, he wants to increase the extent of his papaya plantings. On the other hand, he hopes to finish his studies in operating heavy machinery. 

This will be his second loan with the MFP institution. He is happy to have a line of credit to advance with his work. For this reason he promises to make his payments. He will invest the 1500 PEN that he has applied for in buying more papaya seeds, as well as hiring workers to help him maintain his plantings.

loans.use: to buy papaya seeds and hire workers.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Jessica has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for 6,000 PhP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
I have been making and selling tortillas for five years. I have two schoole aged sons, who help me deliver tortillas to my clients after they return from school. My sales have increased and I have not been able to keep up because I do not have enough disposable income to buy more corn and firewood. I hope to increase our earnings and give us a better standard of living.

Loan Use: Purchase corn, firewood, lime.

Me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas, tengo cinco años de tener mis ventas. Tengo dos hijos en edad escolar y me ayudan a entrar a mis clientes sus tortillas despues que regresan de la escuela. Las ventas han aumentado y no he podido cubrir ya que no cuento con sufieciente capital de trabajo para comprar maiz y la leña. Espero poder obtener mas ingresos y que tengamos un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: Compra de Maiz, lena, cal.

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en: Qabil H. owns an Auto Painting shop in the town of Khachmaz located in the Northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Qabil is looking for funding so that he can invest in a new paint sprayer.

loans.use: To purchase a new paint sprayer

loans.name: Fiaava'e

texts.en: Fiaava'e is an old lady with six children. All of them are unemployed and do not have any financial means. Luckily, her husband is a very good fisherman and that is their only means of earning money to support the family. She started with a $750ST loan and now is on her fourth loan. She used the money to buy new fishing gear for her husband. The other rest of the money was used to build their new bathroom and pay her childrens’ school fees. She is very happy to be in the program and believes that the loans were a savior for her and her family.  They were able to provide for not only the business, but also their living condition but her kids’ fees.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing equipment and building materials for home improvement

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Mr. Tuy L. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and five children, who are students, in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He makes his living by purchasing charcoal from a far village, and resells them to retail outlets in his area. He can typically generate around $6 per day in income. His wife, meanwhile, stays at home looking after their children and cooking meals for her family. Therefore, Tuy L. plays an important role for his family and works very hard to meet the family’s expenses. Currently, he needs two cows instead of a car or motorbike to help him transport and sell his charcoal in this area. He would be grateful and appreciate any kind of help, which motivates him to go ahead.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to transport charcoal.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona is 33 years old and is married to Elpidio Alfonzo, with whom she has three children, two boys and a girl. She comes from a very humble family and had to work from a young age. She tells us that she's been fortunate to have made a home with a good man and that through their combined effort and hard work they have been able to open a small grocery store which has grown day by day. Due to a serious illness that befell her husband, and the many expenses it generated, they had to close their business due to a lack of working capital.

In spite of all these obstacles, Petrona was able to provide for her children and reopen her shop, which is their only means of support. In her store she sells quality products like milk, baked goods, sugar, flour, etc.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store so that she can continue to attract more customers and consequently keep her children in school.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Petrona G. de Alfonzo tiene 33 años esta casada con el señor Elpidio Alfonzo con quien tiene 3 hijos, dos varones y una nena. Petrona proviene de una familia muy humilde motivo por el cual desde muy joven tuvo que salir a trabajar, nos cuenta que tuvo la suerte de encontrar un buen hombre con quien ha formado un hogar y gracias al sacrificio y el esfuerzo de ambos pudieron abrir una pequeña despensa que dia a dia iba creciendo, hasta que una fuerte enfermedad que atacó al Sr. Elpidio tuvieron que cerrar el negocio por falta de capital operativo, ya que tenia muchos gastos. A pesar de todo Petrona con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar adelante a sus hijos, y volvio a reabrir su despensa, que es su actual medio de vida. En su despensa vende diferentes tipos de productos de primera necesidad como leche, panificados, azúcar, harina, etc. Solicita el credito para aumentar sus mercaderias para asi volver a surtir su negocio y de esta forma atraer mas clientes ya que ella quiere que sus hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, coffee, flour, sugar, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a small entrepreneur who owns a stationary shop in Dar es Salaam. She is married to Phines Kalema, who is retired from the civil service, and has five children ages 2, 10, 13, 15, and 17 years old. Leticia loves her job (it has been a dream to her when she decided to be an entrepreneur) and provides for her family. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a new computer set. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a new computer set

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Zunilda O. has three daughters; she works with one of them in the city market selling used clothing for men, women, and children.

She told us that thanks to the low prices of her clothing, it is in great demand. She buys the clothing in Brazil, and travels once or twice a month to bring back her merchandise.

She is requesting a loan that she will use to buy clothing for the summer season, including t-shirts, shorts, Bermudas, pants, skirts, jeans, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Zunilda O. tiene tres hijas, trabaja con una de ellas en el mercado municipal vendiendo ropas usadas para damas, caballeros y niños.

Nos cuenta que gracias al precio accesible de sus ropas ella posee gran demanda de los mismos. Las ropas las compra de Brasil y viaja una o dos veces al mes a traer sus mercaderías.

Ella solicita un crédito con el que podrá adquirir ropa, para esta temporada de verano, tales como remeras, shorts, bermudas, pantalones, faldas, jeans, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of used t-shirts, shorts, Bermudas, pants, skirts, jeans, etc, to sell in the summer season.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
I am Salma B. and my husband's name is Sohail Khalid. I have five children, three boys and two girls. My husband and one of my sons run a store where they sell cement and other construction materials. They have been in this business for a number of years, and we are applying for a loan to expand their business.

My loan group includes three other women. Salma I.’s son operates a lathe and requires a loan to expand his business. Nargis P. needs this loan for her husband’s shoe store. Sardaran B. needs loan for her son's business. I want all of these women to get loans so that they can improve their families’ incomes and lives.

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies we need to expand our businesses

loans.name: Begajeta

texts.en:
Begajeta was born in 1972 and she is divorced. She has a shop in which she sells a variety of products in Jaruške and she can earn 500KM monthly. She has one child who is 16 years old, and she receives alimony in the amount of 150 KM .

Begajeta wants to use this loan of 1000 KM to extend the range of goods available in her store. She hopes that she will improve living standards for herself and her son.

loans.use: For range extending.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly belongs to the Mujeres Santa Bárbara Communal Bank located at Jr Lima No. 138 in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 72 years old and is the mother of 12 children.

With the first loan Nelly received from Manuela Ramos she invested in her own soft drink business. Today she continues to sell soft drinks and opens her store in the mornings to serve her clients.

With this loan of $725, which she plans to repay within five months, she will buy a variety of soft drinks and other items to sell including rice, sugar, milk, soap, cooking oil and pastas.

Nelly is very happy and proud that her business has been growing little by little and that her sales have increased thanks to the effort she has made. She proves to us that there’s no age limit when it comes to working and succeeding in life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Jr Lima No 138, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 72 años y es madre de 12 hijos. Nelly con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertirlo en un negocio de venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad ella sigue con su mismo negocio de venta de gaseosas, abre su local por las mañanas para atender a sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará gaseosas surtidas en vidrio y descartables, abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, conservas, aceite, gaseosas, embutidos, fideos, etc. Nelly esta muy feliz y orgullosa de si misma, su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco y sus ventas aumentan gracias al esfuerzo que realiza para salir adelante y demostrar que no hay limites de edad para trabajar y triunfar en la vida.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods to sell

loans.name: Auralila Del Socorro

texts.es:
Auralila is asking for her third refinancing in order to invest in the purchase of construction materials to plaster her house located in zone 5 of New Guniea: she has worked as a secondary school teacher for the last nine years at the Rubén Darío institute. She has two sons, the elder is 17 years old and is in the fifth year of his secondary school studies, and her other son is fifteen years old and in the fourth year of his secondary school education.

This client is a single mother who has fought for her sons in order to give them all the necessities of life, both materially and spiritually: despite having no support from anyone else they are a united family, who share the daily household tasks. Auralila is an example to all women who fight for the well-being of their family, showing that being a single mother is not an obstacle to fighting for your dreams. Her main dream is to have a house with better living conditions, and stable employment in order to continue supporting her children.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Auralila esta solicitando su tercer refinanciamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción, para repellar la casa ubicada en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea se desempeña como docente de educación Secundaria labora desde hace 9 años como docente del Instituto Rubén Darío, tiene dos hijos, el mayor tiene 17 años de edad estudia 5to año de educación secundaria y el otro hijo tiene 15 años estudia 4to año de educación secundaria.

Esta clienta es madre soltera que ha luchado por sus hijos para darle todo lo necesario tanto en lo material como espiritual, a pesar que no tienen la ayuda de nadie son una familia unida, esta pequeña familia comparten los quehaceres del hogar, Auralila es un ejemplo para todas las mujeres que luchan por el bienestar de su familia ya que no es impedimento ser madre soltera para seguir luchando por sus sueños. Su principal sueño tener una casa con mejores condiciones y estabilidad laboral para seguir ayudando a sus hijos.

loans.use: Improve dwelling

loans.name: Busola

texts.en: Busola A. is a 31 years old and married. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She is a fashion designer who learned her skill over two years and started her business in 2007. She is requesting a loan of $450.00 to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S., 46, sells fish in her village and can earn about $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Uy Phorn, helps Mrs. Sokheourn to sell the fish. They have six children and live in Angkanh Village, Pursat Province. 

Mrs. Chan S. is requesting a loan of  $400 to purchase a motorcycle for business and family use. The loan will allow her to expand and improve her business, as well as improve her quality of life through better transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle
